Fatuma is a very hardworking person who has shown a great enthusiasm in moving forward. She has had several loans both from Yehu and Kiva. She is a faithful and honest person who can be entrusted with loans since she is responsible.

Fatuma says that since she started getting support in the form of loans her business has been gradually growing. This new loan will allow her expand her business and will enable her to buy ingredients like wheat flour, basic grains, cooking oils, vegetables, and meat. As a result, she will be able to continue to earn good income.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing ingredients such as wheat flour, basic grains, cooking oils. and vegetables

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 49-year-old, divorced mother of three grown children.

She is a tailor, who, over time and after gaining experience, opened her own workshop. What she started with trial and error has turned into a well-known business. However, she explains that she struggles every day to ensure that she has food on her table.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine. In the future, her goal is to expand her workshop and to buy more machines and provide jobs for other people.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 34-year-old, married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 16 years old, and her youngest is eight months old.

Her husband is her business partner, and they sell clothes together. She has been in this business for seven years.

She wants a loan to buy more skirts for sale. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans on feeding her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 36-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 12 years old, and her youngest is 7 years old.

Her husband is a motorist, while she is in the grocery business. She has been in this business for three years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more milk and soda for re-sale purposes. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to assist in building her home.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fresh milk and soda for sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a very hard-working young woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is married and lives with her husband and three children.
Amina has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. In addition, she also runs a food stall and thanks to her efforts, both businesses are doing great.

At present, Amina needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu, to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

She plans to open a retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Don José Habita en el barrio san Judas de Managua, tiene 50 años  de edad es soltero y sin hijos, su oficio es el de soldadura con su propio taller ubicado en su casa aproximadamente 12 años, con sus ingresos ayuda a sus padres, este es su primer crédito que solicita para infraestructura, ampliar el techado para poder hacer mejor su trabajo de soldadura con buena visibilidad y poderse tapar del sol y la lluvia para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, para eso necesita comprar laminas de zinc y perlines.
texts.en:
José Habita lives in the neighborhood of San Judas de Managua, is 50 years old, single, and has no children. He has worked as a welder in his own workshop, located in his home, for around 12 years. 

He uses his earnings to help his parents. This is the first loan that he is requesting for infrastructure. He wants to raise the roof of his workshop so that he can do a better job of welding, with good visibility and shelter from the sun and rain, and so that he can offer a good service to his customers. This is why he needs to buy zinc sheets and perlins.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and perlins.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en:
Emerance is a 33-year-old, married woman with two children. Her oldest child is ten years old, and her youngest is five.

For the past five years, she has been in the retail business. She is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to assist her in buying a home.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes and shoes for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Raheal

texts.en:
Raheal is a 53-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Zablom, and they are blessed with five children, the youngest of which is 12 years old.

Raheal has been selling groceries for the last three years, which enables her to earn a monthly income of approximately 6,600 KES.

She is now seeking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more vegetables and assorted fruits for re-sale purposes. She explains that she will use the anticipated profits from the loan proceeds to start another business. Her dream is to run a successful business and to educate her youngest child.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional vegetables and assorted fruits for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 29-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is ten yeas old, and her youngest is four months old.

Her husband sells clothes for a living. She has been in the same business for three years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more skirts, sweaters, and shirts. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will assist her in building a home.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional skirts, sweaters, and shirts for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has made a living operating a food stall for the past three years. This has helped her gain a lot of experience and loyal, daily customers who prefer her business to others. She is a woman known for being enterprising, responsible and very hard-working. She has very good personal references because customer satisfaction is a top priority for her.

Mwanajuma wants to expand her business and decided that the best way to do this was to request a loan from Yehu. She wants to use it to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare dishes, such as beans, rice, corn, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. In future she wants to improve her business location so she can increase her customer base and earnings. This will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare dishes, such as beans, rice, corn, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman and a mother to two children. For the past two years, she has been involved in food vending, selling door to door. She sells a variety of food including dumplings and other types of fast foods. She is asking for this loan to buy more ingredients to prepare more foods to sell. In the future, she plans to have a cafe so that she can have increased sales. Fatuma is a responsible person who assures us that she will be able to repay the loan as scheduled and at the same time provide financial security to her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare more foods to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has a four-year-old child who is already enrolled in school. With much hard work and dedication, she was able to open a small business selling paraffin. She has been in business for one year now. Amina sells her merchandise from her home.

With this business, Amina has been able to improve her home and to pay for her child's education. She is requesting this loan in order to buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 42 years old, married  and has four children ages 19  to  28. One child is attending school and two live at home. Her husband is a contractor. She and her husband and two of their children all live at Jacobs’ town (home), one of the areas in Montserrado County where it is cheap to live. She is a hard-working woman, selling used clothes six days a week in order to help her husband with the home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in her community, She makes lots of profit because people in her community do not have to go far to buy. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron  en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo ella habilito un bar en su casa de los préstamos que le otorgo, hoy día su negocio ha crecido debido al empeño que le puso. Su deseo es seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que el crédito le ha servido de mucho, para la apertura de su bar y para que sus hijos hayan podido terminar su colegio y siga una carrera.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su bar, como ser bebidas, verduras, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” [New Hope] Group was started through promotions in the neighborhood.  All of the members are acquaintances and neighbors from the same neighborhood.  Each member has the same objective, which is to work, to encourage the spirit of solidarity and to achieve the highest level of the program.

Petrona is the president of the group.  With previous loans she renovated her house to install a snack bar.  Since then her business has grown due to the effort and determination she has put into it.  Her wish is to continue working with the foundation, because with her previous loans she was able to open her snack bar and help her children finish secondary school and study in university.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her snack bar, such as drinks, greens, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and others.

loans.use: to buy drinks, greens, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items of jewellery and haberdashery for resale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 30-year-old, married woman with three children. Her oldest child is eight years old, and her youngest is three. Her husband is a security guard.

She has been in the clothing sales business for eight months. She wants a loan to buy more fabric for altering. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fabric for altering.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu has been operating a food stall for the last three years. She lives with her family, which consists of her husband and her seven children.

Her business is located in a busy trading center, which is patronized by a lot of people and is where competition is fierce. Mariamu has a lot of customers, though, who eat her food every day, especially on the weekends, because of the delicious flavors of her African dishes.

She is now requesting a loan to have the necessary capital to buy large quantities of ingredients, such as sugar, rice, beans, vegetables, and flour.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing large quantities of ingredients such as sugar, rice, beans, vegetables, and flour.

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 54 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos; todos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de leche, compra 30 botellas de leche diariamente. Todos los días sale a venderla y tiene que caminar ocho kilómetros para ganar unos $5.00 dolores diarios; por que compra la leche para revenderla. La venta es casa por casa, ya tiene sus clientes, su esposo la motiva para que busque financiamiento y poder satisfacer a sus clientes con los pedidos de queso, requesón, etc.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para producir leche en la época lluviosa. Sus dos hijos varones se encargaran del cuido de ellas. De esta manera, tendrá más leche para vender y le quedara más ganancia por que ella misma la producirá. Además, de mantener ocupados a sus hijos, ya que en la zona en donde viven no hay mucha posibilidad de obtener un empleo. También, obtendrá mejores ingresos que le permitan ayudar a sus hijos y a su papá que tiene 87 años de edad, que por su edad ya no puede trabajar y debido a un enfermedad esta en sillas de ruedas, por lo que necesita un cuidado especial. En un futuro, ella pretende producir toda la leche y no tener que comprar a otras personas, poseer más ganado. Ella comenta que en estos años atrás, su esposo no ayudaba en mucho para los gastos del hogar, solo gastaba en el alcohol; pero hoy ha recapacitado y desea trabajar junto a ella y comenta que nunca es tarde para comenzar.
texts.en:
Blanca is 54 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children, all of whom are older. She sells milk for a living. Every day she buys 30 bottles of milk and then leaves to resell it; she has to walk 8 kilometers daily in order to earn about $5.00 through this buying and reselling of milk. She sells door-to-door. Now that she has customers, her spouse is motivating her to seek funding to be able to satisfy her customers' demand for cheese, cottage cheese, etc. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is for the purchase of two dairy cows to produce milk during the rainy season. Her two sons will be responsible for caring for them. Therefore, she will have more milk to sell and she can keep more of her income because she will be making her own product. In addition, it will keep her children busy, since in the area where they live, there is not much of a possibility of becoming employed. Also, she will yield a better income which will allow her to help her children. It will also allow her to help her father, who is 87 years old, can no longer work, and due to an illness, is in a wheelchair; therefore, he needs special care. 

In the future, she hopes to produce all of her milk, not having to buy it from any one, and to own more cows. She says that years ago her spouse didn't help very much with home expenses, only spending money on alcohol; however, nowadays he has reconsidered, and he wants to work together with her and says that it's never too late to start.

loans.use: to buy to dairy cows.

loans.name: Jessica Maribel

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer joven de 21 años, se convirtió en madre soltera sin cumplir su mayoría de edad, lo cual ha sido el mayor obstáculo que ha tenido, pues sus estudios se vieron frustrados. Tiene cursados estudios de primaria y espera continuar sus estudios de bachiller especializándose en enfermería. Actualmente vive con sus padres Enrique y Carmen de 46 años y con su hijo de 3 años. Juntos viven en una parroquia rural de la ciudad de Quito capital de la provincia del Ecuador, su nombre es Gualea, parroquia ubicada al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, que fue residencia de una cultura ecuatoriana conocida como Los Yumbos. Es un lugar poseedor de diversidad de flora y fauna y además ríos y cascadas que son una fuente cristalina que atrae turistas nacionales y extranjeros, por lo que sus habitantes aprovechan la oportunidad para ofrecer tours, servicio de hospedaje, alimentación, deportes naturales como cabalgatas, etc. Otro medio de producción de la zona es la ganadería con la producción de leche y carne y también la agricultura con la producción de caña de azúcar, yuca, caña, maíz, naranjas, mandarinas y papayas. Las artesanías elaboradas a mano también son una oportunidad de negocio en el lugar, que son demandadas por el uso particular de materiales naturales como semillas del bosque. Por todo esto las autoridades locales se han preocupado por hacer instalaciones adecuadas para que todos sus más de 2000 habitantes tengan acceso a los servicios básicos.
Jessica ha sido apoyada por sus padres para cubrir las necesidades de ella y su hijo. Sin embargo al tener desde niña la experiencia de ordeñar vacas, decidió emprender con este negocio en donde recibe la ayuda y asesoría de sus padres desde hace 2 años. Invierte en esta actividad varias horas al día sin dejar de lado los quehaceres de su hogar y el cuidado de su pequeño hijo. Ahora solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos que implica el retomar los estudios, pues siempre soñó ser una enfermera y piensa que aún está a tiempo de cumplir esta meta. Jessica está segura de que la venta de leche le sustentará para cubrir los pagos del préstamo, sin dejar de lado las obligaciones con su hijo a quien se ha comprometido en darle una educación de excelencia siempre hasta verlo convertido en profesional. Jessica agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo incondicional que prestan al sector rural y a las personas emprendedoras que necesitan apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
Jessica is a young woman of 21. She became a single mother before she reached adulthood. This has been the main obstacle she has faced, since it prevented her from studying. She finished primary school and hopes to continue studying for a technical high school degree with a specialty in nursing. She currently lives with her parents, Enrique and Carmen, who are 46 years old, and with her 3-year-old son. Together they live in a rural parish of the city of Quito, capital of the province and of Ecuador. Its name is Gualea, a parish located in the northwest of the province of Pichincha, which was the site of an Ecuadorian culture known as Los Yumbos. This place has great diversity of flora and fauna, as well as rivers and waterfalls from crystalline springs which attract tourists from within and outside the country. Thus, the inhabitants take advantage of the opportunity to offer tours, lodging services, food, and nature activities such as horseback rides, etc. Another means of production in the area is ranching, with the production of milk and meat, as well as agriculture with the production of sugar cane, yuca, corn, oranges, mandarines and papayas. Crafts produced by hand are also a business opportunity in the area; they are in demand due to the unique use of natural materials, such as seeds from the forest. Because of all this, the local authorities have taken care to create appropriate infrastructure so that all of its more than 2000 inhabitants have access to basic utility services. 

Jessica has been supported by her parents to cover the necessities for herself and her son. However, having experience in milking cows since she was a girl, she decided to get involved in this business, where she has received help and advice from her parents for the past 2 years. She invests several hours a day in this work, without neglecting the chores of her home and the care of her little son. Now she is requesting a loan so that she can cover the expenses involved in returning to her studies, since she has always dreamed of being a nurse, and she thinks that now is the time to achieve this goal. Jessica is sure that the sale of milk will sustain her in covering the payments for the loan, without neglecting her obligations to her son. She is committed to giving him an excellent education and seeing him become a professional. Jessica is grateful to the Alternativa Foundation and to Kiva for the unconditional support they provide to the rural sector and to entrepreneurial people who need financial support.

loans.use: to start her studies as a nurse, so she can support her son.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 54 años está casada con Claudio, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ella y su esposo viven juntos en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural.
El emprendimiento es una de sus virtudes. Hace 33 años inició sus actividades con artesana, hace 10 años como empresaria de radio locución.
Al lado de su esposo logró asentar una cabina de radio. Ahí todos los días transmiten los hechos más importantes dentro y fuera de su localidad. 
“Mi esposo conduce y yo me encargo de los controles”, menciona orgullosa. En los horarios de menor audiencia programa musicales, mientras tanto, se dedica a otras labores como la artesanía.
Considera que la publicidad y transmisión de eventos le arroja buenos ingresos, por ello requiere realizar el mantenimiento de sus máquinas y continuar con su actividad. 
Éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP. Al igual que en los ciclos anteriores se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos. Menciona que, “Mujeres al Futuro”, - su banco comunal-, la apoya bastante en cuanto a temas de ahorros.
Con los 500 soles solicitados podrá pagar por el mantenimiento de sus máquinas como la consola y los mezcladores.
texts.en:
54-year old Elvira is married to Claudio whith whom she has three children. She and her husband live in their own house in a rural area. Her enterprising nature is one of Elvira's virtues. 33 years ago she started making crafts, and then ten years ago she began a business as a radio announcer. She and her husband set up a radio booth, and now they announce the most important information about local and distant events.

"My husband produces the programs, and I am in charge of the controls," she says proudly. In the hours when there are few listeners, they play music. And Elvira still keeps working on her crafts.

As advertising and radio announcements generate a good income, Elvira wants to keep the equipment in good condition and continue with this work. This will be her 11th loan with MFP. As she did in the past, she promises to be punctual with the repayments. She notes that her community bank, 'Mujeres al Futuro', help her a lot with the matter of savings. 

With the 500 soles, Elvira will be able to have the radio equipment (the console and mixers) serviced.

loans.use: Pay to have the radio estation equipment serviced

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata lives at Jacob Town (home), one of the areas in Montserrado County that is cheaper for living. She is married with two children who are in school and live at home. She is 30 years old. Her husband is a contractor.

Aminata started selling with fewer commodities. She makes a profit when she sells every day, but not much. She used the profit to buy more goods to improve the business. She has a table market in the community market, where she sells palm oil, rice, coal, sardines, tomatoes, and other items. 

Aminata has requested a loan to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sardines, and tomatoes for the business.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, sardines, and tomatoes for the business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo Rolando. Sus hijos viven en otra ciudad. Ella y su esposo habitan una casa propia ubicada en un distrito rural.

Nora es una mujer de principios y buenos valores. Se dedica a la confección de tejidos artesanales, los que vende en un puesto ubicado en el centro de su distrito. A la vez expende manualidades, tapices, cerámicas, adornos para el hogar, etc. De esta manera su clientela se siente atraída por las novedades.
“Casi 10 años me dedico al tejido y me gusta porque puedo crear nuevos modelos”, asegura.
Las ventas dependen de la constancia que ella tenga al ofrecer sus productos, por eso la mayor parte del día se encuentra en su puesto de ventas.
Su esposo trabaja en una mina, por ello la mayor parte de su tiempo la pasa con sus compañeras de ventas en el local municipal, donde tiene su puesto de ventas.
Ella requiere de su apoyo para adquirir mercaderías como lanas e hilos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al futuro” y éste es su crédito número 9 con MFP, espera de su apoyo para continuar con sus metas, por otra parte, colabora con puntualidad en su banco comunal.
Nora invertirá los 500 soles en la compra de lanas de oveja y alpaca para realizar sus próximos tejidos.
texts.en:
Nora is 47 years old. She lives with her husband, Rolando. Their children live in another city. She and her husband live in their own house located in a rural district.

Nora is a woman of principles and good values. She makes handcrafted knitted items, which she sells in a stand located in the center of her district. At the same time, she sells crafts, tapestries, ceramics, decorations for the home, etc. In this way her customers are attracted by the new items.

"I have been working in knitting for almost 10 years, and I like it because I can create new styles," she assures.

Her sales depend on her persistence in offering her products, and so she is at her sales stand for the greater part of the day. Her husband works in a mine, so for that reason she passes the greater part of her time with her fellow vendors at the city location where she has her sales stand.

She needs your support to acquire merchandise such as wools and threads. She belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres al Futuro" (Women for the Future), and this is her 9th loan with MFP.  She hopes for your support to continue with her goals. On her part, she cooperates punctually with her communal bank. Nora will invest the 500 PEN in purchasing sheep and alpaca wool for her next knitting projects.

loans.use: to buy sheep and alpaca wool for her next knitting projects

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a 39 year old woman who has seven children who are between 3 and 14 years old. All of them are in school and live at home. Cecelia is married and her husband is a businessman. She made sales with her mother when she was younger and this is where she learned how to sell. Presently Cecelia is selling dry goods like rice, oil, charcoal, pepper, tomatoes, soap, toothpaste, batteries, and candles in her community. She has been engaged in this business for three years now. This loan will enable her to buy more goods to improve the business.  She is proud of her business because
she makes a profit every day. Her plan for the future is to become an even more successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy goods like rice, oil, charcoal, pepper, tomatoes, soap, toothpaste, batteries, candles and others to improve the business

loans.name: Bessay

texts.en: Bessay is 41 years old and lives in Jacob Town. That is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County since it is close to the biggest market in Liberia, but far from the capital city. Bessay is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 20. They attend school and live at home. Her husband is a contractor. For the past three years she has been selling rice, pepper, coal and oil in the community market. She makes profit sometimes, but most of the time business goes slowly. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chisac Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, no tuv la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa, en el mercado de su localidad, inicio este negocio con poco capital y con el apoyo económico de su mamá, hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo  de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que ser utilizado para la compra de mercaderías consistente en ropa, playeras, gorras, sudaderos, camisas, calcetines, etc, con el préstamo atraerá mas cliente ya que tendrá mas variedad en su mercadería. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, artesanía y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Catarina is married, 29 years old, and never had the opportunity to study. She makes a living selling clothes at her local market. She started this business with little capital and with financial help from her mother. Today, she has eight years of experience and is supported by her husband, who works in the same job as her.

Catarina has organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy merchandize, including clothing, t-shirts, hats, sweatshirts, vests, socks etc. With the loan she will attract more customers, since she can offer a greater variety of merchandize. The other members make a living in commerce, handicrafts and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandize to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. Annie is a mother of two children who are attending school and are 6 and 10 years old. They all live at Jacob Town (home), one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. It is good doing business there. 

Annie feels proud of her business because it makes her independent, and she can also contribute to the family’s expenses. She has been selling rice, oil, pepper, Vita (juice drink), onions, and soft drinks for the past five years now. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more rice, oil, Vita, onions, soft drinks, and other items for the business. Annie’s plan for the future is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, Vita, onions, soft drinks, and other items for the business.

loans.name: Kulah

texts.en: Kulah lives in Jacob Town.  That is one of the cheaper place to live in Montserrado County. She is 20 years old and single.  Her boyfriend is a driver and they have a five year old child that is in school and lives with them. For the past three years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She started this business from her savings. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics  for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics  for her business.

loans.name: Munah

texts.en: Munah is 28 years old and lives in Jacob Town. That is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s single with 3 children aged from 4 to 10. None of them live with her but all attend school. Munah has been involved in the sales of cosmetics since 2008. She says there are fewer purchases during the raining season. She started this business with help from her friends who gave her some money for the business. What makes her proud is that she is responsible for her children's upkeep while they stay with their grandmother. Munah has requested this loan to purchase more cosmetics. In future she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Kulah

texts.en: Kulah is 47 years old and lives in Jacob Town. That is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s married with five children aged from 10 and 30. Only one of them lives with her and three of them attend school. Kulah has been involved in the sales of frozen food like fish, chicken, pig's feet, and crabs since 2010. She started this business with the help of her oldest son who give her some money. What makes her proud is that she earns her own money. She is requesting this loan to purchase more frozen food. In the future she plans to build her children a house.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food like fish, chicken, pig's feet, and crabs.

loans.name: Chorracana Group

texts.es:
El señor Marvin Noe esta soltero, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a la comercialización  de colchas de diferentes tamaños, de forma ambulante, inicio este negocio de comercio con la venta de repuestos para electrodomésticos, lleva 6 años de experiencia de ser comerciante, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mas mercadería, consistente en colchas de diferentes colores y calidades, esperando en el futuro tenga variedad de productos y un local propio para sus ventas. Los demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales, Uno de los integrantes de la foto no calificó para el crédito.
texts.en:
Marvin Noe’s single and he’s 20-years-old; he completed elementary school.  He works selling bedspreads of various sizes from place to place.  He started this business selling spare parts for home appliances and has six years’ experience as a merchant; his family helps him out.

He organized a group and requests a loan to buy more merchandise consisting of various bedspreads I assorted colors and of various qualities hoping in future to have a variety of products and a place of his own to sell them in.  

The other group members raise animals to sell.  One of the members in the photo did not qualify for the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mamie is 33 years old and lives in Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s married with a one-year-old child who lives at home. Her husband is a security guard.  For the past six years she has been involved in the sale of charcoal and other goods. Her main challenge is price increases. She started this business with money from her husband. She will use the money to purchase more charcoal. She will use the money to help pay for school fees, and one day she would like to own her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 25 years old and lives in the Jacob Town area--one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County. She’s single with a child, aged two, who lives at home. For the past four years she has been involved in the sale of charcoal. Her main challenge is the increase in prices and looking after her child while running the business. She started this business with money from her boyfriend. She will use the money to purchase more charcoal to resell. In future, she would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery de 42 años comparte una linda vida conyugal con Octavio de 41 años y junto a ellos sus pequeños sus 4  menores hijos Vanesa, Iván, Cristopher y Jefferson para quienes brindar lo mejor de si.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de adobe que construyo de a pocos.
Desde muy niña vivió junto a sus padres en el campo en donde se instruyó en las diversas actividades agropecuarias concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico y demás productos rentables de la zona.
Lleva casi 20 años desempeñándose de manera independiente junto a Octavio con quien tiene el agrado de trabajar de hombro a hombre para el bienestar familiar.
Le agrada su trabajo puesto que ya esta acostumbrada a las actividades agrícolas. No obstante la temporada de lluvias perjudica de manera indirecta sus actividades.
Al hallarse en medio de la campaña productiva de cacao desean contactar a jornaleros y proceder con el deshierbo de maleza a manera de garantizar una producción de calidad motivo por el cual acuden a su institución financiera.
Dentro de sus objetivos a largo plazo esta la compra de un lote puesto que desea habilitar un domicilio para sus hijos cerca de un centro de estudios superiores. Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la contrata de jornaleros quienes apoyaran en el segundo deshierbo de campaña productiva.
texts.en:
Mery, who is 42, shares a beautiful life with Octavio, who is 41, and their four little children, Vanesa, Iván, Cristopher, and Jefferson, to whom they offer their best. She is the owner of a home constructed from adobe, which she built little by little. 

Since she was a child, she lived with her parents in the country, where she learned the various farming activities relating to the production of organic cacao and other profitable products of the region. She has spent almost 20 years working in this independent manner alongside Octavio, with whom she has the pleasure of working shoulder to shoulder for the well-being of the family. She likes her work since she is accustomed to agricultural activities. However, the rainy season indirectly impairs her activities.

Finding herself in the middle of the production season for cacao, they want to hire day laborers and proceed with removing the weeds in a manner that will ensure a quality production. For this reason, they have turned to their financial institution.

Among her long-term objectives is the purchase of a lot, since she wants to set up a home for her children near a center of higher education. 

She needs to have 2000 PEN to hire laborers who will help in the second weeding of this production season.

loans.use: to hire day laborers who will help in the second weeding of this production year.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica de 27 años comparte una vida marital con Edgar de 35 años y para complemento del calo familiar tienen a sus dos pequeños hijos Angie y Esmeralda de 10 y 5 años respectivamente.
Vive en una casa construida a base adobe  que adquirió junto a su esposo a costo de mucho trabajo. 
Inicialmente dedicada a las actividades caseras optó por iniciarse junto  a su pareja en las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico.
Lleva casi 10 años desempeñándose como tal y en todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir mucha experiencia en cuanto al cuidado y mantenimiento de los cultivos.
Considera su trabajo muy dedicado ya que para obtener una producción de calidad se debe estar el pendiente del mantenimiento respectivo el cual lleva de manera estricta contando constantemente con el apoyo de jornaleros del lugar para las actividades mas forzosas.
Al hallarse en medio de la campaña productiva desea realizar el sembrío de plantas que ofrecen sombra temporal a las plantaciones recientemente injertadas para un óptimo crecimiento, asimismo adquirir los insumos como abonos y otros para garantizar la calidad deseada por los acopiadores.
Sus planes a futuro dirigen la construcción de su vivienda  a base de material noble para un mejor bienestar de su familia esperando concretarlo lo mas pronto posible con su trabajo.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la contrata de jornaleros y realizar el sembrío de plantas para sombra permanente y la compra de sacos de guano de isla para garantizar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Mónica, 27, shares a married life with Edgar, 35, and adding to their family unit are two small children: Angie and Esmeralda who are 10 and 5 years of age respectively.  She lives in an adobe-based house that she acquired with her husband thanks to much work.  She initially worked doing household chores but she opted for joining her spouse in agricultural work related to growing cocoa beans and organic coffee.  She’s been working for almost 10 years as such and in all this time has acquired much experience related to crop care and maintenance.  She considers her work to be very dedicated because in order to obtain quality harvest she must be diligent about providing the respective care in a strict way constantly getting help from local day workers for the more heavy tasks.

Being in the middle of the productive cycle, she finds herself needing to plant plants that will provide temporary shade for the recently grafted plants so that they will have optimum growth and she must also buy supplies like manure and others to guarantee the quality local cooperatives require.

Her future plans are aimed at building her house with substantial materials for better family well-being hoping to do so as soon as possible by means of her work.  She needs 1,000 new soles to hire day laborers to plant plants to provide shade permanently and to buy sacks of island guano to guarantee a quality harvest.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy sacks of island guano.

loans.name: Shelia

texts.en:
Shelia is 25 years old, and lives in Jacob Town, which is one of the cheaper places to live in Montserrado County.  She is single, with two children ages 3 and 5. They are in school, and live with her at home.  

Shelia has been involved with the sales of clothing for past four years. She says the problem she faces in the rainy season is that she doesn't have a good location. 

She started this business with the help of her boyfriend, who gave her some money. Her main challenges are sending her children to school, and buying food. 

Shelia has requested this loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.  She hopes to build her own house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora sells spring rolls and doughnuts, which she has done for five years. Dora is married and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying her children’s school fees. Dora will use her loan to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, chicken, and other ingredients, which will be needed in her spring-roll preparation. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, meat, chicken, and other ingredients, which will be used in her spring-roll preparation.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Con 29 años de edad Sonia tiene la alegría de contar con una familia muy unida junto a Prudencio de 32 años t su pequeña Erika de 9 añitos. Reside en una vivienda que le cedieron sus padres cuya base de construcción son los bloques de adobe.
Desde niña siempre estuvo al lado de sus padres quienes la inculcaron en las diversas actividades agrícolas logrando con el tiempo heredar las parcelas donde creció al lado de sus progenitores.
Lleva 9 años desempeñándose de manera independiente junto a Prudencio logrando convertirse en una productora de basta experiencia en el rubro.
Dentro de los productos al cual brinda mayor prioridad esta el cacao orgánico puesto que sus parcelas poseen buen terreno fértil y las mejores condiciones para una producción de calidad. No obstante al estar algo alejado de la ciudad incurre en un costo adicional el movilizar a jornaleros quienes apoyan en actividades masivas como el despeje de mala hierba de los árboles cacaoteros.
Al iniciarse la temporada de lluvias desea aplicar abono orgánico a sus plantaciones para un mejor desarrollo de las mazorcas.
Tiene en mente para el futuro iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble cuyo proyecto lo tiene proyectado dentro de 3 años.
Requiere contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la adquisición de sacos con guano de isla y la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo y mantenimiento de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
At the age of 29, Sonia is happy to have a unified family with Prudencio, 32, and her little girl, Erika, 9.  She lives in a house her parents ceded to her that’s made of adobe bricks.  Since she was a girl she was always by her parents’ side and they taught her to do agriculture chores; in time she inherited the parcels of land she’d grown up on alongside her parents.  She’s been working independently for nine years now alongside Prudencio and she’s become quite a successful grower with vast experience in this line of work.

Among the crops that are her highest priority are organic cocoa beans because her parcels are of very fertile soil and they have the best conditions for a quality harvest.  Due to the fact that they are a bit distant from the city she incurs additional costs related to transporting laborers that help her with the heavier tasks like weeding the cocoa bean plants.  When the rainy season starts she wants to apply organic manure to her plants so that growth will be better.  She intends to build her house out of more substantial materials within the next three years.  She needs 1,500 new soles to buy island guano and to hire day laborers to do the weeding and crop maintenance.

loans.use: to buy sacks of island guano and to hire laborers to do the weeding and crop maintenance.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Con 40 años de edad Margarita comparte una vida conyugal con Félix de 40 años con quien tiene la alegría de tener 5 hijos todos menores y con la necesidad de recibir todo lo necesario para llegar a ser personas de buen porvenir.
Reside junto a su familia en una vivienda construida a base de madera que adquirió junto a su conviviente.
Se inicio en la venta de víveres de manera informal logrando con el tiempo ser admitida en el mercado de abastos de su localidad al igual que otros compañeros suyos.
Lleva casi 10 años desempeñándose como vendedora de diversos productos de primera necesidad como cereales, verduras y demás conservas con mayor demanda.
Considera muy grato su trabajo puesto que ha logrado entablar muchas amistades con sus clientes y vecinos de puesto. No obstante los problemas en las vías de acceso a su localidad se ven afectadas por las constantes lluvias y retrazan el abastecimiento de los productos consumibles perjudicándola considerablemente.
Como comerciante es conciente que los días de descanso no existen y debe estar al pendiente de su negocio.
Desea a futuro aperturar la construcción de su vivienda y lograr habilitar un local comercial para luego desempeñar su negocio cerca de sus pequeños. Actualmente requiere contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para reabastecer su negocio con cereales, verduras y demás enlatados con buena demanda actual.
texts.en:
At the age of 40, Margarita shares married life with Félix, 40 with whom she has the joy of having five minor children who need to receive everything required to become people with good futures.  She lives with her family in a house built of wood that she acquired together with her spouse. 

She started out selling foodstuffs informally and in time she and some of her companions were admitted into the local wholesale food market.  She’s been working as a merchant selling basic staple items like cereals, vegetables and canned goods in high demand for almost 10 years.  She considers her work to be very pleasant because she’s made many friends among her customers and neighboring merchants.  However, access roads to her community are impacted by the rainy season and this causes delays in supply of food items which is considerably detrimental to her.

As a merchant, she’s aware that there are no days off and she must be watchful of the business always.  She wants in future to start building her house and to set up a commercial space to continue with her work nearer her little ones.  She currently needs 4,000 new soles to restock her business with cereals, vegetables and other canned goods that are in high demand at present.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Adiyasuren

texts.en:
Mr.Adiyasuren is 53 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger in the Arhangai province in Mongolia. His wife, Altantsetseg, age 53, helps her husband grow organic vegetables on their plot of land. His son Monhtuvshin, age 25, is a herdsman;  his daughter Ganchimeg, age 23, is a university student. 

The borrower has been running an organic vegetable production and sales business for last seven years. He and his wife sell organic vegetables in a local market. He is now requesting 1'000'000MNT to purchase seed and soil for the organic vegetable planting season.

He and his wife are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soil for the organic vegetable planting season.

loans.name: Verije

texts.en:
Verije is in her late fifties and married, yet she has a disability--she was born somewhat deaf. She lives in the south-central of Albania with her husband in the suburbs of a little town.

For the past 10 years, Verije has been selling milk to locals, and this has been the only income for her and her husband. She has cows and takes great care of them. In order to increase sales of dairy products, particularly milk, she must buy another dairy cow, she said, and this is why she is requesting this loan.
  
This would be her first loan, yet she promises to pay it back on time because responsibility is her strongest character trait, she said while smiling.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is the lady pounding fufu. She operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold) and she has done this for five years. The food she  serves is fufu, banku, and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and three children. Nana uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase  foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Nana plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Wilson Eduardo

texts.es:
Wilson es un joven trabajador de 22 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Wilson creció en una familia trabajadora y esforzada, dedicada a la agricultura y otras actividades de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Unidos aún en las circunstancias difíciles, y gracias a sus padres, Wilson terminó la secundaria. Ahora vive solo y está iniciando los estudios universitarios, los cuales planea terminar derribando cualquier obstáculo. Tiene una casa que aún no ha terminado de construir en la cual vive en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada. Wilson forma parte de esta población y ha desarrollado su espíritu emprendedor también pensando en ser un protagonista del crecimiento económico de su ciudad y del país.
Wilson se independizó de sus padres buscando mejores oportunidades de crecimiento y educación que en Portoviejo no tuvo la ocasión de encontrar. Tras algún tiempo de trabajo en varias actividades ha decidido iniciar sus estudios en la universidad, los cuales se pagan con los ingresos de su trabajo que inició hace 3 años; la crianza de pollos; que emprendió por iniciativa propia al ver la necesidad de autosustentarse diariamente. Invierte en esta actividad hasta 10 horas diarias, dependiendo de una agenda que lleva para el cuidado de los animales, además los fines de semana sale en medio del ardiente sol o incluso en la lluvia a realizar la venta de los pollos a la feria local. Wilson ha adquirido la suficiente experiencia en esta labor, por lo que ahora necesita que sus ingresos incrementen, lo cual conseguirá comprando más pollos para criar y por ende ampliando los criaderos. Wilson espera que con este aumento en sus utilidades pueda pagar sus estudios y también realizar a su vivienda los acabados que necesita. Para hacer posible este reto Wilson requiere un préstamo, para lo cual acudió a la sucursal que Fundación Alternativa tiene en Los Bancos, en donde encontró mucha agilidad, confianza y apoyo a emprendedores y a personas del sector rural que carecen de oportunidades para contar con capital. Este joven luchador agradece la intervención de Kiva para que varias personas alrededor del mundo formen parte sus sueños y crecimiento personal y profesional.
texts.en:
Wilson, 22, is a hardworking young man.  He's single and has no children.  Wilson grew up in a hardworking and strong family dedicated to agriculture and other activities in Portoviejo.  They're close even in difficult circumstances, and Wilson finished secondary school thanks to his parents.  Now he lives alone and is beginning his university studies, which he plans to finish by tackling any obstacle.  

He lives in a house that he hasn't finished building in Los Bancos, a canton in the province of Pichincha, one of the largest in the Republic of Ecuador.  This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito and has a variety of forests.  Also, its neighborhoods are inhabited by friendly people with traditions typical of this city, where there are also several micro-businesses run by entrepreneurs who strive every day to make their dreams come true.  Other notable activities are agriculture and livestock, which produce abundant crops that are they sold for distribution in many provinces.  There are also a variety of tourist attractions, such as waterfalls, rivers, trails, and hot springs, which attract tourists for adventure sports that are offered there with security guaranteed.

Wilson is part of this community, and he has developed his entrepreneurial spirit while also thinking about being a protagonist in the economic growth of his city and of the country.

Wilson became independent from his parents to look for better opportunities for growth and education that he wasn't able to find in Portoviejo.  After some time working in various jobs he has decided to begin his university studies, paid for with the income from the job he started three years ago, raising chickens.  He set it up on his own initiative when he saw the need to support himself every day.  He invests about 10 hours a day on this activity, depending on his schedule for caring for the animals.  In addition, on the weekend he goes out in full sun or even in the rain to sell chickens in the local street fair.

Wilson has acquired enough experience in the job and now he needs to increase his income, so he's going to buy more chickens to raise and, consequently, expand his poultry farm.

Wilson hopes that with this increase in his profits he'll be able to pay for his studies as well as make the necessary finishing touches to his house.  Wilson needs a loan to make this challenge possible, so he went to the branch of Fundación Alternativa in Los Bancos.  He found a lot of flexibility, trust, and support for entrepreneurs and people in the rural sector who lack opportunities to have capital.

This determined young man is grateful for Kiva's participation so that various people around the world will be part of his dreams and his personal and professional growth.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Las Farkas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Farkas” está conformado por 15 emprendedoras quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran;  centro de internet, arriendo de cuartos, feriantes, venta de juguetes, venta de ropa, venta de longanizas, venta de perfumes, venta de verduras, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Marcia, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie hacia el fondo del grupo, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, su cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que habilito un espacio en su casa para tener su local y atender a su clientela, ofrece de todo un poco como bebidas, carnes, lácteos, tortas, pasteles, mercadería variada, su negocio lo abre a las 09.30 horas, hasta las 23ºº horas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando la compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará una máquina para mantener los helados.
Una de las metas de Marcia es crecer dia a dia y que su negocio siga creciendo y atraer más clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y un buen bienestar en familia.
Marcia vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 20 y 10 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder hacer un viaje disfrutando con su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de invertir y surgir en su negocio. Marcia tiene una muy buena relación con las socias del grupo. Respecto a los cursos impartidos ha podido integrar todos los aprendizajes de venta a su negocio.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Farkas” and it has 15 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work among which are: Internet access service, room rentals, street merchants, toy sales, clothes sales, sausage sales, perfume sales, vegetable sales and services, among others.  All are from the city of Puerto Montt.

Marcia, a communal bank member, appears standing in the rear of the group in the photo; she’s fourth from right to left with her hair gathered up.

She’s been a merchant for the last five years.  She comments that she set aside space at home for her store and to take care of customers.  She sells a little bit of everything: soft-drinks, meats, dairy products, cakes, pies and assorted merchandise.  She opens at 9:30 am and closes at 11pm.

She buys the merchandise she needs in various supermarkets and suppliers where she finds the merchandise at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy a freezer.

One of Marcia’s goals is to grow day to day and that the business continues growing and to attract more customers in order to generate higher income and good family well-being.  Marcia lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 10 years of age.  Her dream for her family is to go on a family trip.

She is very happy and grateful to Fondo Esperanza because it has given her the opportunity to invest and surge forward in her business.  Marcia has a very good relationship with the group members.  She’s been able to integrate everything she’s learned in the training courses into her store’s sales.

Puerto Montt is a city in southern Chile located in the Los Lagos Region.  One of Puerto Montt’s attractions are its beautiful green scenery, its almost deserted beaches, its cuisine especially fish and seafood and its crafts.  It’s also the entryway to the Great Island of Chiloé which is rich in tradition and legends.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: Julián, tiene 57 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Don Julián toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, produce café y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. La producción que saca la vende en los mercados locales. El quiere continuar con la asistencia y mantenimiento de sus cultivos por lo que ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a ODEF y es por 13,000 Lempiras, lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para la siembra y mantenimiento de dichos cultivos. Su meta es seguir trabajando y salir adelante con las cosechas.
texts.en: Julian, 57, is married and has 2 children.  He lives in a town in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Julian has worked as a farmer his whole life.  He cultivates coffee and staple grains such as corn and beans.  He takes his products to the local markets to sell.  Julian wants to continue with the care and maintenance of his crops, and so he is requesting his 2nd loan from ODEF for 13,000 Honduran lempiras.  He will use the funds to buy chemical and organic fertilizers to maintain his crops.  His goal is to continue to work and get ahead with his harvests.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella lleva 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa como blusas, jeans, ropa interior y sandalias. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante y también vende en su casa por pedidos. Ha invertido varios prestamos en su negocio, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo de préstamo, el cual es por 17,000 Lempiras para comprar uniformes escolares, blusas y ropa interior, esta inversión le ayudara a obtener ingresos. Su meta es prosperar económicamente, para darles la educación a sus hijos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Karla, 33, is married and has 2 children.  She lives in a town in the municipality of Tela, in the department of Atlántida.  Karla has been selling clothing such as blouses, jeans, underwear, and sandals for 6 years.  She sells door-to-door, and her customers also come to her house to order her products.  She has invested a number of loans in her business.  She is now requesting her 6th loan, for 17,000 Honduran lempiras, so that she can buy school uniforms, blouses and underwear.  This investment will help her to earn income.  Karla's goal is to prosper financially, so that she can provide her children with an education and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms, blouses and underwear to sell

loans.name: Altanhundaga

texts.en: Mr. Altanhundaga is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger in the Darhan province of Mongolia. His wife is temporarily unemployed now. His daughter Ariuntsetseg, age 20, is a university student and his daughter Bayartsetseg, age 13, and son Altanhishig, age 9, go to a local school. This borrower has been running his business of silver and gold jewelry repair and redesign in a rental place in a local shopping area. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay his daughter's university tuition fee and other school-related expenses. He is a hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fee and other school-related expenses

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista habita en el municipio de  Masaya, agricultora desdes hace mas de 15 años, gracias al duro trabajo y esfuerzo a sacado adelante a sus hijos, ella siembra yuca y actualmente requiere de capital para incrementar una manzana de yuca, para que sus ingresos sean mejores, Gracias a este nuevo credito podra comprar lo necesario para estableser su siembra de yuca comprara: Madera de Yuca, Fertilizante e insumos, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado en conjunto a Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Evarista lives in the city of Masaya.  She has been a farmer for more than 15 years.  Thanks to her effort and hard work she has been able to provide a better life for her children.  She grows yucca and currently needs a loan so that she can expand her fields by approximately 2 acres and thus increase her income.

Thanks to this new loan she will be able to buy what she needs in order to establish her new crop, including yucca plants, fertilizer and other supplies.  She is grateful for the support that she has received from Afodenic in conjunction with Kiva.

loans.use: to grow her yucca crops.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La señora Soledad tiene 63 años de edad, tiene ocho hijos. Tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa, la comercializa de casa en casa, por lugares cercanos al lugar en donde vive. Este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia; debido a que ella viajaba  a la ciudad y compraba platos, tazas, ropa interior, camisas, entre otras cosas más en mínimas cantidades y observo que la gente le compraba y poco a poco fue comprando más. Antes ella se dedicaba a la costureria, pero su vista le esta fallando por eso ya casi no costura. Para adquirir la ropa se tarda unas dos horas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más ropa y aumentar su inventario, ya que las ganancias que obtiene las invierte en la compra de alimento para su familia. Debido a que de sus ocho hijos solo uno le ayuda y ella debe de buscar la forma de cómo ganarse la vida. Más adelante ella desea mejorar su casa, ya que en la que vive esta muy deteriorada y el material (bahareque) del que esta elaborada no da mucha seguridad.
texts.en:
Soledad is 63 years old, and she has 8 children.  She has been selling clothing for 2 years.  She sells from house to house, and in places that are close to her home.  She learned this business on her own initiative, because she used to travel to the city and buy plates, cups, underwear, shirts, and other items in small quantities, and she observed that people would buy from her.  Over time, they started buying more and more.  Previously she worked as a seamstress, but her vision is failing and she can no longer do this work.  It takes her about 2 hours to buy the clothing.

She will use the loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Campo to buy more clothing and increase her inventory, and she will use the profits she obtains to buy food for her family.  Because only 1 of her 8 children help her, she must look for some way to earn a living.  In the future, she wants to make some improvements to her house, because her house is very run down and the material it is made of, (wattle and daub), does not provide much security.

loans.use: to buy more clothing so that she can increase her inventory

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual is a petty trader; she trades in ladies' accessories, like earrings and necklaces, in Ankaful, near Abura. She has been in this business for 4 years now. Perpetual is a widow and has 2 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, cloth, and pay for her children’s school fees.  Perpetual needs this loan to purchase a variety of ladies' accessories to increase her sales. With the new profits, Perpetual will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ladies' accessories to increase sales

loans.name: Feruz

texts.en:
Feruz is from Israel’s Negev region. Both her son and husband are battling long-term illnesses and Feruz has taken on the responsibility of making sure her family has enough income to provide for themselves. She has opened a store from her home selling women’s clothing, sheets, blankets, rugs, and household items. The business is doing well.

Feruz needs this loan to pay for stock, like clothing, bedding, rugs, and specialty supplies in demand.

Feruz wants to provide for her family and one day, when her store expands more, move to a location outside of her home.

loans.use: to pay for stock in clothing, bedding, rugs, and specialty supplies in demand

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a petty trader; she sells plastic bowls, which she has done for 6 years now. Rose is married to a farmer and has 3 children. She uses her income to support her husband and pay for their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase plastic bowls and baskets to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls and baskets to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a food vender; she sells banku, vegetable stew, meat, and fish. She has done this for 10 years. She is a widow and has 7 children. Aba uses her income to feed, cloth, and pay for her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, and fish to prepare her banku for selling. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, and fish to prepare her banku for selling

loans.name: Elivania

texts.en: Elivania is a forty-two-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years she has been selling beans and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children and renovate her house. Like all responsible mothers, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and see them work for reputable organizations. Price fluctuation and seasonal weather changes hinder Elivania's business, while her dream is to diversify and trade in groundnuts and maize. Elivania intends to use the loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Don ramón de 48 años, sus hijos ya mayores de edad, uno está estudiando, el continua con su trabajo como guarda de seguridad en una empresa de transporte desde hace seis años, ha construido su casa con créditos obtenidos por Afodenic y KIva por el cual está muy contento se seguir progresando, este préstamo lo quiere para comprar laminas de zinc, hierro, bloques, cemento, perlines, para levantar el nivel del techo de su casa ya que es muy bajito y las laminas están muy viejitas, para poder vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, poco a poco ir haciéndole otras mejoras hasta donde pueda.
texts.en:
Ramón is 48 years old and has one child in school and three adult children. Ramón continues to work as a security guard at a transportation company, where he has worked for six years.  He has built his home with the help of loans from  Afodenic and Kiva, for which he is very grateful.  These loans have enabled him to continue to make progress.  

The loan he is seeking will be used to buy laminated zinc sheets, steel, cement, concrete blocks and wooden beams.  This will allow him to raise the level of the ceiling in his house as it is very low at present. Also, the laminated sheet metal is very old.  This will help him to improve conditions for his family, and he will be making other repairs where he can.

loans.use: to buy laminated zinc sheets, steel, cement, concrete blocks and wooden beams.

loans.name: Lucilo Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Lucilo habita en el municipio de la Concepcion en el barrio los Martinez junto a su esposa e hijos, ella es comerciante y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ya que vende frutas y verduras, el es agricultor, sueña con darle una mejor condicion a su casa y sobre todo a sus hijos, con este nuevo financiamiento podra darle Mantenimiento a su  siembro de Piña ya que por el clima y las plagas requieren de un optimo mantenimiento, Agradece el Apoyo y la Confianza que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Lucilo lives in the city of Concepción in the neighborhood of Martinez, along with his wife and children.  His wife is a merchant who sells fruits and vegetables, and she helps him with the household expenses.

Lucilo is a farmer who dreams of providing a better life to his family and above all to his children.  With this new loan he will be able to perform maintenance on his pineapple crops.  The local climate and the threat of diseases require that he provide a high level of attention to his crops.

He is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided and the trust that they have put in him.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: José Joaquín

texts.es: José Joaquín como en otras ocaciones ha trabajado en la siembra y cosecha de maíz y frijol con crédito comunal, esta vez solicita trescientos mil colones (¢300.000), pues va aprovechar la época de verano que es la más indicada para la siembra de estos granos, compraran semilla de maíz y frijol y suministros agrícolas él y sus dos hijos con la colaboración de su esposa han preparado el terreno para esta actividad, toda la familia depende de este oficio para su subsistencia, pues la cosecha la venden a una asociación local o centro de acopio y por eso quieren obtener una buena produción con lo que lograran mayores ingresos.
texts.en: José Joaquín, as on other occasions, has worked in the planting and harvesting of corn and beans with communal loans.  This time he is requesting 300,000 colones (Costa Rican currency) in order to take advantage of the summer season which is the best for planting these grains.  He will buy corn and bean seed and agricultural products.  He and his two sons with help from his wife have prepared the land for this activity.  The whole family depends on this work for their subsistence.  They sell the harvest to a local association or central stockpile (a grain coop), and for that reason they want to obtain a good harvest so that they can earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista es un agricultor con muchos años de experiencia en esta labor, coonoce muy bien el proceso de cosecha del maíz y frijoles y el mantenimiento que se le debe dar a estos productos para obtener la mayor ganancia posible. Siendo este el mejor tiempo para sembrar estos granos solicita un crédito de un millón treinta y cinco mil colones (¢1.035.000) para comprar la semilla y suministros  para el mamntenimiento y desarrollo del producto.
Su familia lo apoya con la mano de obra tanto en la siembra como en la cosecha, ya que dependen de esta actividad para su subsistencia.
texts.en: Juan Bautista is a farmer with many years of experience in this field.  He knows very well the process of harvesting corn and beans and the care that one must give to these products in order to obtain the best earnings possible.  Since this is the best season for planting these grains he is asking for a loan of one million thirty five colones (¢1.035.000 - Costa Rican currency) in order to purchase seeds and insecticides for the maintenance and growth of his product.  He family supports him with labor both in planting and at harvest, since they depend on this business for their subsistence.

loans.use: to buy supplies and insecticides.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fruit vendor. She sells pineapples, oranges, guavas, and other fruits. She has been in this business for seven years. Esi lives with her husband, a teacher, and her two children in Ankaful near Abura. She will use her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Esi will use her loan to buy more fruit to satisfy her customers. With her expected increased profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is a seamstress, and she sells ladies' accessories, like earrings and necklaces, at Ankaful, near Abura. She has been in this business for four years. Agatha is married to a driver. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their housing and utility bills. Agatha needs this loan to purchase a variety of ladies' accessories, and fabrics to make dresses, for sale. With the new profit, Agatha will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ladies' accessories, and fabrics to make dresses, for sale.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza is a 35-year-old, married woman, who has three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fish for ten years, and she operates in the market, thus attracting many customers. She decided to venture into the business after realizing that her husband's wages were not enough to meet the increasing basic needs of their family. Inadequate capital and a lack of appropriate refrigeration for the fish, hinder her business plans. Her dream is to own a refrigerated van. Eseza intends to use the credit facility to buy fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos en la zona norte del país, se dedica a la agricultura, que es la actividad que más se desarrolla en la zona, la mayoría de estos agricultores venden sus productos a centros de acopio locales como lo es el caso de Cecilo, quien se ha propuesto aumentar sus ingresos, extendiendo el área de siembra,para lo cual necesita un crédito por quinientos mil colones (¢500.000)con lo que comprará la semilla de maíz y los suministros para el desarrollo del producto, se siente contento de la facilidad con la que adquirió el financiamiento y agradece esta oportunidad.
texts.en: Cecilio lives with his wife and their six children in the northern area of the country. He works in agriculture, which is sector that's developing the most in the area. Most of these farmers sell their goods to local stockpile centers, as is the case for Cecilio. He has decided to increase his income by extending the area of the his cultivated land for which he needs a loan of 500,000 Costa Rican Colóns. With this, he will buy corn seeds and the supplies for the growth of his product. He is pleased with the ease through which he acquired funding, and he is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, fungicides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un agricultor vecino de la zona del Pacífico norte del país, durante muchos años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya que esta es la principal actividad de la zona, sus productos los vende a centros de acopio locales, con los ingresos obtenidos sustenta a su familia compuesta por cinco miembros.
El objetivo de Santos es crecer económicamente para que sus hijos puedan ir a la universidad y tengan un futuro mejor, para ello está solictando un crédito por trescientos mil colones (¢300.000)con esto extenderá el área de siembra, comprará semilla de maíz y suministros para obtener nuevos ingresos a partir de la venta de la cosecha.
texts.en: Santos is a farmer near the zone of the Pacific in the North of the country.  He has been working in agriculture for many years, since this is the principle activity in the zone.  He sells his products at local coops, and he supports his family with his income.  His family is composed of five members.  Santos's goal is to grow economically so that his children can go to the university and have a better future.  For that reason he is asking for a loan of 300,000 colones (¢300.000 - Costa Rican currency).  With this money he will extend his crop land, he will buy corn seed, and he'll buy fertilizers and herbicides in order to obtain new income upon selling his harvest.

loans.use: To purchase corn seed, fertilizer, fungicide and herbicides.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camana, Ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo en esta ciudad se puede encontrar  varios platillos típicos en especial el Chupe de Camarones.

Día a día Hilario trabaja en su negocio como agricultor, sobre todo actualmente ha sembrado arroz y él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su familia ya que es padre de 3 hijos; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque siempre tiene a Dios a su lado.

Hilario está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros, para poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Hilario is a very hard-working and enthusiastic man.  He lives in the city of Camana, which is known for having beautiful beaches.  The city is also known for agricultural development, particularly the cultivation of rice.  People also raise fish and above all in the city one can find various typical dishes like the delicious Chupe de Camarones (Lip Smacking Shrimp).
