Day to day Hilario works in his business as a farmer.  Currently he grows mostly rice, and he works around 8 hours each day.  With the fruit of his labor he can pay for family expenses, since he is the father of three children.  He believes that things are going well for his business because he is very responsible and above all he always has God on his side.

Hilario is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since due to their support he will be able to purchase fertilizers and other items.  This will help him maintain his fields in good order and in this way he can keep working each day to make his great dream a reality: "To be a great micro-entrepreneur."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells African-print cloth at Ankaful, near Abura, in Ghana. Beatrice is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Beatrice has been selling African-print cloth for 10 years. She uses her income to support her husband in clothing and feeding their children. She will use her loan to buy more African-print cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more African-print cloth to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 26 year old, married woman living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for three years, and was inspired into service by her parents who are both teachers. She is currently living in a rented house and her desire is to construct her own house. Her low salary coupled with price fluctuations pose a great challenge to her. Her dreams are to upgrade her studies and become a school principal. Irene intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as cement and bricks.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela de 28  años, es comerciante está casada con el Sr. Fidel de 30 años de edad, es chofer, el matrimonio tiene dos hijos menores un niño de 5 años y una niña de 4  años de edad.
Se inicio en el mercado de ventas gracias a la ayuda de su marido, quien desde muy joven trabajo como chofer de camión de cargas, poco a poco fue aumentando su venta ya que ella misma sale a ofrecer sus productos por la zona, lo que más vende son prendas de vestir para damas y niños como blusas, remeras, short, buzos y lencerías. Uno de sus grandes anhelos de ella es contar con su propio local  de ventas en la zona céntrica de la ciudad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir de temporada, lo cual le ayudará mucho para seguir sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is 28 years old and is a business woman.  She is married to Mr. Fidel who is 30 and is a truck driver.  They have two young children, a boy age 5 and a girl age four.  

She began in sales thanks to help from her husband, who since he was young has worked as a truck driver.  Little by little Graciela began increasing her sales since she herself goes out to offer her products in the zone.  She sells mostly clothing for women and children like blouses, shorts, undergarments, 
t-shirts and sweatshirts.  One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center.  She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing.  This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Ms. Altansuh is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters, in an apartment in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Duuriimaa, age 38, has been working in a local private company, as an assistant worker. Her older daughter, Ichinhorloo, age 18, has just enrolled in university, and her younger daughter, Ichinnorov, age 16, is a secondary school student. 

Altansuh has been engaged in producing and selling organic vegetable products, since 2010. She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more organic vegetables, to use in preparing her preserved vegetable products. Borrower and her husband are hard-working, honest and modest people.

loans.use: to purchase more organic vegetables, to use in producing preserved organic vegetable products for sale.

loans.name: Mwamini

texts.en: Mwamini used the previous loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell. She is a 44-year-old businesswoman with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has been selling secondhand clothes, and with the profits she has been able to pay the school fees for her children. She started the business from the proceeds of cocoa sales, a business she still has. Her major problem is inadequate capital to purchase stock. Mwamini is requesting for a loan to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasita es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es soltera, ella es dueña de una casa de ventas de ropas varias en la ciudad de Posadas en donde trabaja con su mama ya hace mas de 4 años.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia para el día a día, nos dice que todo está muy difícil, pero que pese a ello se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y teniendo las ventas que le dan la ganancias para mantener su casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Tomasita is from the city of Encarnación.  She is single and is the owner of a store that sells various types of clothing in the city of Posadas, where she has worked with her mother for more than four years.

She is a very hard-working person who thanks to her efforts is getting ahead and helping her family day by day.  She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing of all types to supply her business and in this way to be able to continue working and having sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité llamado San Cayetano esta integrado por 20 señoras con ganas de superarse económicamente. Son personas humildes madres de familias de escasos recursos que trabajan a diario para mantener a su familia para darles una dignidad de buena vida. Las mismas son independientes en sus labores, personas emprendedoras, solidarias que trabajan en conjunto como grupo buscando la superación de sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Margarita, quien es modista, comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil, pero con el tiempo fue ganando terreno y hoy en día y aes muy conocida por el buen trabajo que hace, en su barrio la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de otros lugares vienen hasta ella. Su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, también botones, cierres, gomas y demás, ya que son los insumos que mas utiliza en sus prendas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Cayetano" is comprised of 20 women who have a desire for financial success.  They are humble mothers from families with limited resources who work daily to support their families and give them the dignity of a good life.  They are enterprising people who each have their own businesses, but they work together and support each other as a group, seeking to succeed with their families. 

One of these women is Margarita, who is a dressmaker.  She states that at first it was a bit difficult, but over time she has been gaining ground, and today she is very well-known for the work that she does.  Most of her neighbors come to her business, as well as people from other places.  Margarita's goal is to continue to grow the business so that she can help her family. 

Margarita is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other supplies that she uses to make garments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, 26 años de edad, originaria de León,  casada, madre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y peluches en la ciudad de León, tiene 2 años con este negocio, con conocimiento académico universitaria  egresada de la carrera de  Relaciones   Internacionales. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo ropa, juguetes y artículos escolares de forma ambulante a la edad de 24 años, este ha sido su primer negocio, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mama y el de sus hermanas.
Ella está solicitando  el financiamiento para comprar,  pacas de ropa, juguetes y artículos escolares como borrador, lápiz y  cuaderno. Ya que ella estima que  este crédito le ayudaría a comprar más mercadería   que aún no tiene en existencia. Su propósito es incrementar sus ventas y poner su propia tienda de mercadería en general, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para darle una mejor presentación al negocio.
texts.en:
Maria, 26, is from León. She is  married and has one child. She is a merchant who sells clothes and stuffed animals in the city of  León.  She has been in this business for two years. She has a university degree in international relations. 

At the age of 24, she started in the merchant business as a street vendor selling clothes, toys and school supplies. This is her first business. She depends on the support from her mom and her sisters.

She's requesting the loan in order to buy bundles of clothing, toys and school supplies such as erasers, pencils and notebooks. 

She believes this loan will help her to buy items to sell that she still does not have. Her idea is to increase her sales and have her own general store. 

Her future plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house in order to give her business a better look.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes, toys and school supplies such as erasers, pencils and notebooks.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 38-year-old, married woman, who has five children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for fifteen years. She was inspired to join this profession by her desire to nurture young people. She says that the low salary she earns cannot support her growing family. Her plan is to buy land and venture into agriculture.

Being the responsible mother that she is, she dreams of educating her children to attain degrees, as a minimum qualification. Joyce intends to use the loan facility to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Amudan

texts.en: Amudan is a 32 year old, married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Seven years ago he decided to venture into a retail shop business in order to supplement his cocoa business. He is a very ambitious man who also works in local government and has a motorcycle transport business. The high costs of operations and price fluctuations hinder his business. His dream is to expand his cocoa plantation and own a wholesale shop. Amudan is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as bread and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as bread and salt to sell.

loans.name: Juana Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Juana Filomena esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, curso 1 grado de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de delantales típicos, inicio este negocio siendo operaria, hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a presta sus servicios de chófer.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas e hilos de diferentes colores, ya que con eso aumentara su producción y por ello venderá mas delantales. Espera en el futuro contar con trabajadores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Filomena is married and is 29 years old.  She completed one year of elementary school.  She has three children two of whom are in school.  She works sewing traditional smocks.  She began this business as a worker in a shop.  She has two years of experience.  She counts on the support of her husband who works as a driver.

She is asking for a loan that will help her buy cloth and thread of various colors.  This will help her increase her production and thus she will sell more smocks.  She hopes in the future to hire assistants.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surge gracias a una de las miembros, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas se informo y las reunió y de ahí surge este grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras.
La Sra. Maria, una de las miembros, es vendedora de comestibles esta casada con el señor Ángel Ella solicita el crédito  para la compra de productos variados para ir generar mas fuente de ingresos, como ser carne, huevo, gaseosa , panificado, etc. Maria tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando así un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This group came about thanks to one of its members who wanted to help her friends and neighbors.  She informed them and they met and from that began this group called "Hard-working Women."

Mrs. María, one of the members, sells food and is married to Mr. Angel.  She is asking for a loan to purchase various products in order to generate more income.  Products include beef, eggs, soft drinks, bread, etc.  Maria has a goal of growing her business and thereby bringing a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: To purchase beef, eggs, soft drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 50 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who earns a living by running a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a loan for PHP 29,000 from NWTF to buy new fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 25 years and her goal for the future is to earn enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fish vending. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Enelcida is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 2 (Love and Faith 2), a group of Haitian emigrants. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana. She is a divorced mom and makes her home here in a simple structure with her six children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard and return to Haiti with enough capital to set a business.

Enelcida is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She has been operating her business for more than eight years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying flour, rice, butter, sugar, beans, meat and other items to sell in her grocery store and fritura (fried food stall). She will use the profits to save and plan for her future, while she dreams to return to Haiti.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, chicken, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de la Ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan con la Fundación desde el año 2012,  se encuentran en el 3er ciclo,  y están trabajando arduamente para   seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Cinthia, quien se dedica a hacer manicuras, cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, que siempre hace buenos trabajos, y que por eso le va muy bien. Se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar esmaltes para pintauñas, limas, quita esmaltes, etc. Y con esto podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación began through a contact with one of the members of the Foundation.  The group has been working with the Foundation since 2012.  They are in their 3rd loan cycle and they are working arduously to continue growing.

One of the group members is Mrs. Cinthia.  She works giving manicures, and she notes that she has very good customers and that she always does good work, which is why things are going well.  She stands out for being a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase nail polish, polish remover, files, etc.  With these products she will be able to continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, polish remover, files, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo San Cayetano se encuentra en el 4to. Ciclo con 12 integrantes, es caracterizado por su responsabilidad, participación en las capacitaciones.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Felipa  de 61 años de edad que se dedica al macate (venta ambulante), ella todos los fines de semana viaja a las ciudades de Luque, Mariano  Roque Alonso y otros a ofrecer sus productos que consisten en frazadas,colchas y hamacas,  y también ropas ,zapatos y todo lo que su clientela formada solicite.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frazadas,colchas y hamacas, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo sus ventas y teniendo mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, San Cayetano, is in its fourth loan cycle.  The group has 12 members and is characterized by responsibility and participation in the training sessions.  One of the stories worthy of note is that of Mrs. Felipa.  She is 61 years old and works as a traveling saleswoman.  Every weekend she travels to the cities of Luque, Mariano, Roque Alonso and others to offer her products, which consist of hammocks, bedspreads and blankets.  She also sells clothing, shoes, and whatever else her regular clientele requests.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase blankets, bedspreads, and hammocks.  That will help her move forward with her sales and have a better variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, bedspreads, and hammocks.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 55 years old and married; she has six children.

Theresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

Theresa has borrowed, and repaid, three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns an income from frozen foods. She aspires to save enough, to expand her business and to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF, to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries, to resell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years, and she earns additional income by fattening and selling pigs.

Ana Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Mba´apora Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Kuña Joaju Mba´apora" , se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Graciela, con 10 mujeres, están en el primer ciclo, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familias que trabajan para ayudar a sus familias.
Todas las miembros se dedican a la cría y venta de animales, también al faenamiento de animales, y por medio de este trabajo ayudan a sus familias.  Graciela, solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir alimentándolos.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Joaju Mba'apora" began with the initiative of Graciela, and is made up of 10 women and herself.  They are in their first cycle.  All of them are leaders in their homes that work to help their families.

All of the members work in raising and selling animals, and also the slaughter of animals.  Through these means they help support their families.  Graciela requests this loan to be able to invest it in buying feed for her animals, and in this manner continue feeding them.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Santa Rita, esta en su primer ciclo, donde las mujeres que lo integran están trabajando arduamente por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias, están aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo y a invertir su dinero en sus labores.
Irene, una de las miembros, tiene una modesta despensa en la que trabaja todos los días incansablemente para poder ayudar a sus familia. Cuenta que quiere tener algún día un negocio más grande donde pueda invertir más dinero y tener mayores productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras, hortalizas, carnes y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group "Santa Rita" is in its first cycle.  The women who the group is made up of are working hard to get ahead and help their families.  They are learning to work as a team and invest their money in their businesses.

Irene, one of the members, has a modest store where she tirelessly works every day to be able to help her family.  She tells us that she would like to one day have a larger business where she can invest more money and have more products to offer her clients.

She requests this loan to be able to invest it in buying drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meats and more to be able to supply her business and continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables, meat and more.

loans.name: Anthony Jerry

texts.en:
This is Anthony; he previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase a larger quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages, than those he had in inventory before the loan. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. Now, he has a welding shop, for additional income. He and his wife are working hard to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan, which he will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs of Anthony and his wife. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Anthony hopes to have a happy family, and dreams of having more businesses in the near future. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to resell in his store.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Natsagnyam works out of their home as a tailor. His daughter Altantsetseg, age 26, works as teacher in a local school and his son Nyamsuren, age 22, works at a mining company as an accountant. Mr. Ganbold earns a living by running a taxi service in town. His car has broken down several times recently and he needs a replacement. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to buy an eco-friendly hybrid car to provide taxi service in town. He and his wife are hardworking and modest people.

loans.use: to buy a new car to use in his taxi service.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en: Miraflor is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last three years by selling new and used products people use in their homes. She makes PHP 5,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC last year as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Grace Marie

texts.en:
Grace recently took out a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. The money she earned from this loan was a big help in paying for her children’s education and meeting household expenses. She is applying for a new loan, for PHP 12,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell to her customers. The more items she displays in her store the better she does. This new loan will help her sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her children’s education. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and provide her family with financial stability. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. Anita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Anita has been in this business for 14 years now.

Anita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Anargul

texts.ru: Анаркул 45 лет,вдова. Анаркул родилась в простой и многодетной семье фермера, с детства была самостоятельным ребенком и помогала матери по уходу за домом. Анаркул получила среднее образование в школе. С мужем они воспитали детей, двоих сыновей. Сыновья являются остаются надежной опорой для матери после смерти матери. По характеру Анаркул очень жизнерадостная добрая и честная женщина.С 1996 года Анаркул начала заниматься животноводством. Их начальный капитал составлял 15,000 сом(KGS) они закупили овец. Благодаря их трудолюбию и целеустремленности на сегодняшний день у них в очень успешное хозяйство. По мимо этого Анаркул активно занимается растениеводством, на сегодняшний день они обрабатывают более чем 6,0 га земли. Геде ежегодно сеют пшеницу корьофель и кормовые культуры. Ежемесячный доход семьи составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Анаркул обратилась в Компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)на покупку овец и теленка. За счет доходов от полученного кредита планируют увеличить поголовье скота и соответственно улучшить условия жизни.
texts.en:
Anarkul is 45 years old and a widow.  She was born in a very simple farming family with many children.  From a young age she was an independent child and she helped her mother to take care of the household. She has a high school education.  She and her husband have raised two sons who have been a reliable source of support since the grandmother passed away.  By nature, Anarkul is a very lively, kind and honest woman.  

Anarkul has been involved in animal husbandry since 1996. She and her husband started this business with an initial capital of 15,000 som (KGS) with which they bought some sheep.  Thanks to their hard work and their determination, the farm is now very successful.  Beside animal husbandry, Anarkul is also actively involved in agriculture.  Her family now cultivates more than 6 hectares (14.82 acres) of land on which they sow wheat, potatoes and plants for forage, every year. The family's monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).

In order to increase their headcount of livestock, Anarkul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) with which she will purchase sheep and calves.  With the earnings from the loan that she has received, she is planning to increase her headcount of livestock and, as a result, improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock for her farm.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso is a 23-year-old resident of Langub, Calamba. Celso helps his family's needs from the little amount of 2,000 PHP he gains monthly from the rice production business he's had for 2 years. However this year he has been a member of GDMPC, and he applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP at GDMPC Microfinance to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer. Celso wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miralon

texts.en:
For over four years in Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Miralon, a 40-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Recently, Miralon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. Her previous loan was a big help to her personal and business expenditures. She now has a direct-selling business for additional income. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario dreams to expand her business and hopes to live a good and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and married.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dried fish and general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her business.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and sell-dried fish and general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and ready-to-wear.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tuvshindelger

texts.en:
Tuvshindelger is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 4 sons in Ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Tuvshinbayar, age 36, works at a road construction company. Her 3 sons Tuvshinbayar, age 9, Bat-Erdene, age 6, and Batzorig, age 5, go to the local primary school. Her youngest son Bat-Orgil, age 2, goes to the local kindergarten.

Tuvshindelger has graduated domestic college as a cobbler. She has been working in a local company as cobbler and now she is starting her own business at home. She will sell her products in Orhon province and will also take orders from local customers.

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and inventory to start her own business as a cobbler. She is hardworking, open-minded and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine and inventory to start her own business as a cobbler.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is married and has six children. She is 32 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba. Elma is a farmer and she operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earns 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Elma joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Elma hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana works hard to support her family. Diana is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Diana has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle. Diana has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Diana would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is from Poblacion, Plaridel. She is 42 years old. Delia is married and has 4 children. 

To make a living, Delia is running a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Delia has been in her business for 4 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Delia is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc. This year, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married with 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Trinidad is 44 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Trinidad has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Trinidad has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Terry Ben

texts.en:
Terry Ben works hard to support her family. Terry Ben is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Terry Ben has been in this business for 10 years now.

Terry Ben requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, Terry Ben would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to start up another business for additional income. Her food stall is already starting and continuously growing. She is working hard to provide income for her children.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia hopes that her business will grow and she dreams that her family will be whole again. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe HEREMAKONO sont essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à MAMASSONI, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont  bien dénoués.
ADIARATOU (assise) 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax et real dans ce groupe de femmes, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 pièces de pagnes wax auprès des grossistes. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the HEREMAKONO group are mostly married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have four children each.  Most of them live in  polygamous families in Mamassoni, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  This is their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and they are taking this loan to meet the needs of their customers.  Previous loans were all successfully concluded.

Among this group of women, Adiaratou sells wax-print and "real-wax pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics).  In the photo, she is sitting in the second position from the left.  She is a well-known seller and her goods are in high demand.

With her loan, she is planning to buy ten sets of wax-print "pagnes" from wholesalers.  She resells door-to-door and within her family, for cash or on credit, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 22,500 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy wax-print "pagnes"

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
This is Renato. He is 42 years old and a resident of Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rose who is a housewife. They have four children. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. He is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Renato has a buy and sell business where he sells pocket books, newspaper, candies and cigarettes. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy products such as candies, cigarettes, newspaper and pocket books. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Renato hopes to expand his business and dreams to be prosperous in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products such as candies, cigarettes, newspaper and other products needed in his business

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: El esposo de doña Rosa trabaja de tornero en una empresa de plásticos y le favorece a ella por que los productos que ella vende los compra en esa misma empresa un poco más favorable, ya sus dos hijos trabajan, el negocio de doña Rosa es siempre vender productos de plásticos para el hogar y ropa por encargo de sus clientes, en esta solicitud de crédito desea invertir en artículos escolares ropa y calzado nuevo, piscina inflables, esto para aprovechar la temporada escolar y de paso la de verano que se aproxima y ayudarse con las ventas para genera más ingresos y apoyar  a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa's husband works as a lathe operator in a plastics company and he benefits her because he buys the products that she sells from his company at a more favorable rate. Presently, their two children are working. Rosa's business invariably consists of selling plastic products for the home and clothing by customer request. For this loan, she wants to invest in school supplies, clothing, new shoes, and inflatable pools in order to take advantage of the school season, and in passing, the approaching summer; she will also use this loan in help herself with sales in order to generate more income and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, school shoes, and inflatable pools.

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Mr. Chinzorig is 22 years old and lives alone in a Ger in the Arhangai Province of Mongolia. He has been working as an assistant in his sister's organic dairy products sales business in a local market. He purchases organic dairy products from herders around town with his car and sells them for retail price. He is now planning to start his own business of selling organic dairy products at a rental counter at the local market. He is requesting a loan of 2'000'000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products from herders to sell in the local market. He is a hardworking, friendly and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products from herders to sell in a local market

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. Her previous loan was a big help, in covering her business and personal expenditures. Her business expanded, and she was able to add more products to her inventory. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy additional merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, to resell. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia dreams of expanding her business further, and having a Product Center, where she will need a big amount. She also hopes to have a happy family, enjoying good relationships with one another. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, that she will resell in her business.

loans.name: Randolph

texts.en:
Randolph is from Labo, Ozamiz City. He is 46 years old and married, and he has two children. To make a living, Randolph owns and operates a general store. Randolph has engaged in his business for three years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

Randolph joined GDMPC in 2011. He is requesting a loan of 15,500 PHP to purchase new items and thereby expand his product offerings. He plans to use the additional profit generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new items and thereby expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 30 years old and lives with her family in the province of Bohol, Philippines. Lolita earns income through her hog raising business. Lolita wants to take out a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising venture. Lolita hopes that she will be able to pay her loan on time so that she can take another one for the continuous expansion of the business. Moreover, Lolita wants to save money for the school expenses of her four children.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Rhonel

texts.en:
Rhonel, 26 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin. He has one child. He is earning a living from his transport service business. He has been in the motorcycle transport services business for almost two years, and he earns 5,000 a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 8,500 PHP from GDMPC, having joined in 2012. He will use the loan to obtain accessories and tires. He hopes to expand his business, before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Sarah is married and has three children. To make a living, Sarah is selling used products such as ready-to-wear clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, lotions and many other products. Sarah has been in her business for 10 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. Sarah joined GDMPC in 2008 and is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to buy more stocks of lotion, perfumes etc to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotion, perfumes etc to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is a 50-year old resident of Mailen, Clarin. Luz provides for her 6 children's needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business she's had for 3 years. However, in 2011 she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance for 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise. Luz wants to expand to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is married, 34 years of age, and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her 3 kids. Analyn buys and sells hanging rice (puso), a rice that is wrapped with coconut leaves. She has been in this business for 7 years and she earns 7,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Analyn will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Erlindo

texts.en:
Erlindo is married with 3 children. Erlindo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Erlindo is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earn 5,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Erlindo has been a member of GDMPC since 2012. In the future, Erlindo hopes to gain double his current income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Merry Mhae

texts.en: Merry Mhae is from Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Merry Mhae owns and operates a bicycle transport service. Merry Mhae has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month for these activities. Merry Mhae is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase spare parts and accessories for her bicycle. In 2011, Merry Mhae joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her bicycle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and married with six children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell and fertilizers for her sugarcane.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell and fertilizers for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Nefelonbert

texts.en:
Nefelonbert lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He earns income through providing transportation services to support the needs of his three children. He has been doing this for three years. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 26-year old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy, except to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Nefelonbert borrows amount of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2011. 

His plan in the future is to hopefully improved his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. Her previous loan was a big help to her rug making business. She was able to make more rugs as she expanded her inventory. She also has a small store where she sells different vegetables and dried fish. She is working hard to give a good future to her children.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She will also use the loan to buy different vegetables and dried fish. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mary Jane hopes that her business will grow bigger. She dreams to give her children a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en: Zulola is a very sociable and clever woman. She is 21 years old, divorced, with no children. Zulola lives with her parents and wants to get a higher education because she wants to have a good career. After graduating from school she enrolled at the Tajikistan University of Business and Politics. She is a third-year student in the faculty of Accounting and Auditing. Zulola is a very smart and active student. She takes part in many competitions through the University. Her hobby is reading books, and she also plays sport. Zulola needs money to pay for her tuition as her parents can’t support her. She is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Sinfonia Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Sinfonía” está conformado por 23 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, feriantes, repostería, venta de articulos varios, venta de cosméticos, venta de articulos plásticos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Lorena, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el sexto lugar de derecha a izquierda detrás de ella está la muralla y la ventana, viste chaleco de color negro, su cabello lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de repostería, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa todos los días, y en estos momentos se encuentra ampliando una parte de su casa para tener su local, ella ofrece empanadas, confitería artesanal, curantos (Plato tradicional del archipiélago de Chiloé, que se prepara en un hoyo, donde se introducen piedras que son calentadas al rojo vivo, antes de introducir una variedad de mariscos, siendo almejas, cholgas, navajuelas y picorocos los más habituales, que se cubren con hojas de panque o parra).
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en supermercados y distribuidoras donde encuentra lo necesario para su repostería y sus curantos a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería y materiales de construcción.
Una de las metas de Lorena es terminar su ampliación para colocar su local y atender a su clientela de manera ordenada.
Lorena vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 14 y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local para generar más ingresos para su familia y darles una buena educación a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en sus negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en: The “Sinfonía” ("Symphony") community bank consists of 23 entrepreneurs who make a living in different trades, among which are selling clothes, selling at flea markets, pastry-making, selling general supplies, selling cosmetics, selling plastics as well as other services. All of the members are from the city of Puerto Montt, Chile. Lorena, seen standing in the second row of the photo in the sixth spot from right to left in front of the window and wearing a black jacket, has made a living in pastry-making for the past 10 years. She says she works at home every day and at the moment is expanding a portion of her home to set up a store. She offers empanadas, artisan confectionery and curantos (a traditional dish from the Chiloe archipelago off the coast of Chile that is prepared in a pit with red-hot stones and seafood is thrown in - clams and mussels being most common - and then covered with leaves and vines). She purchases her supplies from supermarkets and distributors to get what she needs for her pastries and curantos at a low cost, making it economically desirable. With the loan, she plans to purchase more supplies as well as construction materials. One of Lorena's goals is to finish her expansion so she can set up her store and tend to her customers in a more orderly manner. Lorena lives with her husband and their four children, ages 21, 19, 14 and 8. Her dream for her career is to have her own store to generate more profits for her family and to pay for her children's education. She is very content and feels grateful for the opportunity provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, since it allows her to invest in her business. She says that the training she has received has been essential for her business as well as her personal development, since she has learned to better organize and manage her profits and investments. Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile located in the region of Los Lagos. Among the city's attractions are its beautiful green landscapes, its uncrowded beaches, its cuisine - especially its reputation for fish and seafood - and its arts and crafts. It is also the gateway to Greater Chiloe Island, rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Marcos Eliseo

texts.es:
El señor Marcos Eliseo esta soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 6 grados de educación, se dedica a la venta de hot-dog, gaseosa, tortillas para tacos, ingredientes varios  y otros tipos de comida y bebidas, inicio este negocio siendo trabajador, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo moral de su familia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá la para la compra de insumos para su venta, compra de pan, de hot-dog, pan de hamburguesas, aguas gaseosas, y otos productos necesarios para mejorar sus ventas. espera en el futuro tener otras carretas para realizar la venta de mas comida y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
This gentleman, Marcos Eliseo, is 27 years old and single. He attended school until the 6th grade, and has a business selling hot dogs, sodas, taco shells, various ingredients and other types of food and beverage. Marcos Eliseo has gained five years experience since starting his business and has the moral support of his family.

Marcos Eliseo is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for his cart. He will buy bread, hot-dogs, hamburger buns, sodas and other products needed to improve his sales. In the future he hopes to own more carts, so that he can increase food sales and improve his profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 45 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ritchel is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ritchel has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en: Enkhtaivan, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on another person’s plot of land. He has a wheel repairing service for local people and in his operating area there is no other business providing the same service so he generates quite a reasonable amount of income for his family. In order to generate more income he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase welding apparatus as well as build a passage for automobiles which come for service. The welding apparatus can contribute to work efficiency and the passage built for automobiles can increase consumer satisfaction and ease overall work. As a result, he can generate more income for his family and invest in his daughters’ education. In the future, he has a goal of expanding his wheel repairing business.

loans.use: To purchase welding apparatus and build a passage for automobiles

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es de la Ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante ya que se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de primera necesidad y otros artículos, tiene un Autoservice con una gran clientela, el señor es separado tiene un hijo adolescente y vive en casa propia con su hijo.
 Es una persona con muy buenas referencias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en esa zona. Es muy conocido por ser una persona muy servicial y amable.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para poder surtir su negocio, como ser bebidas,  verduras, carnes, panificados y demás y así seguir trabajando y vendiendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is a businessman from the city of Pilar. He buys and sells essential goods and various items, and has a general store with a large clientele. Francisco is separated from his wife and lives in his own home with his teenage son.  

Francisco has very good references, and over 10 years experience in his field of work. He is well known for being a very helpful and friendly gentleman.
He is requesting this loan to purchase basic necessities to supply his store, such as beverages, vegetables, meats, breads and other items in order to keep working and offering good products to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, vegetables, meats, breads and other items

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mercedes de 33 años de edad, originaria de León, soltera, madre de 3 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y pulpería. Inicio con capital propio, vendiendo ropa nueva de forma ambulante, negocio que le genera mucho ingresos, ya que con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de ropa, decidió emprender  otro negocio como es el de la pulpería, de la que es propietaria hace más de 20 años, este ha sido su segundo  negocio,  con mucho esfuerzo propio ha podido  sacar adelante su negocio y establecer la pulpería en su casa.
La temporada escolar se acerca y necesita surtir su negocio con nuevos productos escolares para la escuela. Por esta razón ella está solicitando el  financiamiento para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, lápiz, colores, borradores, marcadores, ropa, granos básicos para vender en su pulpería. Su objetivo es ir agregando más productos que son muy demandados por sus clientes y lograr obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 33, is originally from León. She is a single mother with three children and works as a saleswoman, selling clothes and groceries. She started this business with her own money, and by selling clothes in the streets. This business gave her good income, and with the profits she decided to start a groceries store in her house twenty years ago. The store is her second business and with a lot of effort she has been able to succeed with it.

The school season is approaching now and she needs to restock her business with school supplies. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, pens, pencils, colored pencils, erasers, marker pens, clothes and basic grains for her store. Her goal is to offer more products demanded by her customers and in this way obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, clothes and basic grains for her store.

loans.name: Delgerdalai

texts.en: Mrs.Delgerdalai is 36 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a small house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband Uuganbayar, age 33, helps his wife to run her business of organic dairy product sales in the local market. Her daughter Ariun-Erdene, age 16, is a senior student of the local secondary school. The borrower has been running her organic dairy product sales business at a rental counter of a local market since 2010. She purchases organic dairy products from herders, collects them in her husband's car and sells to local retailers as well as her retail counter at the local market. She is now requesting a loan of 4’000’000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products from herders outside the province center. She and her husband are hardworking people who say "Our daughter will be enrolling in university next year and we need to save for her education"

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic dairy products from herders outside the province center to sell at your retail counter.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. She previously accessed a loan which helped a lot in her tailoring business. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed for her tailoring business. She will also use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her direct selling business. Her profits from these 2 businesses will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lilian hopes to be successful in all her business endeavors and dreams to have a peaceful and united family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old and married with three children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more snack food, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more snack food, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Enkh-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Enkh-ochir is 49 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. His wife has the position of manager at a private business entity. His son is a monk and after studying Buddhism in India, came back to Mongolia so that he can teach at the school of religion. Enkh-ochir has been working as a serviceman at the police auto service department for five consequent years. Before working at the police auto service department, he worked at other auto service centers in Ulaanbaatar. During his free time, using his vast amount of experience in auto service, he renders auto service to local people. During this time of year, construction materials are at its cheapest price so he is requesting a loan of 1000000 MNT to buy them. Using the construction materials, he wants to build his own house, which is way better than living in a ger, in many ways such as comfort, warmth and space.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his own home.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 30 years old, married with one child.

Eden is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Eden has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eden would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Felipe Chumil Tún

texts.es:
Felipe  es un hombre agricultor de  44 años de edad, el está casado  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene siete  hijos de ellos cuatro varones  la cual uno trabaja independientemente, otro quien es estudiante en el nivel primario en una escuela de su comunidad y dos que trabajan juntos en el campo. Tres hijas  una de ellas también es estudiante de una carrera académica  y dos apoyan en los oficios del hogar.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando zanahoria, papa y remolacha en una parcela que tiene  al lado de su hogar así como en otra parcela que tiene a unos kilómetros de la comunidad. Esto lo aprendió desde que el tenia 10 años trabajando con su primo en la agricultura siendo así su principal trabajo como fuente de ingresos económicos.
Viendo la necesidad de crear y tener su propio cultivo por que el ha visto que el precio y la calidad del producto que cultiva es  buena obteniendo ganancias que le han a poyado al desarrollo económico de su familia. 
El ahora cuenta con 22 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que tiene más oportunidades para ampliar otra parcela.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 9,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de zanahoria y su fertilizante para sembrar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña que en un futuro  pueda emprender un nuevo comercio con el apoyo de su familia así como poder darles los estudios académicos a sus hijos que aun estudian, todo con el fin de tener un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 44 year old farmer. He is married and lives in Sololá. He has seven children, four of them boys. One of them is on his own, another is a student in primary school at a community school and two work with him in the fields. One of his three daughters is a college student and the other two help out at home. 

He is a farmer who grows carrots, potatoes and beets on a parcel of land he has next to his house and on another parcel some kilometers from his community. He learned this from the time he was 10 years old, working with his cousin in farming, It has been his main job and source of income.
He saw the need to create and have his own crops because he saw that the price and the quality of the product he grows is making good profits and has helped in the economic development of his family. 
 
Now he has been growing his own crops 22 years and sees that he has another opportunity to expand to another parcel. That is why he is asking for a loan of Q 9,000.00 so he can buy carrot seeds and fertilizer for planting and to harvest, improving his and his family's income. 
 
He dreams of in the future being able to support his family and give his children who are still in school a good education, all of which will be to have a better family development.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesus se encuentra en su ciclo número 4, y gracias a trabajo de todas las miembros están saliendo adelante. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que gracias al trabajo de cada una ayudan a sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Cynthia, quien hace crochet, y con esto mantiene y ayuda a su familia, hace todo tipo de cosas, como ser sobrecamas, prendas, mantelitos los cuales son muy vendidos y solicitados. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y talentosa en lo que hace, es por eso que le va muy bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos y agujas para poder seguir haciendo su crochet, el cual es su sostén.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Jesus is in its 4th cycle and thanks to the hard work of all of its members, they are all getting ahead. They are women who are heads of household and thanks to the work each of them does, they help their families.
 
One of them is Cynthia, who crochets. That is how she supports and helps her family. She does all kinds of things, such as bedspreads, clothing, and tablecloths, which sell well and are in demand. She is a very hardworking person and talented at what she does and that is why it is going well for her.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying thread and needles to keep doing her crochet, which is her support.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles.

loans.name: Filomena Ester

texts.es:
La señora Filomena Ester esta casada, tiene 42 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene  4 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a prestar servicios de trasporte de encomiendas a diferentes lugares, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien  se dedica a la entrega de encomiendas.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de muebles necesarios para su negocio de encomiendas, ya que su negocio tiene demanda y quiere comprar estantes para colocar y resguardar las encomiendas que recibe, las cuales tiene que entregar en diferentes destinos. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio mas grande con otros locales.
texts.en:
Filomena Ester is married. She is 42 years old and has six years of primary education. She has 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She works running a delivery service to different places. She started this business thanks to the support of her husband and has 8 years experience. She has her husband's support who also does deliveries.  

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy furniture she needs for her delivery business. She has demand and wants to buy some shelves to keep the items she delivers that will be sent to different places. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business with more locales.

loans.use: to buy shelves.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La Sra. Agueda tiene 39 años, está casada con el Sr. Juan, aun no tuvieron la bendición de tener hijos. El Sr. Juan tiene una herrería en su casa desde el año 2003, la Sra. Agueda se dedica a la venta en forma ambulante de prendas de vestir y calzados para damas, caballero y niños desde el año 2007. Ambos por medio de su trabajo ayudan con los gastos de la casa y están saliendo adelante.
Agueda solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  camisas, blusas, jeans, bermudas y calzados deportivos para damas, caballeros y niños y de esta forma poder tener una mejor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agueda, 39, is married to Juan and they have no children.  Juan has been running a blacksmith's shop out of his house since 2003 and Agueda is a street vendor who sells women's, men's and children's clothing and shoes.  She has been in business since 2007.  Through their respective jobs, both contribute toward household expenses in their effort to get ahead.

Agueda is requesting a loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, bermudas and sport shoes for women, men and children.  This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's and children's clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Alegres se encuentra en el Tercer Ciclo con  21 integrantes. Cada una tiene su respectiva actividad, pero también trabajan juntas para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma hacer un poco más ligera la carga del grupo.
Gladys es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que ella siempre apoya a sus compañeras en todo lo que puede y que les insta a poder seguir con sus negocio y que no se desanimen, ella por su parte se dedica a la lavandería, Lava muchas prendas por día, cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que por medio de esto ayuda a su familia. Su meta es seguir en el grupo e ir creciendo.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes, aromatizantes para prendas y demás, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo su trabajo y dando a sus clientes buena atención.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Alegres, comprised of 21 members, is in its third loan cycle.  Each member has her own business but they also help each other mutually to make the group's burden a little lighter.

Gladys is the president of the group and says she helps her colleagues as much as possible, encouraging them to continue with their businesses and not to become disappointed.  She has a laundry service and washes many loads every day.  Hers is a very self-sacrificing job, but it is how she helps her family.  Her goal is to continue in the group and to keep growing.

She is requesting a loan to buy soaps, softeners, and fresheners for the clothing, and other items.  This is so she can continue doing her job and providing good customer service.

loans.use: To buy soaps, softeners and fresheners for her laundry business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used sweaters to make into thread.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. She is 55 years old and a mother of a grown son. Marina earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area.
Marina is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, toiletries and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her store and augment her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, toiletries and other items for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Raquel has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Raquel aspires to save enough to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Maftunakhon

texts.en: Maftunakhon is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She graduated from school 2 years ago and entered the Technology University of Tajikistan. She studies at the school of Engineering and is in year 2 of her studies. She is one of the more active and well-rounded students. She likes math and all exact sciences. Her friends love her because Maftunakhon is very kind. Her parents do not have enough income to pay for her education. She is asking for a loan to pay her tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread, leather, etc. to make gloves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 51 years old and married with three children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing PHP 9500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
