Shirley has been raising pigs for 21 years and also earns additional income from clothing sales and tricycle transportation businesses.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.ru:
Вадим занимается тепличным хозяйством в селе Приветное. У него есть участок земли в 1.1 гектара, на котором он выращивает ранние помидоры, кабачки, перец и капусту. После высадки рассады в грунт, Вадим в теплицах выращивает раннюю капусту, собирая урожай уже где-то в мае.  
Сумма в 12 000 гривен ему понадобилась для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, удобрения и реконструировать теплицу. Вадиму нравится заниматься своим делом, работать на земле и выращивать овощи. Он надеется продолжать заниматься любимым делом, по возможности расширяя свое тепличное хозяйство.
texts.en:
Vadim continues his greenhouse farming in the village of Privetnoye. He owns 1.1 hectares of land where he cultivates early tomatoes, squash, peppers and cabbage. After transplanting seedlings from the greenhouses into an open field, Vadim uses the greenhouses to grow early cabbage, which he harvests some time in May.

He needs the sum of 12,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers, and rebuild a greenhouse. Vadim enjoys working for himself, taking care of the land and growing vegetables. He hopes to continue in his favourite occupation, expanding his greenhouse farm as circumstances permit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers, and rebuild a greenhouse

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходур житель города Вахдат. Он 29 - летний женатый человек. Баходур живет с женой. Он является отцом троих детей. Жена Баходура домохозяйка. Она занимается домашним хозяйством, также она воспитанием маленьких детей. 
Баходур имеет средне - техническое образование. Он занимается покраской автомобилей. Этим видом деятельности Баходур занимается шесть лет. Он арендует помещение, где открыл собственную авто-мастерскую. Баходур в первые получает кредит в Хумо. Он берет кредит для приобретения специального аппарата для покраски машин, чтобы облегчить свою работу, а также с экономить время для того чтобы обслуживать всех своих постоянных клиентов за короткое время.
texts.en:
Bahodur resides in the city of Vahdat. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Bahodur's wife takes care of the household and looks after the small kids. 

Bahodur has vocational secondary education. For the past six years, he has been painting automobiles in his workshop, which he runs at a rented location. This is Bahodur's first loan from MLO Humo. He is taking it to purchase special equipment for painting cars, which will make his work easier and enable him to serve all his regular clients faster.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for painting cars

loans.name: Santa Monica Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Monica se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo.La señora Dora es un  ejemplo de perseverancia y del empeño que pone para progresar es por eso que el grupo ha decidido nombrarla directora desde este ciclo.
Dora se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas le está yendo muy bien. Cuenta Dora que ella siempre ayuda a su grupo y que juntas y con el trabajo de todas están saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas. Ella está contenta por esta oportunidad que les dan, ya que también de esta forma ayudan a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Santa Monica stands out for its solidarity and desire to get ahead as a group.  Since Dora is an example of perseverence and hard work, the group decided to appoint her director of the group for this loan cycle.

Dora has a food business which has attracted many customers.  Thanks to her delicious cooking, business is going well.  Dora says she always tries to help her group and, together, they are getting ahead in their respective businesses.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, condiments, vegetables and other supplies to make the food she sells.  She is grateful for this opportunity which also helps other families.

loans.use: To buy meats, condiments, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Tembiapora Group

texts.es:
Las señoras del comité invertirán para mejorar sus puestos de trabajos y las que aun no tiene quieren iniciar con este pequeño crédito algún puesto de ingreso para ellas y sus familias.La señora Maria es una Ama de Casa con mucho deseo de empezar a trabajar y este crédito lo utilizará para poner un pequeño puesto de ventas de comestibles y con esto podrá ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
Ella es una persona que desea salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Desea poder luchar por ellos.
texts.en:
Some of the women in this group will use the loan to improve their businesses, while those who have not set up business yet will use it to establish themselves and make an income for their families.  

Maria is a homemaker who wants to start working.  She will use the loan to set up a small food stall so she can help the family cover household expenses. She wants to get ahead and help her family lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To set up a food stall.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
El comité Vya Renda es de Ciudad del Este, tiene 10 integrantes que se esfuerzan y trabajan por salir adelante. Una de ellas es Adalvina quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos.
Ella cuenta que gracias a su grupo está mejorando, pues las capacitaciones la han ayudado mucho, también ella apoya mucho a sus compañeras para salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas y variedad de calzados, ya que con eso se surtirá y podrá tener un buen stock que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y dice que la aprovechara.
texts.en: The Vya Renda committee is in Ciudad del Este and is made up of 10 members, all of whom devote all their efforts and hard work to getting by.  One of them is Adalvina, who sells clothing and shoes.  She says that, with the help of her group, her situation is improving, and the training sessions have helped her tremendously.  She also supports her colleagues in their efforts to get by.  She is seeking this loan to buy clothing and a range of footwear with which to replenish her stock and offer greater choice to her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and is determined to make the most of it.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: This time, Josephine is applying for a loan in the amount of Php 29500 to buy ingredients for her food production business. This business was previously funded through Kiva field partner, NWTF, and continues to provide for Josephine and her family the income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Hermocilla

texts.en:
Hermocilla is 40 years old and married with four children.

Hermocilla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Hermocilla has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.
Hermocilla aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
This is Jennie. Her previous loan was a big help in her variety store. She was able to add more stocks to her inventory. She now has a direct selling business for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennie is hoping for more success in her business. She dreams of having a happy family with the guidance of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is a thirty-six-year-old farmer in the Kitale county of Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children who are all in school.  She has been in farming for the past six years producing milk, vegetables, bananas and poultry products which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will provide her with more milk and earn her extra income.  This will help her lift her living standards and also use some of the money to pay for her children's schooling.  She aspires to expand her farm and increase the number of dairy cows in the next five years.
Diseases, high cost of production and high cost of feeds are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Armida works hard to support her family.
She has a Vulcanizing Shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Armida is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy other tools and materials for her vulcanizing shop.

Armida has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other tools and materials for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, thread and sewing materiels for her boutique business.

loans.name: Adalat

texts.ru: Адалат 64 год, вдова, мать троих детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Адалат с 1985 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 300 сом (KGS) купив одного теленка . На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Адалат имеется 4 коровы и 1,3 га обрабатываемой земли. На посевной земле Адалат ежегодно сажает хлопок и кукурузу.  Перепродажа скота и разведение скота приносит 15,000-20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Адалат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, оплату труда наемным рабочим  и на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Адалат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет покупки скота. В планах у розы улучшить жилищные условия и сделать ремонт.
texts.en:
Adalat is 64 years old. She is a widow and mother of three children. As the main source of income for her family, Adalat has been raising livestock since 1985, having started her business by purchasing a single calf for 300 som (KGS). At the moment, she keeps 4 cows and has 1.3 hectares of arable land, where she annually plants cotton and corn. By breeding and reselling livestock, she earns 15,000-20,000 som (KGS) per month.

In order to continue developing her business, Adalat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers, pay salaries to hired help, and purchase livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business by buying additional livestock. In the future, she plans to improve her living conditions and carry out repairs in her home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, to pay her employees, and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Avish

texts.en:
Mrs. Avish is a 51-year-old widow who lives with her 3 daughters in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband passed away a few months ago. Her older daughter, Anargul, age 23, works in a local company, daughter Kumisgul, age 21, studies in university and youngest daughter, Ardah, age 13, goes to a local school.

Avish has been running various businesses for the last 10 years. She has temporarily stopped her shoe manufacturing business for the last few months because of her husband passing away. She is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase inventory to restart her own handcraft business. She is a clever, hardworking and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to restart her own handcraft business

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Over the past year, a unique idea came to Fadi's mind, which is recycling used oil from restaurants and reselling it to local manufacturers to make animal food. This idea will reduce the remnants of everyday life and use it in a very innovative way.

Fadi is a 30-year-old married man and a father to four sons and two daughters. He took a USD Youth loan from FATEN to buy more used oil and large bottles.

Fadi appears in the photo while he is working.

loans.use: to buy more rough materials to sell

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is 40 years old and lives in Estrella Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
To earn a living, Sabrina has a business selling street foods. She earns about PHP 1400 each month doing this type of work. Sabrina has requested a loan to purchase additional foods such as bread, buko juice, etc.
Sabrina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Sabrina would like to be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods to sell such as bread, buko juice,etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old. She is a widow with two children. The oldest is 24 and the youngest is 21.

She has been in business for 19 years. She wants a loan to buy more fruit to sell. The profits from the business will pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33 years old and married with two children who are young in age.  They are presently residing at Caticugan, Siquijor.

She has been engaged in a general store business for more than two years and earns two thousand pesos as a monthly net income.

She had been a member of PMPC for two years and has good credit records.  Now, she has requested a loan amount of five thousand pesos only to purchase different goods for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase different goods for her general store

loans.name: Hildebrand

texts.en: Hildebrand is 32 years old and he has a fiancé. He has been in business for four years. He wants a loan to buy more fruit to sell. The profits from the business will go towards his savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly is a 53-year-old single mother with one child and lives in San Isidro Sinacaban, the Philippines. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 1600 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

Belly has requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Costique

texts.en: Costique is 33 years old. He is married, with two children. The oldest is eight and the youngest is four. His wife sells food goods. He has been in business for seven years. He wants a loan to buy more kitchen stuff to sell. The profit will go towards his savings.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: Christelle

texts.fr: Christelle est une femme de 39 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants agés de 21 ans et 12 ans. Elle possède et gère un kiosque dans un coin de la ville depuis 4 ans où elle vend des crédits de communications. Dynamique et accueillant, elle considère que son stock de crédits est déjà insuffisant pour sa clientèle grandissante. le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs (grossistes d'Orange et de MTN). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et construire de chambre pour les louer sur son terrain d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, santé)
texts.en:
Christelle is 39 years old, single, and mother of two children, ages 21 and 12. She has a stand in her town where she has been selling calling credits for the past four years.

A dynamic and friendly woman, she feels that her stock of credits is too low for her growing customer base. The loan that she is seeking will enable her to buy calling credits in bulk from wholesalers (Orange and MTN).

The profits that she expects to earn will allow her to increase her capital, build a room on her land that she can rent, and support the needs of her family (education, food, health).

loans.use: to buy calling credits

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Living in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Lim is aged 33 and a mother of three children. She is dedicated to the family's farming business, working alongside her spouse on their land. Lim can farm the land twice a year due to the main source of water from a nearby river, which is favorable for growing rice and other seasonal crops. She has no difficulties with her farming because she has been doing it for almost 20 years already.

Lim is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) to buy a cow and for the maintenance of the rice field. With the financial support of the loan, she will invest in her farming business to improve her earnings and better her quality of life. Her dream is to one day expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow and maintain her rice field.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married, with four children. Lilia is 53 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

To earn a living, Lilia has a Buy and Sell business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000. Lilia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

In the future, Lilia hopes to save for the family's personal consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en:
Vergilita is married with 5 children. Vergilita is 65 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Vergilita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns 6,000.00 PHP every month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soft drinks, and detergents.

Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Vergilita hopes to save for the future and for her family's personal consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soft drinks, and detergents.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is 52 years old. She is a widow with 11 children. The oldest is 32 and the youngest is 20. She has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to buy more goods such as rice and sugar for her retail store. The profits will go toward her savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka, 45, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children who are all in school. She has been farming for the past ten years, producing milk, horticultural products and poultry products which she sells at the local market in her area. She owns a motorbike for a transportation business as an additional source of income.

She is requesting for 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will produce more milk and earn her extra income to uplift her living standards. She will use some of the money to pay her children's school fees. She aspires to have expanded her farm by two more acres of land in the next five years.

High costs of inputs and fluctuating market prices are her major challenges in farming.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Medalla Milagrosa ” están  en el Décimo Segundo Ciclo  con 16  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  las mismas cuentan con actividades  diferentes, y realizan labores para la recaudación de fondos para el comité.
Fatima es parte de este grupo, ella vende todo tipo de bebidas, y comenta que cada vez le va mejor, ya que con el clima cálido tiene mejores ventas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde joven ha trabajado y no teme a ningún desafío.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, energizantes y demás bebidas para poder surtir su negocio con más variedad de ellas.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagroa communal bank is in its 12th cycle with 16 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive, and responsible.  The members have different business activities, and they do work to raise funds for their group.

Fatima is part of this group.  She sells all types of drinks.  She says that it keeps getting better and better for her because with the hot weather she has improved sales.  She is a very hard-working person.  Ever since she was young she has worked, and she is not afraid of any challenge. 

She is requesting this loan to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, energy drinks, and other drinks in order to be able to stock her business with a greater variety of drinks.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, energy drinks, and other drinks.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 35 years old. She is single with three children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest is 9. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy clothes such as skirts, sweaters, and pants. The profit will assist her in paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Gaza City with his wife. Mohammad gets a low salary from his job. This salary does not cover all the family's needs. Mohammad would like to buy window frames for the family home.

Mohammad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his living conditions.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy window frames for his house.

loans.name: Karume Group

texts.en:
Lusia, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three school-going children. She has been selling sarongs, fabrics and chapati (flat bread) for 15 years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Lusia used the previous loans to pay her children's school fees, buy a plot of land and build a small house. She also bought more sarongs and fabrics as well as two bags of baking flour and a bucket of cooking oil for making more chapati and a sack of charcoal. She has paid all her loans successfully. She requests a loan to  buy more sarongs and fabrics to resell. Her dream is to one day own a clothing shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karume" with 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sarongs and fabrics to resell.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en:
Seham is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Sameeh, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Seham is a 45-year-old Palestinian married woman. She lives in Qalqilia with her husband and five children, including three sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and two of her sons are municipality workers with low salaries. 

Seham is requesting a $1,000 loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will enable Seham and her family to buy comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 33 years old. She is a widow with four children, the oldest is age 13 and the youngest is age 5. She has been running a canteen business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more sodas, milk and juice. The profit will go towards paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more soda, milk and juice for sale.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha, 62, lives in Lagodekhi District with his wife and grown son. In fact, there is no source of income in the family at the moment as all of the family members are unemployed. Vazha used to have a car and served the local people as a taxi driver but his business has recently stopped, and because of financial problems, he sold the car. 

He decided to re-start his business because his family's living conditions are poor. Vazha’s loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program aims to provide business start-up and re-startup loans with more favorable conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to standard credit, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. With this loan, Vazha will purchase a car and offer a service to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. The family will also have enough income to use the usual sources of credit in the country should they need to do so.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “MARÍA AUXILIADORA” se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa con 15 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción; todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas y también trabajan juntas como grupo.
Myriam es la presidenta de este grupo y comenta que gracias a las capacitaciones que reciben están mejorando sus negocios. Ella ayuda a sus amigas en todo lo que puede para que puedan seguir trabajando. Myriam se dedica a la venta de bolsos de mujer, y con esto ayuda a su familia, tiene muy buena venta y siempre está llena de pedidos, gracias a su habilidad como vendedora le está yendo muy bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bolsos de distintos tipos y marcas y de esa forma seguir teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora groupis in its fifth program cycle. It has 15 members, and is located in the Asuncion zone. All of the members carry on their own businesses and also work together as a group. 

Myriam is the president of this group, and comments that thanks to the assistance they receive they are improving their businesses. She helps her friends in all she can so that they can continue working. Myriam works selling handbags, and with this helps her family. She makes good sales and always has plenty of orders. Thanks to her ability as a saleswoman it is going very well for her. 

She is asking for a loan to buy various types and brands of handbags and in this way to continue to have the means to help her family.

loans.use: to buy women's handbags for resale.

loans.name: Esinyen

texts.en:
Esinyen is a 36-year-old farmer in the county of Kitale in Kenya where he lives with his wife and three school-going children. He has been in farming for the past four years producing milk, vegetables, maize, beans and poultry products, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 61,200 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds and to also buy and insure a dairy cow. This will give him more products and help him earn more income to uplift his family's living standards. He will use some of the money to pay for his children's school fees. He plans to buy two more dairy cows in the next five years.

Diseases and poor markets for his products are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 31 years old. She lives with her husband, two children and father-in-law in a small village in the district of Kaspi. Her husband, George, works as a baker and earns a monthly income. Gulnaz has two milk cows. She produces cheese and sells it in an open market at a good price. She is a very hardworking young woman and has much experience in her business. 

Gulnaz has requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, she will produce more cheese and increase her sales. Thus, her family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gulnaz awaits you support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 29 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a motorist. She sells fruit, which she has been doing for two years. Fatuma is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fruits to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire, 26, is a farmer in Kitale County, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and one child, who is in school. She has been farming for the past nine years, producing milk, horticultural and poultry products which she sells at the local market in her area. She owns a welding workshop as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give her more milk produce and earn her extra income that will help boost her family's livelihood and pay for her child's education. She aspires to have adopted the modern way of doing dairy farming within the next five years.

Unreliable rainfall and the high cost of production are her major challenges in farming.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding her with this loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Orquideas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Orquídeas, está conformado por tres personas dignas de admiración, que saben salir adelante gracias al emprendimiento y al amor que tienen a sus familias, este grupo ha sabido ganarse el respeto de su comunidad por que ven en ellos un ejemplo a seguir.
La presidenta de este grupo es la señora Wilma una mujer de carácter amable, muy alegre, emprendedora y trabajadora, Wilma es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños a los cuales adora, Wilma como ayuda en la economía del hogar se dedicó a la crianza de animales específicamente cerdos, siendo un negocio sacrificado pero muy rentable, ya que puede ayudar en su hogar y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos.
El crédito que Wilma solicita a FODEMI es para invertir en la compra de más cerdos blancos, para la crianza y la venta, esta inversión ayudara a Wilma a tener más animales para la venta y a mejorar los ingresos en su hogar.
El sueño que Wilma tiene es ver a sus hijos crecer y que sean unas personas de bien, además también quiere hacer su casita en el terreno nuevo para seguir teniendo animales y cuidarlos mejor.
texts.en:
The group “Orquídeas” is composed of three admirable persons that get ahead in life thanks to their entrepreneurial spirit and the love they feel for their families. Its members are respected by their community because they are seen as role models. 

The group’s president is Mrs. Wilma, a kind, joyful, enterprising and hardworking woman. Wilma is married and has two small children that she adores. Wilma started raising livestock (pigs in particular) as a way of helping with the household economy. It is a demanding business but also a profitable one and it allows her to help at home and take care of her children.

Wilma is requesting a loan at FODEMI to invest in buying more white pigs to raise and sell. With this investment, Wilma will have more animals to sell and will improve her family’s income.

Wilma’s dream is to see her children grow to be persons of good character. She would also like to build her house in the new piece of land, keep her animals and take better care of them.

loans.use: to buy white pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 48 years old. He is married with three children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is six. His wife also sells fruits as well. He has been in business for 18 years. He wants a loan to buy more fruits for sell. The profit will assist him in buying a cow.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 39 years old. She is married with three of her own children and two others she takes care of. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is seven. Her husband is a motorist. She has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more used shoes to sell. The profits will assist in feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to resell.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en: Vazha is 40 years old. He lives with his mother, wife and a daughter in the small village of Mtskheta district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell dairy products locally in an open market at a good price. Vazha is very hard working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing piglets and to expand the shed. After the shed is expanded and piglets bought he will be able to increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Vazha awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and to expand the shed

loans.name: Urcisina

texts.en: Urcisina is a 63 year old married woman with 2 grown up children. She is engaged in the coconut wine vending business. Urcisina also sells soft drinks like Pepsi and Coke.She earns 8,000 pesos a month by doing both businesses. She has been in the coconut wine business for 40 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy to buy additional soft drinks, coconut wine and additional capital for load retailer business. Urcisina would like to expand her business in order to save at the same time in preparation of old age.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, coconut wine and additional capital for load retail

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 42 years old and a very hardworking and honest lady. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a responsible mother of 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband owns a shoe shop in the market in which he sells shoes for all age groups.

She has requested a loan for her husband's shop, as he is interested to purchase a variety of shoes to sell. With the profit she will put aside some savings for their children's future.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes to sell

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. Jaafar is the only provider for the family.

Jaafar is a mechanic. He established his business in 2004 and now he has an employee. He has built a good experience in this field and he has an excellent reputation in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with a good education and better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment specialized for his work.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the Chkhorotsku district of West Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her daughter, son, brother-in-law and retired mother-in-law. Lali’s daughter is a student. Lali and her husband run an agricultural business. In particular, they own two calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Lali produces cheese and sells it locally. Besides, the family has a pig and sells piglets seasonally. Also, they have a vineyard and a plot of land where nuts are grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Lali works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. 

With the requested credit, Lali will finance the education of her daughter. Another part of the loan will be used for purchasing fertilizers for her family's nut orchard. After fertilizing and properly caring for her plants, Lali will get high quality harvest and sell it at a good price. This will significantly increase her family's income, improving living conditions for all family members.

loans.use: to fund her daughter's education and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mourreen

texts.en:
Mourreen is aged 29. She is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children who are all schooling. She has been in farming for the past three years, producing poultry and horticultural products that she sells at the local market in her area. She sells second-hand clothes as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. This will give her more produce and help her earn extra income, which will help boost her family's livelihood and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have increased her poultry birds to 2,000 birds in the next five years.

Diseases and the high costs of feeds are her major challenges in farming.

Mourreen is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for its continuous support for its clients.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and some tools to start his own interior design business for local customers.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is 28 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is nine and the youngest is two. Her husband is a mechanic. 

Recently, she established another business, a restaurant, which has been running for three months. She wants a loan to buy goods to use in her restaurant such as rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, potatoes, cooking oil, milk, etc..for her new restraurant.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is aged thirty three and is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children who are both at school. Alex has been in farming for the past fourteen years, producing milk, poultry and horticultural products which he sells to the people in his local area. He also owns a motorbike for transportation as an additional source of income.

He is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more milk produce and earn him extra income which will help uplift his livelihood and use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling, he aspires to have redoubled his production in the next five years.

Unreliable rainfall and poor markets are his major challenges in farming.

Alex is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Warlito Jr.

texts.en: Warlito, a 32-year old, is a married man of Upper Pulacan, Labangan who has 2 children and is earning from his private transport service business. It started almost 3 years ago and he earns 8,000 a month. To improve business, he would like to borrow 50,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit, which he just joined recently, in order to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Mwitanzige Village Bank Group

texts.en: Julius is a 28 year old hardworking man with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. In order to support his growing family he decided to venture into produce business and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees and construct a house for residence. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluction pose a challenge to his business growth while his desire is to own a food store. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Julius intends to use the loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Izo

texts.en: Izo is from the Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 53 years old, a widow and lives with her daughter and son. Izo’s daughter works as a teacher at the local school and gets a monthly salary. Izo runs an agricultural business. In particular, she owns a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Izo produces cheese and sells it locally. Also, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where nuts are grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. Izo works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Izo will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then, the living conditions of her family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Izo hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en: Yvone is 30 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is two. Her husband is unemployed. She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to buy more hair product for clients. The profit will assist her to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy more hair products for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay is from Poblacion, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 39 years old, is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. Jay has been engaged in his business for 6 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Jay joined GDMPC. Jay is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used  to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and pay the school tuition for his children.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married and has three children. She is 65 years old and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Rufina owns and operates a farm, planting, harvesting and selling corn to earn a living. She's been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of business. 

Rufina requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Rufina been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 41 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 7. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy goods used to make fresh bread, such as yeasts and cooking oil for use in order to make more breads. The profit will go toward the children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more yeast and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father to one child. Mouhammad is the only provider for his family. 

Mouhammad owns a small shop for selling spare parts for specific cars. After gaining enough experience in this field from his father, he established his own business in 2006. He built a good experience in this field and has an excellent reputation in his area. 

Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to install a new rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay his shop's annual rent and install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is from Balintawak, Aurora. To make a living, Cerila grows coconuts and bananas to sell, which she has been doing for five years. She earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Cerila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Cerila joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers for growing coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una persona feliz, muy dedicada a su trabajo, responsable para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Guadalupe vive en la ciudad de Ibarra junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Guadalupe se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir, negocio que inicio hace dos años atrás, al momento le está yendo muy bien ya que sus productos los está vendiendo en algunas tiendas de la ciudad de Ibarra.
Guadalupe solicita un crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de tela algodón en cantidad mayores para la realización de sus prendas de vestir camisetas y confeccionar adornos para el hogar como manteles y limpiones para el hogar, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. 
Guadalupe sueña en tener un taller más grande que le permita contratar a más personal y convertirse en una empresa grande y distribuir al por mayor en todo el país y con estos ingresos darles la educación a sus hijos y enseñarles este bonito oficio para que sigan con la tradición.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is content, dedicated to her work, and responsible for improving her family's well being. She lives in the city of Ibarra with her husband and four children. She makes clothing, a business she started a few years ago that is prospering because she is selling to stores in Ibarra. 

Guadalupe is applying to FODEMI for a loan to buy wholesale cotton fabric to make clothing such as t shirts and household items such as tablecloths and towels so that she can increase her sales and earnings. She dreams of having a larger workshop so that she can hire staff, expand her business, and sell her merchandise at wholesale throughout the country. This income would allow her to educate her children and teach them a profession that they can continue.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing such as t shirts and household items such as tablecloths and towels.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Growing up in Africa, Angela has distinct memories of helping her parents run their baby clothing store. She never imagined following in her parents' footsteps until she began to notice that her son had very sensitive skin that reacted to regular baby clothing. Researching organic materials, she discovered bamboo, one of the most sustainable and truly “green” fabrics. She began making clothing from this miracle fabric and her son’s allergies quickly went away.

Inspired by her son’s recovery, Angela began the journey of starting her own business, Angel Green Baby. Two years later, Angela’s business uses bamboo to make a completely organic baby clothing line.
  
Angela’s business is unique and remarkable because she is creating positive change by using green certified and fair trade vendors as well as organic materials. Angela’s vision to create a healthful product for other children like her son was never limited by her lack of money. In spite of her limited credit history and lack of initial capital to finance her clothing line in bulk, she found opportunities to help her business succeed.  

A $4,500 loan through Kiva will enable Angela to purchase additional fabric for her clothing line, allowing her to meet the needs of her growing clientele base, while still creating a positive impact on the earth. The loan will also help Angela reach her goal of moving from selling at local farmers' markets to selling her clothing at reputable local baby clothing stores in San Diego.  

With your help, Angel Green Baby can continue to make a positive impact on both the community and the globe through sustainable and “green” baby clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and begin selling her clothing at local retailers.

loans.name: Saulegul

texts.en: Saulegul is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband Huanish works part-time in a local company. Her daughter Asemgul, age 18, studies at university and Erkebulan, age 15, Ahtuigan, age 13, and Axerkei, age 11, attend a local school. Saulegul has been running her own business of tailoring and handcraft for years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to run her business without pause because of lack of inventory. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run her business without pause because of lack of inventory

loans.name: Mernafe

texts.en: Mernafe is 37 years old. She is single with 1 child. She resides in Poblacion, Aurora. After 5 years of being in a service-based type of business activity, Mernafe earns a monthly income of 8,000. Mernafe has applied for a loan of 45,000 from GDMPC to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Mernafe hopes to expand her business and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev, 37, is married and lives with her family in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom still depends on her income while the other two are already married and earning their own living. Khiev and her husband cooperate well in their business and are very passionate about supporting their family and providing a good education for their children. Khiev is engaged in growing seasonal rice crops whereas her husband provides threshing service with a machine that appears in the photo behind Khiev.

She is requesting a loan of 1,250 USD to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice field. The impact of the financing is that her farming business will be feasible and profitable because she will avoid unnecessary expenses on hiring other villagers’ animals to work on her farm. Her plan for the future is to continue growing her family-owned businesses every day to earn a good income, improve her shelter and provide her family with a comfortable living status.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 26 years old. She is married and has three children. The oldest is 8 and the youngest is 2. Her husband sells shoes. 

She has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more clothes for sale such as skirts, shirts, and pants. The profit will assist in feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque son un recurso importante en el negocio para mejorar y crecer económicamente, el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para las tortillas y para el pan, como maíz, leña, harina,levadura entre otros productos.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener más producción, esto se debió a la compra de productos para hacer el pan y las tortillas, con lo que realizo más ventas y genero mejores ganancias, en su familia se mantiene el número de miembros, pero ahora cuenta con más posibilidades para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is applying for a new loan because it is an important element in improving her business and financial situation. She will use the loan to buy supplies such as corn, wood, flour, and yeast to make tortillas and bread. She was able to increase her production, sales, and earnings by using her previous loan to buy supplies to make bread and tortillas. Her family comprises the same number of people, though now she has more opportunities to improve their well being.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, flour, and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Sheilla Mae

texts.en: For the past 8 years Shiella Mae, a 23-year-old married resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, has raised a variety of crabs to sell. Along with other irregular sources of income, she earns PHP 16,000 a month. Shiella Mae is requesting for a loan of PHP 40,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional crabs to raise. This year she expects to reap a good harvest and obtain a very favorable price for her crabs.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bayarhuu, works in a local company. Her son, Temuujin, age 23, works with his father in the company and her younger son, Temuulen, age 13, goes to a local school. 

Altantsetseg has been running her butcher shop in the rental counter of the local market since 1994. She is popular due to her qualified products in town. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell during holiday season. She is a hardworking, active and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 49 years old, married and has four children. She is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Edna owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials). She has been in her business for seven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC. Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Sandagsuren is 60 years old and lives with his wife and his five sons in an apartment in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Uranchimeg, helps her husband to run their organic vegetable growing and sales business on their plot of land. His oldest son, Myagmardorj, age 24, has graduated university as an IT engineer. Odbayar, age 22, and Od-Orgil, age 20, are university students, and Gantulga, age 17, and Batbileg, age 16, are secondary school students. 

He has been running his organic vegetable growing and sales business since 1992. His wife and their sons help them during their summer vacation. 

His oldest son is now planning to start his own computer service business in town. Sandagsuren is now requesting 4,000,000,MNT to purchase starting inventory for his son's business. He and his family members are all hardworking and optimistic people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his son's new computer service business.

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en:
Sivan is a young Iraqi woman. She is 20 years old, married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sivan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sivan has recently started working with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. Since 2010, she has been slowly building up her clientele. Using an old sewing machine, she enjoys creating custom-ordered dresses and other small fabric household items. To enhance her creativity options, she would like to buy an oversewing machine, which will allow her to offer a greater variety of choices for her customers. She also plans to buy some more quality fabrics and raw materials.

To be able to make the purchase, she took a loan in the amount of $1,400 USD from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.  

Sivan is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy an oversewing machine, more fabrics and raw materials for sewing.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is married and has five children. She lives is Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, Irenia does planting, harvesting, and selling of bananas. She has been in this business for eight years. She has a monthly income of PHP 3,000. 

Irenia is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer. Irenia became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2011. Irenia aims that her business be more productive, so she can get a good return.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow and sell bananas.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 40 years of age, married and blessed with three children. She lives in Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Myrna plants and harvests coconuts for sale. She has been in this business for 7 years. She earns Php 7,000 every month. Myrna is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase farm chemicals. In 2011, Myrna joined GDMPC. Myrna's future plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and a father of four children. Habib is the only provider of the family. 

Habib owns small grocery store, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Habib is requesting a sum of $2,400 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Uuganbaatar

texts.en:
Uuganbaatar is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Undraga, age 34, works in the local kindergarten as a nanny. His older son, Davaa, goes to the local school and his younger son, Angarag, goes to the local kindergarten.

Uuganbaatar has been providing transportation service to local customers since 1998. He transports hay and other forage during the warm season and charcoal and firewood during the cold season. 

His car has been broken for the last few months and his business has stopped because of that. He is now requesting 2,800,000 MNT to purchase a second-hand truck to enable him to provide his transportation service again in town. He is a hardworking, reliable and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck to provide his transportation service again.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 12. Her husband is a technician. 

She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more food for her restaurant. The profit will go towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Providance

texts.en: Providance is 37 years old,  married, and has six children. Her husband is a builder. She sells shoes, which she has been doing for five years. Providance is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more shoes to sell. The profits will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Channoern's Group

texts.en:
Channoern is a 34-year-old, married mother who lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She has five children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She is a housewife, while her husband provides for the family’s daily cost of living through work as a paid construction worker in the local area. Her husband has been in this business for ten years. The family's daily income is about US 6 per day.

This is the sixth loan for Channoern with VisionFund Cambodia. She fully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her children’s education. 

Now she is leading her group (Channoern's Group) to ask for a loan of KHR 160,000 each. As the leader, Channoern is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to provide a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a decent latrine.

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es:
Juana Jeannette de 38 años de edad, del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música, y en algunas ocasiones lee algunos libros de su interés personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recurso económico no pudo terminar sus estudios, ya que desde muy joven tiene que trabajar.
Gracias a sus espiritud y sus ganas de salir adelante, Juana de dedica a una pulpería, la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario y comestible del hogar, en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, aceite, jabón, arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, tiste. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de Juana es trabajar unas 14 horas diarias, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano aumentar sus ingresos. Juana agradece la ayuda que lo inversionistas kiva le brindan, a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juana Jeannette is 38 and lives in the department of León in western Nicaragua. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and read books that interest her. She did not complete her education and began working at a young age because she had limited resources. With enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead, Juana runs a store where she sells basic household products and foods such as coffee, shampoo, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and cacao beans at retail. She sells merchandise to her neighbors 14 hours a day from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. 

The purpose of this loan is to provide capital to stock her store so that she can increase her income. Juana thanks the Kiva lenders for their support for low-income people in developing countries such as Nicaragua because it provides them with the means for decent work.

loans.use: to buy items such as coffee, shampoo, oil, rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and cacao beans to stock her store.

loans.name: Zacharie

texts.en:
Zacharie is 34 years old. He is married and has two children. The oldest is 5 and the youngest is 1. His wife is a cleaner. 

He has been in business for 11 years. He wants a loan to buy cleaning materials for sale. The profit will go toward his savings.

loans.use: To buy more cleaning materials for sale.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is a 26-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has two young children, ages 5 and 1 year old.

She is engaged in  cooking snack foods like pancakes, fried banana and camote que (sweet potato) and selling them in neighboring towns. Her husband is a laborer who earns only a meager income that is not sufficient to meet the family's needs.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, Azucena would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her growing children.

loans.use: to  purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dorothy Joy

texts.en:
Dorothy Joy, age 27, is married and has three children. She lives in Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Dorothy Joy has been in her business of raising pigs/hogs for five years, and she gets an income of 10,500 PHP per month. 

Dorothy Joy became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeds.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 31 years old. She is married with one child who is one year old. Her husband is a soldier. She has been in business for nine years. She wants a loan to buy more passion fruit, eggplants and yellow bananas for sale. The profit will assist her in finishing her house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi, 30, is a person who has worked her entire life with much dedication in order to get ahead. She is married, but yet to have children. 

Her main source of income is selling women’s, children’s, and men’s clothes, from place to place and also at home. She sells good quality clothes at good prices, so her customers keep increasing, day after day. Her major challenge is stiff competition from colleagues selling the same, but hard work and good relationships with her customers have helped expand her business territory. 

It is for this reason, to expand the business and add more stock of clothes, so as to cope well against the colleagues' competition, that Hamisi has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan request of KES 10,000.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business and buy more stock.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa  is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (father and brother). She has business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for 10 years. She generates additional income through selling piped water.  

Afuwa is requesting a loan from MCDT-SACCO forf 800,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and transportation.  She hopes to become a wholesaler, to buy a delivery van for transportation, and to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and her family.  They have no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 36 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 17. Her husband is a pastor. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy more pants, sweaters, and skirts for sale. The profits from the business will assist her in building a house.

loans.use: to buy more pants, sweaters and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Dama Y Obrero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Damas y Obrero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; artesanía, transporte escolar, venta de miel, comida rápida, venta de ropa, productos de belleza, leña, bazar, peluquería, tejidos, confección de cortinas y manteles, costuras, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Maria Teresa, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un chaleco de color rojo, una chaqueta de color gris con franjas de color café claro, su pelo es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de kiosko, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a lunes desde las 9ºº horas hasta las 00ºº horas, tiene diarios, revistas, helado, dulces, bebidas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando como los diarios se los trae  una agencia directamente a su kiosko, las revistas las compra en el centro de Puerto Montt, y los helados, bebidas y confites en diferentes supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un porcentaje más de diarios, helados y confites.
Una de las metas de Maria Teresa es crecer y poder colocar otro local con otro rubro, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida. 
Maria Teresa vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 13 años e edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle lo mejor a su hijo en educación para que el dia de mañana tenga una profesión.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Ladies and Workers" and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields.  Among them are the following: Handicrafts, school transport, honey sales, fast food, clothing sales, beauty products, firewood, knick-knacks, hair-dressers, weaving, sewing drapes and tablecloths, sewing in general, and other services.  All of the members live in the city of Puerto Montt.  

Maria Teresa is one of the members of the Communal Bank.  In the photo she can be found standing in the first row in the first place looking from left to right, and dressed in a red colored vest and a grey jacket with brown clear fringes.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears it loose.  

She works in a kiosk and has been doing this for 9 years.  She comments that she works from Monday to Monday beginning at 9am and working until midnight.  She sells daily papers, magazines, ice cream, candies, and soft drinks.  

The products that she needs like the papers are brought directly to her kiosk by an agency.  The magazines she purchases in the market of Puerto Montt, along with the ice creams, drinks, and candies, which she buys at different supermarkets at a low cost.  That makes them convenient economically.  

With the loan she will buy one percent more of the newspapers, ice creams and candies.  

One of María Teresa's goals is to grow the business and be able to put up another kiosk in another zone, and in that way generate greater income in order to improve her quality of life. 

María Teresa lives together with her husband and a 13 year-old son.  Her dreams for the family are to give her son the best education so that in the future he will have a profession.  

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business.  With respect to the Communal Banking group that she forms a part of, she comments that in her group they have very good communication.  Also, the trainings have helped her learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the region of The Lakes (Los Lagos).  Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are the beautiful  green landscapes; It's beaches are very secluded; It is also known for its food, especially the fish and seafood, as well as for its handicrafts.  It is also the port of entry to the Island "Grande de Chiloé," which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy a percentage more of newspapers, ice creams and candies.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is from Balintawak, Aurora. He is 55 years old. Felix is married and has 5 children. Felix raises coconuts. During harvests, he produces copra and sells it. The coconut shells are used in charcoal making. Felix has been in his business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Felix joined GDMPC. Felix is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Yanjindulam

texts.en: Yanjindulam, 31, lives with her husband and son in a ger in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Surhiisaihan, 32, provides transportation services in town. Her son, Enhtogoldor, 13, goes to a local school. The borrower graduated from hairstylist school in 2004 and started working in hair salon for years. She has obtained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now opening her own hair salon in a rented place and needs 5,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to begin it. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to start her own hair salon.

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. She is widowed and has two children. 

Deogracia owns and operates a general store. She has engaged in her business for 15 years and earns PHP 6,000 per month. In 2008, Deogracia joined Kiva partner, Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). 

Deogracia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering of her general store.

loans.name: Jandra Maria

texts.es:
Jandra María de 28 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad de 8,2 años, originaria de la Paz Centro lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. La Paz Centro de caracteriza por sus comidas típicas como el quesillo y del tiste que se sirven en jícara, una bebida típica de la región. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser una maestra titulada.
Gracias  a sus ganas de superación de personas, tiene por actividad una venta de ropa y calzado, cosméticos, negocio que está ubicado en su casa de habitación, desde hace 11 años que desempeña dicha actividad. La cual la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. La rutina de Jandra es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: pantalones, cosméticos, blusas, short, faldas, vestidos, camisetas, ropa de cama,  pillamas, jugos de toallas ropa interior. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientelas, y en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos, Jandra María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jandra María is a 28-year old woman, married and mother of two minor children, aged 8 and 2. She is from La Paz Centro, located on the west side of the country and known for its traditional food, such as the "quesillo" (tortilla wrapped around pickled onions and cheese sauce) and the "tiste" (traditional drink made of corn and cocoa), which is served in "jícara" (pot made from the fruit jícara). 

Although she would have liked to be a qualified teacher, unfortunately she didn't have the financial resources to study at university. Thanks to her motivation for self-improvement, she owns a business, located in her house, where she sells clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has been working on this business for 11 years and enjoys her job very much, as it's been her way of life and that of her family. Jandra works 8 hours a day and offers products such as pants, cosmetics, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts, bed clothes, pajamas, towel sets and underwear. 

She plans to use the requested loan to invest in work capital and stock her business for the buying and selling of goods with an aim to keep her clients satisfied and to obtain more earnings in a not too distant future. Jandra María is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and to stock her business for the buying and selling of goods, such as pants, cosmetics, blouses, shorts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts, bed clothes, pajamas, towel sets and underwear.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
Flor de Campo es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 12 personas cada una de ellas con una actividad economica

María Blanca venta de abarrotes,
Alejandro venta de trastes de plástico,
Rosa venta de ropa,
Juana B. farmacia,
Tomasa venta de abarrotes,
Esteban venta de pan ,
Aurora venta de zapatos,
Paula jardineria,
Marisol venta de pan, 
Pedro Albañileria,
Juana J. carpinteria
Grisel venta de ropa.

Este grupo está ubicado en una comunidad donde las principales actividades económicas son el corte de la naranja y la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar. 

Esteban es otro de los integrantes del grupo Flor de Campo. El esta casado con Maria del Carmen y tiene un pequeño hijo.

Don Esteban platica que hace mas de 3 años decidió poner una panadería en su hogar ya que sabia este oficio y creando su propio negocio tendría la oportunidad de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
