El dice que su actividad inicia desde el medio día preparando la harina e ingredientes para hacer la masa del pan lo cual le toma tiempo cuando la masa esta lista inicia a hacer las figuras de los diferentes panes para posteriormente  meterlo al horno. Todo el proceso le toma la tarde justo a tiempo para tomar su canastas y salir a venderlo de casa en casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar mas insumos como son leña, harina, levadura, para la elaboración de su pan.
A futuro le gustaría poder contratar un par de vendedores para sus ganancias aumente y mas gente pruebe su pan.
Este grupo esta agradece a VisionFund por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Flor de Campo is the name of the communal bank that comprises the following 12 members who have different businesses: María Blanca sells groceries: Alejandro sells plastic recyclables; Rosa sells clothing; Juana B. runs a pharmacy; Tomasa sells groceries; Esteban sells bread; Aurora sells shoes; Paula sells plants; Marisol sells bread; Pedro is a bricklayer; Juana J. is a carpenter; and Grisel sells clothing. The bank is located in a community where the main business activities are growing oranges and sugar cane.

Esteban belongs to Flor de Campo, is married to Maria del Carmen, and has a young son. Three years ago, he set up a bakery in his house because he knew the profession and believed that having his own business would give him the chance to give his family a better life. At noon, he starts preparing the flour and other ingredients to make the bread dough. This allows the dough time to rise before he shapes it in different forms and puts it in the oven to bake. The process takes all afternoon and is finished in time for him to fill his baskets and go door-to-door selling the bread with friends and neighbors.

A loan from VisionFund will help him buy more supplies such as wood, flour, yeast, and sugar to make bread. He would like to hire two salespeople some day so that he can increase earnings and more people can sample his bread. The communal bank thanks VisionFund for its support.

loans.use: to buy wood, flour, yeast, and sugar.

loans.name: Qodirbi

texts.ru:
Кодирби жительница города Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Кодирби дружелюбная и очень хорошая женщина. Она человек с сильным характером, которая смогла заняться своим делом и открыть собственный магазин за короткое время.
Вот уже два года Кодирби занимается торговлей. Он открыла небольшой продуктовый магазин в городе. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот ей необходима финансовая поддержка. Кодирби берет кредит для покупки хлебобулочных изделий, конфет, сахара, колбасных изделий, а также для покупки приправ и сухофруктов. Кодирби не хочет терять клиентов из-за небольшого ассортимента продуктов.
texts.en:
Qodirbi is a resident of the city of Vahdat. She is 50 years old and married. She has three children. Qodirbi is a friendly and very good woman. She is a person with a strong character, which has helped her do her business and open her own store in a short time. Qodirbi has been doing sales here for two years already. She opened a small grocery store in the city. 

In order to increase the turnover she needs financial support. Qodirbi takes a loan for the purchase of baked goods, candy, sugar and meat products, as well as to buy spices and dried fruits. Qodirbi does not want to lose customers due to a small assortment of products.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, candy, sugar and meat products, as well as spices and dried fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new car, in order to continue his work

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36-year-old farmer in Kisii county, in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and three children. Only one child has started schooling. Charles has been in farming for over five years, producing milk, maize, beans, bananas, and tea which he sells at the local market in his area. He is employed as an additional source of income.

Charles is requesting a KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more produce and earn him extra income that will uplift his family's livelihood. He will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children. 

Charles aspires to have two more dairy cows in the next five years. Poor climatic changes and lack of adequate capital are his major challenges in farming. Charles is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for the support it is giving to its clients.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow for his farm.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Рустам берет повторный кредит в Хумо. Он целеустремленный человек, который профессионал своего дела. Рустам размещает животноводство и строительные работы. Он занимается строительными работами по найму в районе Султонобод. 
Рустам хочет увеличить поголовья крупнорогатого скота. Поэтому он берет кредит.
texts.en:
Rustam takes his second loan with MLO Humo. He is a purposeful man, who is professional in his work. Rustam has livestock and does construction work. He is engaged in construction work for hire in the Sultonobod region.

Rustam would like to increase the number of cattle, and therefore takes a loan.

loans.use: to purchase calves and a bull

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Исмоил житель Яванского района. Ему 35 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат, имеет шестерых детей. В семье он единственный кормилец. 
Исмоил уже 4 года как арендует магазин, где занимается куплей-продажей продуктов питания. Для того чтобы как-то улучшить условия жизни в семье и увеличить товарооборот в магазине он берет кредит.
texts.en:
Ismoil is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 35 years old, and has a large family. He is married and has six children. He is the only provider in the family. 

Ismoil has been renting a store for four years already, where he sells food products. He takes a loan in order to somewhat improve the family's living conditions and increase the store's turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products to increase his assortment

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. Her previous loan was a big help to her food stall. It also helped her in her everyday expenses and in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

Editha would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha dreams to have other businesses and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her food stall business.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
Doña Ángela es otro de los integrantes del grupo Las Palomas, ella cuanta con 51 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casadada con el señor Jorge con el cual tiene 2 hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria.

Doña Ángela platica que ella decidió iniciara a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta peor el dinero no rinde y quiere brindar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida. Doña Ángela desde hace un poco mas de 5 años realiza ventas de zapatos por catalogo con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, ella hace sus ventas saliendo por la tardes a mostrar sus catalogos a sus clientes para levantar pedidos los cuales surte posteriormente y entregra. 

Ella dice que hay temporadas cuando se vende mas que son en meses de desfiles o fiestas ya que la gente quiere estrenar, Lo que mas le gusta de sus actividad es que la realiza en su tiempo libre y no descuida sus labores del hogar.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de Zapatos para continuar realizando sus ventas. 

Ella quiere a futuro poder tener su negocio fijo en su hogar para no tener que caminar tanto y poder dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de ir a la universidad.

los demas integrantes de este grupo son :

Perfecta venta de pollo
José Luis venta de bisuteria
Heidi venta de topper(articulos para el hogar)
Deysi venta de topper(articulos para el hogar)
Guadalupe venta de ropa 
Consepcion venta de ropa
texts.en:
Ángela belongs to the communal bank Las Palomas. She is 51 and only finished elementary school. She is married to Jorge, and their two children attend elementary school. Ángela started her own business because her financial situation was worsening, she had little money, and she wished to provide her children with better circumstances. Five years ago, she began selling shoes through catalogs to her friends and neighbors. She goes out in the afternoon to show her customers catalog merchandise and take orders for later delivery.

The best selling seasons occur during parades and holidays, since the customers like to show off then. She likes that this business lets her work in her free time and also do her housework. She will use the loan to buy shoes to continue making sales. She would like to set up a store in her house one day so that she doesn't have to sell door-to-door. She also wants to give her children the chance to go to college.

The other members and their businesses are: Perfecta sells chicken; José Luis sells costume jewelry; Heidi sells household items; Deysi sells household items; Guadalupe sells clothing; Consepcion sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru:
Наимджону 24 года. Еще не женат, живет вместе с родителями в Шахритусском районе. У него высшее экономическое образование, но он не работает по профессии. 
Вот уже 3 года как Наимджон занимается животноводством, а в свободное время он помогает брату, у которого есть собственная столовая. У Наимджона имеются все необходимые условия для разведения скота. Наимджон берет кредит для закупа коров, телят и быка. За счет полученной прибыли он хочет сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Naimjon is 24 years old. He has not married yet, and lives together with his parents in the Shahrituz region. He has higher economical education, but he does not work in this area. 

Naimjon has been engaged in livestock breeding for three years already, and in his spare time he helps his brother, who has his own cafeteria. All the necessary conditions for livestock breeding are present at Naimjon's. Naimjon takes a loan for the purchase of cows, calves and bulls. He would like to repair his home based on the income received.

loans.use: to purchase a cows, calves and bulls

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Doña Faustina lleva aproximadamente 15 años de dedicarse al comercio. Ella vende de manera ambulante variedad de mercadería como cortinas, camera o ropa de cama, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, y sandalias, mediante pedidos. También los clientes llegan a buscarle producto a su casa. Para este negocio ha invertido ya varios prestamos de ODEF, el que solicita actualmente es el 14 ciclo y es por 12,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar mas ropa y sandalias para la venta. Quiere mantener productos en inventario para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta es hacer más clientes para seguir adelante con el negocio y aportar económicamente al núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Faustina, age 48, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Faustina has been a merchant for approximately 15 years.  She sells a variety of merchandise like curtains, bedding, clothing for women, men, and children, and sandals.  She sells by order in an itinerant manner.  She also has customers who come to her house seeking her products.

She has already invested several loans from ODEF in her business.  This is her 14th cycle, and the loan of for 12,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more clothes and sandals to sell.  She wants to keep products in inventory in order to increase sales and income.  Her goal is to get more customers in order to get ahead with the business and to contribute financially to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 28-year-old married man with a child living in Masindi, Uganda.He is a policeman and has been in service for five years .He was inspired into service by his love for peace and order despite the fact that it comes with a low salary that can hardly support his family. In order to increase his income he decided to venture into the produce business which has turned out to be very lucrative.

Morris intends to use the loan to buy produce like maize and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize and millet to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.ru:
Кристине родилась и живет в городе Капан,Сюникской области вместе с родителями пенсионерами. Кристине 40 лет  и она не замужем. Она окончила Капанский Политехнический институт и по профессии инженер металлург.  
Кристина проработала по своей специальности 6 лет но так как зарплата была небольшой она решила открыть свой собственный бизнес. 
С 2010 года Кристине открыла свою собственную кафетерию в Капане. Бизнес небольшой ,но как сказала Кристине:” прибыльный и хватает на жизнь”. В бизнесе ей помогают родители и друзья. У Кристине уже есть множество постоянных клиентов которые любят сидеть и проводить приятное время в кафе у Кристине. Она любит свой бизнес и гордиться теми достижениями, которых она достигла за такой маленький срок. 
Кристине решила расширить меню и добавить традиционных блюд; лагмаджо,шаурма и кебаб , что поможет ей разширить оборот бизнеса.
Кристине нужен кредит на сумму 1700$ для покупки печи для лагмаджо и обновить посуду в кафе.
texts.en:
Kristine was born and lives in the city of Kapan, in the Syunik region together with her parents, who are retired. Kristine is 40 years old and she is not married. She finished the Kapan Polytechnic Institute and is a metallurgical engineer by profession. Kristine worked in this area for six years, but as the salary was small she decided to start her own business. 

In 2010, Kristine opened her own cafeteria in Kapan. The business is small, but as Kristine says: "It is profitable and enough for living". Her parents and friends help her in the business. Kristine has many loyal customers who love to sit and have a good time at Kristine's cafe. She loves her business and is proud of the accomplishments she has made in such a short period of time. 

Kristine decided to broaden the menu and add traditional dishes; lahmajo, shawarma and kebab, which will help her increase the turnover of the business. Kristine needs a loan in the amount of 1,700 US dollars to purchase an oven for lahmajo and add tableware to the cafe.

loans.use: To buy a new oven for making "'lahmajo'' and to add tableware to the cafe

loans.name: Kulsun

texts.ru: Кулсун 54 года, замужем, С ними проживает младшая дочка Ажар. В качестве основного дохода с 1996 года Кулсунай занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 голов КРС, 15 голов МРС и 2 лошади.По мимио этого  Кулсун обрабатывает 5,13 га земли где ежегодно сажает картофель, зерновые культуры и многолетние,   прибыль от швейного бизнеса составляет 7,500 KGS в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсун обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) скота, что позволит увеличить сбор молока. Доходы от кредита Кулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.  В будущем планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Kulsun is 54 years old and married. Her youngest daughter Azhar lives with them. In search of a source of income, Kulsun has been engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1996. Thanks to Kulsun's persistent work, her farm currently has three heads of cattle, 15 sheep and goats and two horses. In addition to this, Kulsun processes 5.13 hectares of land where she plants potatoes and crops every year. The income from the business is 7,500 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulsun turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle, which will increase the collection of milk. Kulsun plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business. She plans to repair her house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
This is Lerma. Her previous loan was a big help in her dressmaking business. She was able to make more dresses as she expanded her business through the loan. It also helped a lot in her family's everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her dress making business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lerma dreams of having a big stall for her business and hopes to help her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is aged twenty-six and a farmer in Kisii in Kenya where he lives with his wife and one child who is schooling. He has been in farming for the past ten years producing maize, potatoes, beans and bananas which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will give him more milk produce and earn him extra income which will boost his family's income and help him to also pay for his child's schooling. He aspires to have three high-quality dairy cows in the next five years.

Poor markets, inadequate capital, and poor road networks are his major challenges in farming.

He is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for its continuous support to its clients.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa is single and has three children. She has received no formal education. Adjowa sells smoked fish and cassava in Kufur near Elmina and has done so for 20 years. She uses her income to support herself and her children. 

Adjowa will use the loan to purchase more fish and cassava for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjowa plans to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is married and lives in Cortes, Bohol. She is 59 years old and the mother of three grown children. She earns a living by selling snack foods like banana chips, rice cakes, pastries and camote (or sweet potatos). She has been in the food-vending business for 20 years, and is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000 to buy more ingredients, including flour, cooking oil and sugar, so that she can continue to serve her customers at a nearby school. Susana does not rely on her children for support and is working hard to earn a living and prepare for old age. In the future, her goal is to invest to other business in order to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for a food-vending business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a small village of Gardabani district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and sell milk. Besides, David has a horse. He brings wood from the forest using the horse and sells the wood locally. 

David is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle and to repair the shed. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will be fattening properly. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle and repair the shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Khujamiyor

texts.ru:
Хужамиёр - житель Шахритусского района. Ему 22 года. Живет он с родителями. Его родители работают в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Хужамиёр с 17 лет занимается животноводством, в течение 5 лет он хорошо усвоил этот вид деятельности. Хужамиёр просит кредит для закупа нескольких голов крупнорогатого скота. Он собирается закупить скот в дальнейшем для продажи. За счет полученной прибыли Хужамиёр планирует расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Khujamiyor is a resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents. His parents work at a dekhan farm. Khujamiyor has been engaged in livestock breeding since he was 17 years old, and in this 5-year period he has learned the business well. 

Khujamiyor requests a loan for the purchase of cattle. He has decided to purchase livestock to sell in the future. Khujamiyor plans to expand his business based on the income received.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and gobies

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan, aged 50, has been with HKL for five loans already and this loan will be her second time with Kiva organization. Kan has made a good repayment and she has become a VIP client for her honesty with HKL institute. After successfully paying her previous loan, Kan is resubmitting her request in order to obtain another financial support from lenders. She is hoping to have this loan amount so that she will be able to buy more stock of rice to keep nourishing her family as daily food through the year. The rice will cost 1,000 USD. 

With the remaining amount of 500 USD, Kan will reinvest in her recycling business, buying and selling recycled materials, an activity she and her husband have been in for over 10 years after their farming business. The impact she expects with the financing is that her sales will increase and thereby boost her income. Through her determination despite hardships, she hopes to gradually improve her business and help providing a better education to all of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to keep nourishing her family and to reinvest in her recycling business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelita dreams that her store will be bigger and hopes to have a simple and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Doña Mercy es una mujer emprendedora que a base de trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir sus sueños, Doña Mercy se define como una persona humilde, soñadora, solidaria y muy trabajadora, Mercy tiene 41 años, ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos con los cuales vive y son su adoración y razón de vivir, el negocio que ella tiene en una ferretería que inicio hace más 15 años en la ciudad de Ambato.
El crédito que la señora Mercy solicita a FODEMI es para seguir incrementando mercadería en la ferretería que tiene, la cual ha ido creciendo y se ha ido ganando mayor número de clientes los, y la inversión ayudara a Mercy a satisfacer la demanda existente en estos momentos.
El sueño que Mercy tiene es seguir trabajando en su ferretería y lograr tener otras sucursales para que trabajen sus familiares y darles con estos ingresos una buena educación universitaria a sus hijos, con la esperanza de que la ferretería la administren sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercy’s an enterprising woman who by means of work and effort has succeeded in building her dreams.  She defines herself as a humble, supportive, very hardworking woman who has dreams.  Mercy’s 41-years-old and a widow; she has two children she lives with and who she adores and her reason for living.  The business she has is a hardware store she started more than 15 years ago in the city of Ambato.

The loan Mercy’s asking FODEMI for is to continue adding stock merchandise to her hardware store which has been growing and has acquired a larger number of customers.  This investment will help Mercy meet current demand.

Mercy’s dream is to continue working in her hardware store and to eventually open branches for her family members to run and with income earned be able to provide her children with university education.  She hopes her children will manage the hardware store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio esta casado, tiene 61 años de edad, no tuvo   tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando,  se dedica a prestar su servicios de albañilería, construcción y remodelación de casa, inicio este trabajo con sus padres, hasta el momento lleva 35 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficio domésticos de casa.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de herramientas, como paleta, martillo, cortadora eléctrica, tenaza, planchas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener mas trabajadores a su cargo.
texts.en: Eleuterio, 61, is married.  He never had the opportunity of attending school.  He has six children three of which are in school.  He works providing bricklaying services, in construction and remodeling houses.  He started this work with his parents and to date has 35 years’ experience in this line of work.  He has his wife’s support; she works doing domestic chores.  He’s asking for a loan that he’ll use to buy tools like trowels, hammers, electric saws, pliers, plate compactors, etc.  In future, he hopes to hire more employees.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 45 years old from a small village of Gardabani district. She has a large family: husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income and her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, they have 50 hens. Gulnaz sells eggs and cheese locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Gulnaz requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will be fattening properly and this will increase the cheese production and thus sales. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gulnaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle

loans.name: Mselemani

texts.en:
Mselemani is forty-five years old and lives with her six children. All of the children are still in school and she is a widowed, hardworking lady. She makes her living selling clothing specifically for ladies -- shirts, pants, dresses and skirts, among others. She has had this business for several years, and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to maximize her earnings. 

The business is located in her house, and she also sells on the street. She is well known by people in the area. She has acquired a large clientele because everyone knows that everything she sells is of quality, at accessible prices, with incomparable service and within reach of her customers.

She is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and very determined. Day after day, she works her hardest to earn a better living and ensure successes for the future. In recent weeks, demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment. However, she doesn't have enough capital to back her up, which is why she is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy wholesale clothes. She has good payment references and an impeccable ethic.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothes.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a young entrepreneur from the town of Msambweni. She runs a hairdressing salon. She started her business three years ago and during this period has attracted a large number of clients due to the quality of her services.

Mwanaidi needs to add new beauty products to her salon in order to serve all her clients. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a dryer, hair relaxers, shampoo, creams, etc. This loan will allow Mwanaidi to increase her income and develop the business further.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer, hair relaxers, shampoo, creams, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fátima, es soltera no tiene hijos, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco   de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente atiende el Internet de su hermana mayor, además es socia con su hermana ya que venden productos por catálogos.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar cosméticos y productos de belleza y formar parte de la empresa de cosméticos pero esta vez como promotora independiente, así sus ingresos aumentaran.

El sueño  de Fátima es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer  una variedad de cosméticos y joyas.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Fátima’ single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.  She attended secondary school and currently manages her older sister’s Internet access service; she’s also a partner with her sister selling cosmetics via catalog.  The loan she needs is to buy cosmetics and beauty products to become part of the cosmetics firm as an independent consultant; her income will increase this way.  Fátima’s dream is to have a store where she can sell a variety of cosmetics and jewelry.  This is the first time she’s asked for credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de julio   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente cursa el primer año de contabilidad, en el turno de la noche y trabaja como tejedora en un taller de la urbe alteña ( o sea en la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una computadora e impresora para realizar los trabajos prácticos, del instituto donde asiste y estudia contabilidad.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Gladys is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.  She completed secondary education and is currently in the first year of Accounting in night school; she also works as a knitter in a workshop in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to buy a computer and a printer to do her assignments for the accounting courses she’s taking at an institute she attends.  This is the first time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer for her accounting courses.

loans.name: Josefinas Group

texts.es:
La señora Norma Elena tiene la edad de 43 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casado con el señor Rolando que se dedica al trabajo del Operador de autobuces, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y los otros dos pequeños estudian. Ella platica que hace más de 12 años inició su actividad con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con su amiga y vecinos de su comunidad poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo e inicio a salir a vender a otras comunidades como san Agustin, Tetela y Cosolapa. Ella a hecho cada dia mas clientes y hace algunos años inicia a vender tambien un poco de bisuteria (accesorios para dama) y dice que Gracias a Dios se ha vendido muy bien. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior, pantalones, calcetines, pulceras, aretes y bolsas de mano para posterior venta. Ella espera que cada dia su negocio cresca mas ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y en un futuro poco a poco construir un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos.

Doña Norma es integrante de un grupo llamado Josefinas el cual esta integrado por 10 mujeres, que viven en una comunidad donde las principales funtes de trabajo se encuentran el el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña tambien el la recoleccion de resinas de arbol de hule.

Las demas integrantes del grupo son:
Socorro panaderia
Maria Basilisa venta de antojitos
Adoradila venta de abarrotes
Martina venta de cosmeticos
Obdulia venta de ropa
Cistina venta de ropa
Jovita venta de pollo
Maclovia venta de zapatos
Justina venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
Norma Elena is 43 years old and she only studied until high-school. She is married to Rolando, who is a bus operator. They have 4 children, two of whom are already married, the other two are still studying.
She says she started her activity over 12 years ago in order to help her husband. She started by selling women and men's clothing door to door to neighbors in her community, along with a friend. Little by little her business grew and she started selling to other communities such as San Agustín, Tetela and Cosolapa. She increased the number of customers and a few years ago started selling costume jewelry for ladies, which she says has fortunately been selling very well.
She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, trousers, socks, bracelets, earrings and handbags to sell. She hopes her business will continue to increase day to day because she wishes to provide better quality of life for her children and, in the future, build a small establishment to sell her products.
Norma is part of a group called "Josefinas" consisting of 10 women living in a community where the main sources of jobs are found in the field of sowing and farming cane, as well as in the harvest of natural rubber gum.  

The other members of the group are:

Socorro, bakery
Mara Basilisa, sells traditional corn-based dishes
Adoradila, sells groceries
Martina, sells cosmetics 
Obdulia, sells clothing
Cistina, sells clothing
Jovita, sells chicken
Maclovia, sells shoes
Justina, sells groceries

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, trousers, socks, bracelets, earrings and handbags.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela. She received a previous loan of 30,000 PHP which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business. The profit that resulted from the loan helped her to pay her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to the additional capital with a glad and thankful heart.

Angela dreams of having a bigger stall for her business and hopes to have a strong and healthy body. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Therefore, he is interested in purchasing a  new rickshaw to grow his business. This will help him to increase his net income and savings.
His wife, Naseem, has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. 
With the profits, she will pay expenses of the household and the children's education. 
She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw to grow her husband’s business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 45-year-old, married woman from Loon, Bohol. She is a mother of seven children. The oldest child is 20, while the youngest is 8 years old. 

Elsa is engaged a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells commodities like noodles, sugar, beverages, condiments, and soaps. 

She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase rice in bulk kilos and provide additional capital for her sari-sari store. She works hard to meet her family's needs. Her husband is a driver and his income is not enough to support his growing children. In the future, Elsa would like to expand her business to support her family, at the same time, sending her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk kilos and provide additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 34 years old, married, and three children, two of whom attend school.  He is a farmer in Kisii County, which he has been doing for over eight years.  He produces bananas, maize, beans, and milk, which he sells locally at the market.

Stephen is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 62,400 KES, which he will use to buy and insure a dairy cow providing him with more milk. The cow will generate extra income that will uplift his family's livelihood. He will also use some of the money to pay school fees for his children.  Lack of enough capital and poor market are his major challenges in farming.  Stephen aspires to have five dairy cows in the next five years and become the leading milk supplier of milk in his area.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take  care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people, retail. She  has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She works seven days out of every week at the market.   Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal and thieves.  

Zulaika is aspiring of becoming of a wholesaler and also buying a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: Doña María tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Ella se ha dedicado a los labores del hogar pero por necesidad de ingresos hace 10 meses inicio su propia actividad de negocio. Vende ropa, cortinas, perfumes, cosméticos y útiles escolares. Su negocio es de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de ropa y cosméticos, para salir a vender y obtener los ingresos para su hogar. Tiene como meta continuar dándoles el estudio a sus hijos y arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 46, is a single mother.  She has 7 children.  She lives with them in a village that belongs to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s worked doing household chores but needing income started her own business ten months ago.  She sells clothes, curtains, perfume, cosmetics and school supplies.  She sells from place to place and also based on prior orders.  She will use the requested, 10,000 Lempira, loan to stock up on clothes and cosmetics to go out and sell and earn income for her home.  Her goal is to continue providing her children with schooling and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina, es Divorciada y tiene un hijo, vive en Anticrético, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 23 de Marzo  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudio hasta el nivel de Primaria y actualmente es comerciante de frazadas y edredones en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar más frazadas y edredones y de esta manera aumentar su capital y mejorar su nivel de vida.

El sueño de Guillermina es tener su propia tienda de frazadas y edredones.
Es la Tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Guillermina’s divorced and has a son.  She lives in the ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality in a house located in the city of El Alto’s 23 de Marzo zone.  She attended elementary school and is currently a blanket and comforter merchant in the city of El Alto.  She needs the loan to buy more blankets and comforters to increase capital and improve her standard of living.  Guillermina’s dream is to have her own blanket and comforter store.  This is the third time she’s requested credit from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy blankets and comforters.

loans.name: Begnazar

texts.ru: Бегназар житель Яванского района. Ему 49 лет. Он женат, отец шестерых детей. Трое его сыновей уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Бегназар с 2000 года занимается растениеводством. Он в дехканском хозяйстве по сезонно сеит овощи, пшеницу. За счет прибыли, полученной от своего хозяйства, он перестроил свой дом. Теперь он хотел бы сделать ремонт в доме. В данное время его сыновья не могут выслать деньги отцу, так как сейчас не сезон работы. Поэтому он обратился в организацию за кредитом для закупа семен зерна. За счет прибыли от сбора урожая он собирается осуществить свою мечту и сделать ремонт в своем перестроенном доме.
texts.en:
Begnazar is a resident of the Yavan region. He is 49 years old, married, and the father of six children. Three of his sons went to the Russian Federation to work. Begnazar has been engaged in crop production since year 2000. He sows vegetables and wheat seasonally at a dekhan farm. Based on the income he receives from his farm, he rebuilt his house. 

Now Begnazar would like to repair the house. Currently his sons cannot send him money, as there is no seasonal work now. Therefore he turned to our organization for a loan for the purchase of seed grains. Based on the income from the harvest, he has decided to realize his dream and repair his rebuilt house.

loans.use: to purchase seed grains

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en: Nunu is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She is from the village of Sartichala and lives with her husband, son and daughter. Nunu’s daughter works as a nurse locally, and her husband is an artisan. Both of these family members get small monthly salaries. The family is involved in the animal husbandry business and has a calf and a milk cow, whose milk is used in making cheese products that are sold at the local open market. Nunu is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase a cow with calf. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Nunu wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With the increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and improve the living conditions for the family. She is a very hard-working person with a rich experience in her work.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with calf in order to produce and sell more cheese.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is 38 years old. She runs a little food stall where she makes and sells fast food. She works hard to maintain the high quality of the food and services she offers, and because of this she has made her stall competitive among the nearby fast food stalls.
Mwanasiti has applied for this loan to increase the variety of her services. She plans to purchase more ingredients, such as flour, sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, etc. This will help Mwanasiti to develop her business by increasing sales and to earn more income. This business is vital for Mwanasiti to improve her household conditions. Her goal is to expand her stall to a hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients, such as flour, sugar, rice, vegetables, meat, etc., to increase the variety of the food she offers.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is 35 years old. She lives with her husband, who works as a casual employee, and with their four children, three of whom are attending school. Mwanahamisi is a mother who works very hard in her home and for the well-being of her family. For this reason she has her own business with which she can help her husband with all of the expenses. 

Mwanahamisi is involved in food vending, selling flat breads and dumplings. She is very conscientious and hard-working and would like to improve her sales. She is requesting a loan from Yehu so she can count on the money necessary to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ana tiene 5 años de dedicarse a vender productos alimenticios, tiene una pequeña pulpería y vende churros, dulces, azúcar, arroz, frijoles y tarjetas de saldo para celulares. Anteriormente vendía tortillas pero miro que resultaría más rentable una pulpería. El préstamo que esta solicitando es el tercero y es por 8,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más producto como carnes de res, de cerdo y pollo para incrementar las ventas. Su meta es lograr que la pulpería crezca y se mantenga bien surtida y también vender comidas como pollo frito con tajadas, es una comida que tiene bastante demanda en la zona.
texts.en: Ana, 39, is a single mother; she has two children and lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  She’s been selling food items for five years in a small grocery store; she sells snacks, candy, sugar, rice, beans and mobile phone cards.  She used to sell tortillas but realized a grocery store would be more profitable.  The loan she’s requesting is for 8,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy beef, pork and chicken to increase sales.  Her goal is to succeed in making the grocery store grow and to keep it well-stocked as well as to sell food like fried chicken with fried plantain which is a dish that’s in high demand in the zone.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
El señora Rosibel  reside en el casco urbano de Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la cabecera departamental de Estelí, ella reside desde hace mas de veinte años aproximadamente y esta felizmente casada.

Ella se desempeña como maestra en la escuela especial para niños con capacidades diferentes ubicada en el municipio de Condega desde hace unos 22 años de manera continua, donde labora de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am hasta la 1 pm y por la tarde planea su próxima clase, su esposo se desempeña como constructor en este mismo municipio y también desempeña su labor a diario

se presenta a las oficinas Ceprodel a solicitar de su financiamiento con este crédito ella podrá realizar las compras de algunos materiales de construcción tales como cemento y ladrillos y pagar la mano de obre de la mejora que le realizara a su casa de habitación, ya que sus ingresos mensuales no son suficiente como para poder realizar la inversión con esfuerzos propios y en el momento preciso. De esta manera ella piensa ir mejorando las condiciones físicas de su casa y darle un hogar más bonito y presentable a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel lives in the urban part of Condega, 35 km north of Estelí, the administrative center of the department. She has lived there for more than 20 years and is happily married.

She works as a teacher in a school for children with special needs located in the municipality of Condega. She has been working there for 22 years, and works from Monday to Friday from 7 a.m. to 1 p.m. In the afternoons, she plans her classes. Her husband works in construction in the same municipality and also works full-time.

She came to the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to be able to buy construction supplies such as cement and bricks, and to pay labor costs to be able to make improvements to her home. Her monthly income is not enough to be able to make this investment by her own means and at this precise moment. She hopes to be able to improve the physical condition of her house and to be able to offer her family a nicer and more presentable home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies like cement and bricks and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Osmán

texts.es: Don Osman tiene 48 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Osman desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura realizando trabajos de jornalero. Lleva aproximadamente 30 años de experiencia. El compra y vende vacas, cerdos y fruta de palma africana de donde sacan el aceite. Le ha ido muy bien con esta actividad. Ha invertido varios prestamos con ODEF, actualmente esta solicitando el quinto ciclo, con un préstamo de 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ganado, cerdos para vender y compra y venta de fruta de palma africana. Su mayor ingreso lo obtiene de la venta de ganado. Su sueño es seguir ayudando a sus hijos con el estudio y comprar una parcela más de tierra para construir su casa.
texts.en: Osman, 48, has six children and lives in a village belonging to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Since a very young age Osman has worked in agriculture as a day laborer.  He has about 30 years’ experience.  He buys and sells cows, pigs and the fruit of African palms that produce oil.  He’s done very well with this activity.  He’s invested several ODEF loans and he’s currently requesting his fifth cycle with a 20,000 Lempira loan he’ll use to buy cattle and pigs to buy and sell and also to buy and sell fruit from the African palm.  He earns his highest income from selling cattle.  His dream is to continue helping with his children’s schooling and to buy another parcel of land to build his house.

loans.use: to buy livestock and African palm fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Despite being the only breadwinner, Mwanasiti has been able to provide for her three children. Thanks to her efforts and her previous loan, all of her children are in school, and they are doing great. Mwanasiti is asking for another loan to renovate her business premises. She will use the loan proceeds to buy building materials. She is grateful for the support she received in the past and the new support she is receiving. Thanks for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her business premises by buying building materials.

loans.name: Timah

texts.en: Timah is 46 years old and married. She has been selling timber in her workshop for the past ten years. She is a very hardworking woman and well-known in the area. She is also engaged in an agricultural business. Thanks to these activities, she helps her family to progress in life. Her daily goal is to excel and to improve as a person. She is requesting a loan to buy more timber because she has received many orders. She is thankful for the opportunities that she has received to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
Jhon es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Mercedes de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel Secundario y actualmente es Comerciante de Cd´s y Dvd´s, en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar dos Maquinas para quemar sus Cd´s y Dvd´s y así tener más cantidad de los mismos para vender y un mayor ingreso para su persona y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida.

El sueño de Jhon  es tener su casita propia.

Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jhon’s single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Mercedes zone.  He completed secondary school and is currently a CD and DVD merchant in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.  He needs the loan to buy two CD/DVD burners to have more of them to sell and earn higher income for him in order to improve his standard of living.  Jhon’s dream is to have a house of his own.  This is the first time he requests credit from IMPRO and first from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy two CD/DVD burners.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan Jose, tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace tres años que se dedica a la venta de pan de toda clase, pan dulce, pan molde y pan simple. El lo distribuye mediante una bicicleta, surte pulperías y vende a personas particulares. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 4,000 lempiras para surtir de producto de pan y vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a comprar de contado el producto. Su meta es seguir trabajando con su negocio para poderles brindar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Juan José, 65, is married.  He lives with his wife and two children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  He’s been selling all kinds of bread-sweet, loaf and simple-for three years now.  He distributes it on his bicycle.   He supplies grocery stores and also sells to individuals.  He’s asked for a 4,000 Lempira loan to stock up on bread to sell.  This loan will help him pay cash for the product.  His goal is to continue working with his business to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread, bread trays and plain bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for construction work.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with three children; all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Betty has a business of sewing sweaters and school uniforms. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO   to buy more thread for sewing sweaters and rolls of clothing materials. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She also generates additional income through selling soft drinks like passion juice and mineral water.  

Betty works six days out of every week in a shop and sells at wholesale only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, increasing prices of thread and clothing materials, and defaulters. 

She aspires to acquire more machines for sewing sweaters, to build rental rooms where she can work from, and also to own a fully stocked sweater factory.   

Betty resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more thread and rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for eight years. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from working as a cook at the nearby school. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to help with transportation. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include   school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco es una persona luchadora, él tiene 67 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos pero solo uno depende de Francisco, vive en la ciudad de Ibarra, Francisco se define como una persona de carácter amable, trabajador. Alegre y emprendedor, Francisco se dedica hace más de 20 años a la venta de periódico en la ciudad de Ibarra, siendo un negocio que le a ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.
El crédito que Francisco solicita a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de periódicos, libros, revistas  ya que hoy tiene un local propio en el centro de la ciudad donde puede vender estos productos, esta inversión ayudara a Francisco a mejorar la atención a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos para su hogar.
Don Francisco sueña con lograr terminara su casa para vivir junto a su esposa y su hijo, y seguirle apoyando a su hijo en los estudios para que logre ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Francisco is a tenacious person who is married and is 67 years old.  He has 3 children, but only one is still a dependent.  Francisco lives in the city of Ibarra, and is known to be a friendly and hardworking person.  Cheerful and enterprising, Francisco has worked for more than 20 years selling newspapers in the city of Ibarra.  This business has helped him to support his family.

Francisco is requesting a loan from FODEMI to invest in the purchase of newspapers, books, and magazines, because he currently has his own newsstand in the center of the city where he can sell these products.  This investment will help Francisco to provide better service to his customers, and obtain more income for his household.

Francisco dreams of being able to finish his house, so that he can live there with his wife and son.  He also wants to continue to support his son with his education so that he can become a professional.

loans.use: to buy magazines, newspapers and books to sell

loans.name: Hayk

texts.ru:
Айку 52 года . Он примерно 25 лет живет и работает в селе Сюник с женой ,четырьмя сыновьями и дочкой. До этого Айк и его семья жили в Азербайджане, но во время Армяно- Азербайджанского конфликта он вынужден был переселится со своей семьей на родину.  Сначала Айку было тяжело заботится о семье. Как он признался – на исторической родине конечно легче , но не легко было все начать заново и в эти тяжелые времена найти работу и прокормить пятеро детей. Так как Айк окончил сельскохозяйственный техникум – он с женой начал заниматься  сельским  хозяйством в селе Сюник . В результате у семьи Айка уже есть собственный участок земли, где они выращивают виноград, овощи и фрукты. Он построил также маленькую теплицу где круглый год выращивает петрушку ,редиску, лук, киндзу, укроп, базилик, розмарин  и т.д.  С прибылью от его хозяйства Айк купил трактор , который  был ему необходим, а  также Айк трактор сдает в аренду своим односельчанам, что также приносит ему прибыль .  
Сегодня Айк и его семья счастливы и считают себя полноправными гражданами своей родины и стараются позабыть тот факт, что они бывшие беженцы.    
Для покупки семян, дизтоплива , навоза и одобрения для весеннего посева Айку нужен кредит на сумму 750$.
texts.en:
Hayk is 52 years old. He has lived and worked in the village of Syunik for around 25 years with his wife, sons and daughter. Before this, Hayk and his family lives in Azerbaijan, but during the conflict between Armenia and Azerbaijan he was forced to move back to his homeland with his family. At first, it was hard for Hayk to take care of his family. He admitted that it was easier to be in his homeland, of course, but it was not easy to start everything anew and in this difficult time also find work and feed the five children. 

When Hayk finished agricultural college, he and his wife started working with farming in the village of Syunik. As a result, Hayk's family now has their own piece of land, where they grow grapes, vegetables and fruit. He also built a small greenhouse where he grows parsley, radishes, onions, coriander, dill, basil, rosemary and similar all year round. Hayk used the income to buy a tractor, which was necessary to him, and further he rents out the tractor to his fellow villagers, which also gives him income. 

Currently Hayk and his family are happy and think of themselves as full citizens of their homeland and try to forget the fact that they used to be refugees. For the purchase of seeds, diesel, manure and approval for spring planting, Hayk needs a loan in the amount of 750 US dollars.

loans.use: To buy seeds, diesel fuel, manure, and approval for the spring planting

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Munhbat is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Hovd Province of Mongolia. His wife, Sarantuya, works at a local market as a saleswoman. His daughter, Amarzaya, age 13, and son, Amarbayasgalan, age 12, go to a local school. 

Munhbat has been running his small carpentry business since 2004. He has built a strong relationship with his customers and suppliers and he is well-known in town for his qualified products. 

Munhbat is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to run his carpentry business smoothly without sudden pause in order to save for his children's future education. 

Munhbat is a well-behaved, hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run his carpentry business smoothly without sudden pause in order to save for his children's future education.

loans.name: Florisa

texts.en:
Florisa is a 35-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has two young children. 

Florisa operates a sari-sari (variety) store and sells basic commodities like canned goods, soft drinks and noodles. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles, condiments and detergents. 

Florisa works hard to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to earn, and at the same time save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities like canned goods, noodles, condiments and detergents.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha lives in the rural area of Msambweni with her two adult children. She is a widowed mother who, despite the adversities she is passing through, has the motivation to get ahead. Asha's financial source is selling coconuts, a business she has been into for the past two years. She has applied for the loan to purchase more coconuts to sell. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This will raise her income, which she will use to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is 46 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 1 son and 2 daughters. Her husband is working in Kuwait. Ghazala herself owns a small boutique to contribute some amount to the family's income. Her boutique dresses are liked by everyone. 

Presently she is interested in purchasing a variety of clothes for her boutique. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business through this financing and make her life happy. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: To purchase variety of clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is married with one child and her only child goes to school. She also takes care of her old father. She has a business of selling cosmetics and has been in this business for three years, selling to all types of people, but on retail. 

Doreen has applied for a loan of  UGX 700,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT-SACCO) to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, hair conditioners, and vaselines. She works seven days a week in a shop she rents. Her major business challenges include seasonality, increasing prices of cosmetics, and transportation of boxes of cosmetics from Kampala City to her shop. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked cosmetics shop and also to start importing cosmetics from Mombasa. 

Doreen resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her child and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and hair conditioners for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 33-year-old man, married with two children. Asif is a market vendor and sells different utensils for the home, such as kettles, tableware, electric accessories and so on. He has four years of experience in selling these goods. His shop is located in the center of the local bazaar and it is the most visited place. Hence, people very often pass his shop and make purchases. 

His monthly income is about 90 AZN, but he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for 1,200 AZN and will use the loan to buy more products to cover his customers` demands. This will be his second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify the home products he sells.

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en:
Fikrat is a 45-year-old man on a pension. He is married with three children.  He breeds cattle and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers right from his home. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

He usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Meat selling brings about 120 AZN income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce.
 
This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. He applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase three baby calves.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a 50-year-old married man with two children.  He sells food products such as macaronis, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Elshan has 10 years of experience in this field, and considers himself a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products that he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 300 AZN. His son helps him to sell products in shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

Elshan would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. Therefore, he applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will use this loan to purchase and diversify his inventory.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She operates a retail store where she sells household items and vegetables, which has been doing for six years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Monicah is requesting her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy vegetables and household items to sell.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of household items and vegetables. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and household items to sell

loans.name: Juana Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 55 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas, alimento producido de forma artesanal con sus propias manos.

Tiene ocho años de trabajar en este negocio y lo aprendió de su mama desde muy joven, y quien también se dedica a esta labor.

Actualmente necesita un préstamo para hacer realidad su plan de inversión que es para comprar maíz y leña y tener materia prima disponible para la fabricación de este alimento.

Ella inicia su negocio para apoyar económicamente a su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Su estado civil es viuda y tiene dos hijos, a quienes apoya económicamente.
texts.en: Juana, 55, works making tortillas, a hand-made food produced in traditional way. She’s been in this business for 8 years having learned it when still very young from her mother who also works in this occupation.  She needs a loan at present to carry out her investment plan which is to buy corn and firewood to have raw materials on-hand to produce this food.  She started her business in order to support her home and improve her living conditions.  She’s a widow and has two children who she supports economically.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is a 47-year-old man, married with two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 15 years. During these years he gained enough skills and experience to run the business well. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and because fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and they are also used to make fresh punch. Imran usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is about 170 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Imran wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mirvari

texts.en:
Mirvari is 48 and married with two children. She has been breeding livestock from a very young age, thanks to her father, who taught her the best practices. She already has 10 years of experience. During these years Mirvari has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

She purchases cows and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals she resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  Fresh milk and yoghurt are also inevitable parts of Azerbaijan life and cuisine. 

This business requires a lot of physical strength, and Mirvari spends most of her time in the open air. Her husband helps her to feed the animals. Her monthly income is about 160 AZN, and Mirvari wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, she needs more capital to put into her business and cover the market costs.  For this purpose she applied for 1,100 AZN. She will use the loan to buy two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Deybis Jairo

texts.es:
Don Deybis es propietario de un taller de fabricación de colchones matrimonial y personal, oficio que aprende de su padre desde los dieciocho años.

Con la colaboración de su papa inicia su taller de producción y luego es comercializado en los mercados populares de Managua, capital de Nicaragua.

Tiene una perspectiva de crecimiento como microempresario por su habilidad de hacer negocios, sin embargo necesita de un financiamiento para comprar materia prima y atender la demanda de sus clientes.

Sus proyecciones es incrementar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda de su mercado.
Su estado civil es casado, y tiene un niño con su esposa
texts.en: Deybis owns a workshop that manufactures twin and double bedspreads, an occupation he learned from his father since the age of 18.  With his father’s collaboration, he started his workshop.  He sells what he makes in the popular markets in Managua, Capital of Nicaragua.  He’s poised to grow as a micro-businessman because of his skill for doing business but needs financing to buy raw materials and meet customer demand.  His intention is to increase sales and meet market demand.  He’s single and he and his wife have a little boy.

loans.use: to buy fabric and fabric remnants.

loans.name: Erdenemunh

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenemonh is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in a ger in Tosontsengel soum, Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Suriyaragchaa, runs her own business, providing tailoring and cobbler services at home. His two sons, Gonchigsuren, age 21, and Ser-Od, age 19, and his daughter, Budhand, age 17, are all university students. His youngest daughter, Otgonsuren, age 8, goes to a local primary school.

Erdenemonh has been running his furniture manufacturing business since 2001, on their plot of land and he made it business in 2009. He is well-known in town, for his qualified products. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan, to purchase inventory (wood and other materials) at a low price. He will use it to produce more wooden furniture. Both Erdenemonh and his wife are hard-working and diligent people, who say, "We are working hard to develop all our children into educated and well-behaved people."

loans.use: to purchase inventory (wood and other materials) at a low price, which he will use to make more wooden furniture to sell.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati, 36 years old and married with four children, lives with her family in Tiribe, Kenya, in their own home. She sells clothes for women, men and children. She makes and sells a variety of shirts, skirts and suits. She has done this work for many years, since she was trained as a tailor, and now has a lot of experience which helps her to increase her income. She buys clothing materials and makes them in her home at negotiable prices, depending on the customers' wishes. She has many regular clients who prefer buying from her because she always provides what they need, offers affordable prices, sells only high-quality items and provides excellent service.

She is an entrepreneurial woman who works very hard. She always fights for what she wants and never stops until she is successful. In the last few months, demand for her clothing has increased. It is for this reason that Wakati wants to expand the business, buy materials wholesale and employ someone to help her increase output. She has asked for a loan amounting 20,000 KES. She assures us that she will be able to repay the loan, and at the same time she is confident that she will be able to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married lady, aged 40 years old, and a mother of three children aged between 21 and 13 years old.  She buys and sells new clothing and has been in operation for a period of six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 16,000.  

Christine is servicing her sixth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD after she successfully paid the previous one. She intends to use this amount to purchase more new clothing for resale.  

The profits she earns will be used to pay the school fees of her children and repay the loan.  Christine’s dream is to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new clothing for sale.

loans.name: Edda

texts.en:
Edda has been very successful in her cereal-selling business, which she plans to expand further. She has many regular customers because of her caring nature. In addition, she was able to open a clothes-selling business, and she says that both businesses are doing well. Since the previous loan, her life has gradually improved.

Edda is requesting this loan from Yehu so that she will be able to buy more stock of cereals as well as bundles of clothes to sell. Thank you for supporting her!

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals as well as bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelzon José

texts.es:
Don Nelzon es propietario de un taller de muebles donde produce camas matrimoniales, roperos, entre otros productos de madera.

Su especialidad es la cama matrimonial, elaborada con calidad y excelente presentación, sus principales clientes son comerciantes que se encargan en venderlo en los mercados de Managua y otras ciudades importantes de Nicaragua.

Su demanda ha crecido por la calidad del producto, y requiere de capital de trabajo para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, que en estos últimos meses ha crecido.

Su trabajo anterior era en el sector de la construcción y posteriormente aprende el oficio de carpintero, especialidad que ha podido desarrollar por tener un gran talento artesanal.
texts.en: Nelzon owns a furniture manufacturing shop where he makes double beds and armoires, among other wood items.  His specialty is the double bed made with quality and excellent appearance.  His main customers are merchants who sell them in markets in Managua and other important Nicaraguan cities.  Demand for his product has increased and he needs working capital to fill pending orders which have grown in past months.  He used to work in construction and later learned carpentry, a specialty that he has been able to develop thanks to his great artisanal talent.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
