She opened her own grocery store three years ago where she sells basic family staple items like sugar, rice, bread, soft-drinks, snacks, meats, dairy products, cleaning supplies, etc.  She’s decided to request a new, 11,000 Lempira, loan from ODEF to stock the store with food items but most of it will be used to buy school supplies to take advantage of the school term.  Her plan is to stay in business to earn income that will make it possible for her to help pay for her children’s schooling and to use profits generated to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 49 years old, a widow, and a mother of four children aged 23, 17, 15 and eight. She operates a plastic recycling business that provides a monthly income of KES 45,000, and she has been in the business for the last year.

She has acquired a second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more raw materials to use in her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

She hopes to expand her business into a big plastic manufacturing plant in future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for plastic recycling

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 47 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with two children who are aged 17 and 14 years old.

He has a grocery store, which he has been running for the past 17 years. He has applied for his first loan to enable him to buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes for sale to add to his stock.

He hopes to buy a tractor in the near future.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet  is a 30-year-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be an independent, determined and humble man. 

He operates a motorcycle, which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located near a busy market, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy spare motorcycle parts. 

His business goal is to run a garage for motorcycle spare parts within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en: The desire to get ahead is one of the many goals Dometila has. She has operated a restaurant for several years which has enabled her to gain sales experience. She is asking for another loan through Yehu to renovate her business premises. She wants to buy iron sheets, assorted nails, timber, etc. Dometila is grateful for the loan she got and she hopes to expand her business after this investment due to increased number of clients.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, assorted nails, timber, etc

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old and from Ndunyu in Kenya. She is married with one child who is 13 years old and in class seven of Upper Primary School.

She has been a farmer for the past 30 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy farm inputs like maize seedlings,fertilizers and also pay school fees for her child.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future and educate her child well.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 36 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as humble and hard working . She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, food and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a big hotel within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Eliu De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Eliu un humilde señor de 36 años de edad, originario  del Sauce, Municipio de León, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 1 y 11 años respectivamente, actualmente solo uno está estudiando el otro todavía no tiene edad para estudiar, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, ayudándoles a otras personas  en un cafetín en donde adquirió experiencia y total dominio del negocio, fue allí que decidió emprender su otro negocio de cafetín, el cual lo comenzó con capital propio, a la edad  de 30 años,  sus expectativas es hacer ampliar  su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar toda la mercadería en general tales como shampo, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, pan, cremas, etc. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar  productos que aún no tiene en existencia como sillas, mesas, para ofrecerles mejor comodidad a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura del  local en donde tiene su negocio de cafetín, para darle una mejor presentación al negocio, con el propósito de hacer crecer  el negocio para que le genere mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Eliu is a humble, 36-year-old man from Sauce, León Municipality.  He’s married and father of two children who are 1 and 11 years old respectively.  Only one of them is currently in school, the other one isn’t old enough for school yet.  He’s a merchant in the grocery store business.  He started out in commerce helping others in a snack bar where he gained experience and total business savvy.  That was when he decided to start another snack bar business that he started with his own capital when he was 30-years-old.  His expectation is to expand the business to earn higher profits.

He’s asking for financing to buy all the general merchandise like shampoo, rice, sugar, beans, soap, bread, cream, etc. because he feels that this loan will help him buy products like tables and chairs he still does not have thus providing better comfort for his customers.  His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of the locale his snack bar is located in to give the business improved appearance aiming at making the business grow so that it will generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Aracelly De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Aracelly una humilde joven de 26 años de edad, originaria de León, soltera, con conocimientos académicos de secundaria,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica  a la venta de ropa y perfumes Avon desde hace 6 años. Inicio desde muy joven en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo ropa  a la edad de 20 años la cual con esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante su negocio, este ha sido su primer negocio, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su tía quien le ayuda a administrar su negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar una línea solo de ropa para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar más ropa  como blusas, faldas, vestidos, etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito  le ayudaría a crecer en inventario de su  ropa, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder agregar más productos que ofertar a sus clientes, sus metas próxima es poder cancelar este crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro
texts.en:
Aracelly, 26, is a humble, young woman from León.  She’s single and attended secondary school.  She’s a merchant by profession; she has been selling clothes and Avon perfume for six years.  She started out in commerce when still very young at the age of 20 selling clothes.  With much effort she’s succeeded in moving her business forward.  This has been her first business and her aunt helps her manage it.  Her expectation is to expand only one clothing line to satisfy customer needs.

She’s requesting financing to buy more clothes like blouses, skirts, dresses, etc. because she feels this loan will help her expand her clothing inventory aiming at increasing sales to earn higher profits.   Her future plan is to be able to add more products to offer her customers and her short-term goal is to be able to repay this loan to then request another one.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old woman. All her days she has not been to school. She is married with five children between the ages of 6 months and 17 years. They all live in the capital city (Monrovia) of Montserrado County. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past eight years, Rose has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita (juice drink), etc. in the local market. She spends eight hours on her business. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She really enjoys the movement of her customers.

Rose is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita, etc. to expand her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.
.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, Vita, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Fraciah

texts.en:
Fraciah is 37 years old and married with four children who are between two and 14 years old. 

Fraciah has a farming business that she has been running for the past 10 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a heifer to add to her stock of animals.

She hopes to own a piece of land in the near future and be able to educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is twenty nine years old. He is a married man with one child living in Kasese,Uganda. For the past three years he has been a teacher. He was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. He also has a brick making project to supplement his meager salary. His personal goal is to upgrade his studies while his business plan is to expand his brick project. Charles intends to use the loan to pay employees who are helping him in brick making.

loans.use: to pay employees who are helping him in making bricks.

loans.name: Mandalina

texts.en: Mandalina is a 59 year old married woman. She has 5 children ranging in age ranging from 10 to 36 years old. She describes herself as a faithful and caring woman . She operates a farm where she sells bananas (ripe and raw). She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a favorable business environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand the business. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy banana trees. Her business goal is to be the biggest supplier of bananas in her town  within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy banana trees for planting

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is taking out a new loan to expand his business. He has a many years of experience selling animals. Thanks to his efforts, his family has not lacked any basic necessities. With this new loan, he plans to buy more goats to sell. He has also been able to open a small business where he sells scrap metal. Both businesses are doing well. 

Thanks for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 31-year-old lady and is married to Nicholus, who is a clerk at a conservancy firm. She is a mother of two children aged five years old and six months old. Sylvia operates a bakery in Narok town and has been in the business for the last year earning a monthly income of KES 80,000.

She has acquired her first loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase an additional baking tray to expand her bread and cake business. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business as well as to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business into a large outlet.

loans.use: to purchase an additional baking tray

loans.name: Karen Johana

texts.es:
Doña Karen Johana,  reside en el municipio de Nindirí perteneciente al  departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 34 años, de oficio comerciante.

 Su núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposo, su  pequeña hija y ella. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa usada y una pequeña Pulpería, lo inicio  hace 2 años con su propio capital que provenían de unos ahorros que ella tenia, esto lo inicia con el propósito de colaborar con los ingresos del hogar y poder contar con un bienestar económico, la compras de su negocio de ropa las realiza en el mercado oriental de Managua, sus clientes son sus vecinos y transeúntes. 

 Actualmente  esta necesitando invertirle más a su negocio para la compra de pacas de ropa usada y bisutería y así  poder reabastecer su negocio, por lo que esta solicitando a ceprodel un financiamiento que le permita ofrecer variedad en su negocio, considera que esta ayuda le dará mejores condiciones de vida y le brindara una mejor educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Karen Johana lives in the municipality of Nindirí, part of the Masaya department. She is 34 years old and works as a vendor.

Her immediate family is comprised of her husband, her young daughter, and herself. 

Her business is selling used clothing, as well as running a small convenience store. She started it two years ago with her own money, which came from some savings that she had. She started the business with the hope of being able to contribute towards the household income and to be able to have financial security. She makes her clothing purchases at the market in Managua, and her customers are her neighbors and passers-by.

Currently she needs to invest more in her business to buy bundles of used clothing and jewelry to be able to stock up her business. This is why she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to enable her to offer more variety. She believes that this help will give her a better quality of life and will allow her to give her daughter a better education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Fran

texts.en:
Fran is 39 years old and has three children; twelve, seven and five years old with two of them attending school. Fran and his family live in northeast Albania, in a little community.

While he has been selling low-priced clothing for the past eighteen years in his community, he has also been selling in the neighboring villages by transporting those items with his own vehicle. “Sales of such items go smoothly here, because people are very poor and cannot afford buying better ones,” Fran said.

Recently, the vehicle that he uses for transportating his clothing broke down, and he needs to repair it. As the only financial provider for his family, he said that “it is impossible” to save this much money. Thus, Fran is applying for a loan through Kiva to repair the vehicle.

loans.use: To repair the transportation vehicle that he uses for his business

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro José de 55 años de edad, del municipio de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Pedro es un hombre trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor es que, y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamentos genéricos de forma ambulante, el cual consiste en vender acetaminofén, alkaD alkazelcer , migratil, ácido mefenamico, dorival, novalgina, amoxicilina. La rutina diaria de Pedro es trabajar unas 10 horas ofreciendo sus productos en diferentes lugares de su región a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de medicamento, para ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro no lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Pedro José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro José, 55, is from the municipality of León, a place located in the west of the country.  Pedro is a hardworking, responsible man with a desire for personal growth.  Thanks to his enterprising spirit and his drive to get ahead, his economic activity is selling generic medicine from place to place.  He sells acetaminophen, Alka-AD [anti-diarrheal], Alka-Seltzer, Migratil [migraine remedy], mefenamic acid [non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug], Dorival [brand of ibuprofen], Novalgina [a powerful analgesic and antipyretic], Amoxicillin [anti-bacterial].  Pedro’s daily routine is to work about 10 hours selling his products to regular and occasional customers in various places in his region.

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to stock his business buying and selling medicine to provide better customers service and in a not too distant future earn higher income.  Pedro José is grateful to Kiva investors for the help they give people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Hugo Edilberto

texts.es: Hugo Edilberto a sus 43 años de edad, casado con dos hijos de 8 y 9 años, ambos estudiantes de primaria, los cuales  están bajo su responsabilidad estudiando. Él es originario de Somotillo  lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de occidente del país. Hugo es una persona muy trabajadora, este negocio lo inicia por herencia porque su papa estudio y vendió medicina alternativa de esa manera el aprende el negocio lamentablemente el solo logra estudiar 3 años por falta de recursos económico en su hogar, actualmente tiene 22 años de trabajar en este negocio, compra y venta de medicina natural (alternativa) de manera ambulante y domiciliar, el realiza sus compras al contado y sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito en municipios del norte del país, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  en la compra de medicina natural como: suelda con suelda, limpia colon, cascara sagrada, linaza, lumba grasa, entre otros  y asi  brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Hugo Edilberto, 43, is married and has two children who are 8 and 9 years of age, both elementary school students who are in his care and attending school.  He’s from Somotillo, a place located in the northwest part of the country.  Hugo is a very hardworking person.  He started the business as an inheritance from his father.  He studied and sold alternative medicine and this is how he learned the business.  Unfortunately, he was only able to study for three years because of the lack of economic resources at home.  He’s currently been working in this business for 22 years.  He buys and sells natural (alternative) medicine from place to place and door-to-door.  He pays cash for his purchases and sells for cash and on credit in the municipalities in the north of the country.  The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital buying natural remedies like: Suelda con Suelda [cream], colon cleanser, sacred bark, flax and fat burner, among others to provide better customer service and improve his income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy alternative natural remedies.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a fishmonger who sells fresh fish in Enyinase near Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a businessman in the community. 

Abigail has been selling fresh fish for the past four years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband and child. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. 

Abigail hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her fish selling trade.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for sale.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Angostura Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuevo Horizonte de Angostura” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de pasteles, venta de ropa, venta de productos plásticos, venta de productos de belleza, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Karina, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste polera de color verde, su cabello es de color castaño claro y  lo usa largo y tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de confección, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja dia por medio, en su casa tiene un pequeño taller que lo ubica en el living de su casa, trabaja por pedidos de su clientela, a domicilio y a familiares.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para sus confecciones de manteles y cortinas, las compra en la cuidad de Santiago, ya que encuentra gran variedad de géneros y colores a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará géneros y una maquina overlock usada.
Una de las metas de Karina es hacer una pieza y ubicar su taller como corresponde y dejar su living despejado, y así atender a su clientela de manera más satisfactoria.
Karina vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 12, 8 un año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es creer con su negocio para genera mayores ingresos y darles un buen futuro escolar a sus hijos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizante de Angostura”. It is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who work in various fields, among which are: selling cakes, clothing sales, selling plastic products, selling beauty products, and services, among others. All of them live in the city of Rancagua.

Karina, a member of the communal bank, is in the photo standing in the second row and second from the right. She is wearing a green shirt; her hair is light brown and she wears it long and braided. 

She has worked in tailoring for 1 year. She says that she works during the day in her house. She has a small shop located in the living room of her house. She takes orders from her customers, relatives, and does deliveries.

She purchases the merchandise and supplies that she needs to make blankets and curtains in the city of Santiago, as she can find a wide variety of merchandise and colors at a low cost, and therefore it’s economically convenient.

With the loan, she will buy merchandise and a used Overlock sewing machine.

One of Karina’s goals is to build a room, relocate her shop as is fitting and clear out her living room, and therefore attend to her customers in a more satisfactory way.

Karina lives with her husband and three children ages 12, 8, and 1 years. Her dreams on a work level are to believe in her business in order to generate more income and give her children a better educational future. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. 

With respect to the communal bank group which she is a part of, she says that within it, there exists very good communication. On the other hand, the trainings have helped her to learn new sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. It’s a modern city that regulates the main agricultural production and exportation process for fruit and wine grapes in Chile. It is also a mining city, due to the fact that in its mountain range is found the largest subterranean mine in the world, “El Teniente,” with 4,500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a used Overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Peter is applying for a loan of 15,769 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, and he looks forward to establishing the farm further by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Mugambi

texts.en:
Mugambi lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Mugambi is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Dar Group

texts.en:
Gema, who is in her mid-30s, is single with two children. One of her children goes to school, and another one is still small. She has been running a retail shop selling drinks at wholesale price for six years now. She works from 8.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and can make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Gema's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock, pay school fees, and cover household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She now hopes for a loan to increase the stock of drinks for her shop. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Gema will share this loan with her loan group "DAR," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 5 years. He describes himself to be an honest man.

Harun operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within an urban area, and his primary customers are general people from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Harun will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy suits to sell. 

His business goal is to buy a sewing machine within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had expanded his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Harun does teaching, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy suits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 52-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 29 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a strategically placed business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs used to transport clothing materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a financially independent businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Mary does tailoring which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for sale in the market.

loans.name: David Rafael

texts.es:
David un  humilde joven con deseo de superación, de  24 años de edad, originario de la capital de  Managua, soltero, se dedica a estudiar en la universidad, su mama es padre y madre al mismo tiempo, la cual le ayuda en sus estudios. David está culminando su último quinto año de la carrera de Derecho, él nos cuenta que escogió esta carrera porque le gusta y además le da la oportunidad de salir adelante, ya que  le ayuda a tener un cargo más alto como profesional él trabaja dando su servicio de policía y de esta manera ayuda a la sociedad.
Él quiere utilizar el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación y poder graduarse de la carrera de Derecho. Ya que el estima que le ayudaría a obtener mejores cargos dentro de la institución, aunque él dice que quiere seguir estudiando después de graduarse otra carrera de psicología porque tiene mucha relación con su trabajo, que es uno de los planes a realizar y de esta manera poner en práctica  todos los conocimientos adquiridos en la universidad. David dice que este crédito le brindara la oportunidad de ver realizado uno de su más grande  sueño como es graduarse y poder salir adelante con su mama.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old.  He is a humble young man with a desire to succeed.  He is from the capital city of Managua, unmarried, and studies at the university.  His mother, who is both father and mother to him, helps him with his studies.  David is completing his fifth and final year of a law degree.  He tells us that he chose this degree because he enjoys it. In addition, it will give him the opportunity to get ahead because it will help him obtain a higher professional position.  He works on the police force and in this way, helps society.

He wishes to use the loan to pay for his courses and be able to graduate with a law degree.  He feels that this will help him obtain better positions within the institution.  He also says that after graduating, he wishes to continue studying for another degree in psychology because this closely relates to his work.  This is one of the goals he wants to achieve and in this way, be able to put all the knowledge he acquired in college into practice.  David says that this loan will give him the opportunity of realizing one of his greatest dreams, graduating and being able to get him and his mother ahead.

loans.use: to pay for his college degree courses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 37-year-old married man. He has two children aged 7 years and 9 years. He describes himself to be a social man. 

He operates a farm and a retail store where he sells tea and cereals. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a busy business environment, and his primary customers are local residents and cooperatives. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances for improving the businesses. 

He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy cereals to sell. His business goal is to own more retail cereal stores within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits generated from the business. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereals for selling.

loans.name: Koipasoi

texts.en:
Koipasoi is 36 years old and married with five children aged 14, 13, 11, 9 and 7 years old. She is a mixed farmer, and she has been in the business for the last five years. Her monthly income is 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She is currently servicing her fifth loan from KADET LTD of 70,000 KES to prepare the land and buy seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. 

Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has four children. She has received no formal education. She sells fresh fish in Enyinase near Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a poultry farmer. Aba uses her income to assist her husband and pay her children's school fees. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to develop her fish selling business to meet the needs of her community.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Barnaba,who is in his mid 30s in married with one child who goes to school.  He has been running a Retail shop for one and a half years now.  He works from 6.00 am to 4.30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Barnaba's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy the missing items in his shop, covered the household expenses and has paid back the loan successful. He wants a loan to start buying the shop products like soap bars,cartons of water, juice and biscuits instead of buying small quantities. This will make him sell more products than before and the stock of his shop will be full.  His dream is to one day be able to become an international business man.

Barnaba will share this loan with his loan group "Mavuno" with thirteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop products like soap bars, water, juice and biscuits in cartons instead of in small quantities

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señorita Noemí es una mujer de emprendimiento y llena de virtudes, ella se define como una mujer humilde, con valores éticos y muy trabajadora. Noemí es soltera y vive con sus padres a los cuales ama y ayuda en todo lo que puede, Noemí se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos ingresos que le ayudan a solventar su educación y ayudar a sus padres en lo que necesitan.
El crédito solicitado por Noemí a FODEMI se lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en la adecuación de los galpones que ya están maltratados, esta inversión ayudara a Noemí a mejorar sus ingresos y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
El sueño que Noemí tiene es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia, y lograr culminar sus estudios universitarios para así seguir ayudando a su familia desde otros trabajos
texts.en:
Noemí is an entrepreneurial woman, with many good qualities.  She considers herself a humble woman with ethical value and very hardworking.  Noemí is single and she lives with her parents whom she loves and helps in any way she can.  Noemí raises and sells chickens.  The income helps her pay for her education and help her parents with whatever they need.  

The loan that Noemí is requesting form FODEMI will be used to purchase chickens and to make repairs to her coops, as they are in bad shape.  This loan will help Noemí improve her income and thus improve her family's quality of life.  Noemi's dream is to continue working to help out her family, and to complete her university studies in order to be able to continue to help her family through other jobs.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise and sell and to make repairs to her chicken coops.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 57 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Manuel de 68 años y sus 7 queridos hijos de los cuales 5 ya son mayores de edad y solo dos dependen de ella para poder tener una buena educación y mejorar cada día su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Juana consiste en la venta de verduras y tubérculos, tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas que ha improvisado en su casa, ofrece a la venta diversas verduras y productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, huevos entre otros. Por fortuna, su puesto es muy surtido y la concurrencia de sus clientes produce la venta rápida de todo lo que ofrece. Trabaja a diario desde hace 4 años y lo hace sola pues su esposo se dedica a otras actividades.
Le gusta de su trabajo por que puede conversar con sus clientes cuando se acercan a comprarle algo, tiene muy buenos clientes a quienes ganó día a día con su buen trato, amplia sonrisa y sobre todo con las ofertas que siempre brinda, mas adelante espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus verduras y abarrotes con mayor comodidad. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, por ello está muy contenta por la oportunidad que le permiten para acceder a este financiamiento y continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado ella se compromete a seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, del mismo modo desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará más verduras y abarrotes como huevo, sal, aceite y plátanos ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 57 years old, is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband, Manuel, who is 68, and their 7 beloved children, of whom 5 are adults and only 2 depend on her to be able to have a good education and to improve their quality of life every day. Juana's work is selling vegetables. She has a little sales stand that she has improvised in her house. She offers various vegetables and basic products such as rice, oil, sugar, milk, and eggs, among other items. Fortunately, her stand is very well stocked, and the flow of her customers produces the rapid sale of everything that she offers. She has worked every day for four years, and she does it alone because her husband works in other activities.

She likes her work because she can converse with her customers when they come to buy something from her. She has very good customers, whose business she earns each day with her good treatment of them, her wide smile, and above all, the selection that she always offers. In the future she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell her vegetables and groceries with greater comfort. This is her 10th loan from MFP, and that's why she is very happy with the opportunity that allows her access to this financing and to continue with her goals. On her part, she promises to continue being a punctual member [of her communal bank] and to perform as she did with her previous loans. In the same way, she wants to continue working with the members of her communal bank, since they are all very friendly and united.

With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more vegetables and groceries such as eggs, salt, oil, and bananas, since she wants to better stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to stock her stand by buying  more vegetables and groceries, such as eggs, salt, oil, and bananas

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María  del Carmen, es del departamento de Masaya tiene 50 años de edad, de oficio comerciante y a la vez ama de casa, su núcleo familiar lo componen su esposo y ella.

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de productos útiles para el hogar y de uso personal,  con la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante, tal es el caso que llevan ya 5 años de estar en el mercado, la manera de cómo ofrecen el productos, entre los dos salen de casa en casa  dando a conocer los productos entre los que mencionan mochilas, pantalones, camisolines,  perfumería, termos, sombrías, abanicos eléctricos entre otros.

 Y de ahí es como van adquiriendo sus propios clientes, aparte que también la misma gente los va recomendando. Esto lo iniciaron con capital propio, sus productos los comercializan en los municipios de Diriomo, Masaya y Malacatoya, dos de estos municipios son  zonas aledañas que para que las personas puedan adquirir un producto tienen que viajar varias horas, por lo que  sus clientes son personas que ellos prospectan en el recorrido que  efectúan, las compras de sus productos la realizan en el mercado de Masaya.

 Doña María también cuenta con un pequeño negocio ubicada en su  casa de habitación vende refresco y platanitos elaborados por ella, que en los momentos que ella no sale a vender, ella misma es la que se encarga. 

Uno de sus sueños y el de su esposo es de engrandecer más su línea de clientes y expandir más su negocio.

Por esta época ella tiene más demanda por la temporada escolar, por lo que  se acerca a Ceprodel  para obtener un crédito y poder realizar las compra de mochilas, pantalones, camisolines,  perfumería para poder satisfacer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas
texts.en:
María del Carmen is from the department of Masaya.  She is 50 years old and is both a businesswoman and a homemaker.  She and her husband make up their nuclear family.

Her business involves the buying and selling of useful products for the home and items for personal use. With the help of her husband the business has made progress and they have had the business for 5 years.  The two of them go door to door to show their products, which include backpacks, pants, nightgowns, perfumes, thermoses, shades, electric fans, etc.  They acquire new customers this way, and are also recommended by others. 

They started their business with their own capital.  They sell their products in the Diriomo, Masaya, and Malacatoya municipalities. Two of these municipalities are in neighboring areas and people there would have to travel many hours to purchase a product.  For that reason their customers are people that they find along their route.  They purchase their products in the Masaya market. 

María also has a small business in her home where she sells soft drinks and snacks that she makes.  When she isn't out selling, she runs that business herself.  

She and her husband dream of increasing their customer base and growing their business. This is the season when they have more demand because school is in session.  They are asking Ceprodel for a loan to purchase backpacks, pants, nightgowns, and perfumes to meet their customers' needs and improve sales.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks, pants, nightgowns and perfumes.

loans.name: Lucia Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Hortencia es madre soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica a a la elaboración de tejidos de fajas para damas, inicio este negocio siendo trabajadora en otro negocio, hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de altaseda de varios colores, estos con el fin de incrementar su producción de tejido de fajas, y tener mas posibilidad de vender, ya que su anhelo es que su negocio pueda estar bien posicionando, y tener muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia Hortencia is a 19-year-old, single mother who has completed her six years of primary education. She has one child. Lucia makes a living weaving belts for women. She started this business while still working in another business, and so far she has six years of experience. 

Lucia is asking for this loan to help her buy silk thread in various colours which she will use to increase her production of woven belts and have more possibility to sell them. Her wish is that her business can be well-positioned and have a lot of clients.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave belts

loans.name: Sharmy Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora  Sharmy, reside en Catarina también conocido como  uno de los pueblos blancos, municipio del departamento de Masaya. Tiene la edad de 29 años, de oficio comerciante, su núcleo familiar lo componen su esposo, su pequeño hijo y ella.

 Sharmy inicio su negocio hace tres años  originalmente consistía en la venta de pan y fresquito,  al ver que le iba bien comenzó a llevar productos de artesanía y le dio buenos resultados, también tiene en su casa una pequeña venta de refrescos naturales. 

Sus compras las realiza en los municipios de Nandasmo y San Juan de oriente, que es  donde se elabora la artesanía. Para ofrecer sus productos ella viaja a los departamentos de león y Managua, del cual cuenta con  sus propios clientes fijos pertenecientes a los principales  mercados esas ciudades, y del cual les mantiene sus pedidos.

Ella manifiesta que le gusta ser una persona emprendedora ya que ha tenido siempre el deseo de ir prosperando en lo que ella se propone,  considera que lo ha logrado. 

 Busca la manera de mantener siempre sus clientes satisfechos, también poder tener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.

se presento a Ceprodel con el propósito de  solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerámica pequeña, cerámica grande, jarrones, jugueteras y comedor.
texts.en:
Sharmy lives in Catarina (which is also known as one of the Pueblos Blancos), a municipality in Masaya.  She is a 29-year-old business woman.  Her nuclear family includes her husband, her little boy and herself.  

Sharmy started her business three years ago.  Originally, she sold bread and chilled items, but then she saw the opportunity to make a good living from hand-crafted items.  So she started selling those, too, with good results.  She also has a small store in her home where she sells refreshments.

She buys her products from the municipalities of Nandasmo and San Juan de Oriente, which is where the the crafts are made.  To sell her products, she travels to the provinces of León y Managua, where she relies on her established customers in the principal markets of those cities.  

She says that she enjoys working as an entrepreneur, since she has always wanted to make it on her own.  She considers herself a success.  She is looking for a way to keep her customers happy and to also have a good life for her family.  She has requested a loan from Ceprodel in order to buy small and large ceramics, vases, toys and dishware.

loans.use: to buy small and large ceramics, vases, toys and pieces for dining.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 39 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Luis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con sus padres cuando los visita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de plantas y flores, adicionalmente brinda servicios de jardinería, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Luis se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos cuidados que les dedica a sus plantas.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una motobomba, una manguera y un equipo de riesgo, los cuales le servirán de mucho ya que estas herramientas son muy importantes para brindar sus servicios como jardinero, así pues Luis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un productor y distribuidor de plantas.
texts.en:
Luís is a man of 39. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources and the need to work to meet his expenses, Luís was not able to study for a professional career, but he very much would have like to do so. In his free time, he likes to listen to music, and sometimes he cooks a very delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" (a Peruvian stew made from meat, potatoes, peanuts, pasta and spices) to share with his parents when he visits them.

On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Luís works in his little business of selling plants and flowers. In addition, he offers gardening services. He works every day from the early hours of the morning, and he can do it for approximately 8 hours. Luís feels happy doing his work and believes that it is going well for him because of the good care that he gives to his plants.

Luís is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to complete the purchase of a water pump, a hose, and irrigation equipment, which will help him a lot, since these tools are very important for offering his services as a gardener. This way Luís will continue working and exerting himself to achieve his great dream of becoming a producer and distributor of plants.

loans.use: to buy a waterpump, a hose, and irrigation equipment

loans.name: Agustine

texts.en:
Agustine is a 34-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an honest and ambitious man. He operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a busy environment, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of shoes to sell with the high demand from the customers. He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy shoes to sell to customers to meet their high demand for the shoes. His business goal is to be a well-known supplier of shoes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his living standard. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell. He is a 26-year-old man who has one child, and he lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For seven years he has been trading in a local brew, known as "waragi" to the people in Dan's area. He faces problems in his business -- namely, inadequate capital to buy raw materials, such as bananas, and customers who buy on credit but do not pay him on time. He would like to move his business to a more permanent location and expand it to other, new markets. Dan is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew local brew to sell.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a 55-year-old, married woman. She has nine children, whose ages range from 12 to 33 years. She describes herself as an honest and determined woman in her work.

She operates a retail stall, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy, viable retail environment. Her primary customers are local residents and the general public.

She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bales of clothing to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler of second-hand clothes, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Eva Devotha

texts.en: Eva Devotha is 32 years old. She owns a canteen and has been running it for the past two years. She wants a loan, to buy more milk and food stuffs to use in the canteen. With the profits, she is planning to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more milk and foodstuffs to use in the canteen.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells smoked fish in Enyinase, near Elmina. She has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Efua has been selling smoked fish in her community for the past 10 years. She is responsible for earning income to help her husband with their family's living expenses.

She will use her loan to buy more fish to clean, smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to improve her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, which she will prepare and sell smoked.
